Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Gimper90
Reviews.Content: This hotel blew us away as it was everything we were looking for; balconies overlooking canals in a quiet area away from the tourist masses, but still close to everything. I was a bit put off by the name but booked 2 rooms here after reading other reviews. We absolutely loved our room, it had balconies with old Venetian doors, a nice modern bathroom with a tub and was very clean and had all the typical venetian decor. Down the hall from our room was an outdoor patio that felt very private. The staff here is genuine and gave us great recommendations when we asked. They also never seemed bothered by our requests for ice and corkscrews, etc. The location of the hotel couldn't be better as it's close to the Accademia bridge, so all the main sights are only a 15 minute walk. We took the 110 Euro private water taxi as we were splitting it with another couple and because we had a lot of bags with us. It dropped you off right in front of the hotel and was a nice way to arrive. It took about 35 minutes from Marco Polo Airport. We plan to stay here again when we return to incredible Venice, Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Room”
Reviews.Author: ManilaTourist
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 adults had a very satisfying stay at Hotel American Dnisen early April 2012. We stayed at their 2 bedroom suite which housed 2 couples each room and a folding bed for 2 in the living room/kitchen. We enjoyed the excellent wifi, the kitchen facilities which allowed us to cook and the washing machine in th suite which allowed us to wash our dirty clothes accumulated for the past 2 weeks. The rate is very reasonable considering our savings on food and laundry. The location is very good as it was very near the grocery and the accademia boat station as well as 20 minute walks to San Marco. The staff was very attentive and it was good that they had a good Filipino staff Ronaldo who made sure that we felt at home. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: K S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late March and absolutely loved this hotel! Great location since it is very close to the Accademia bridge and also in a great location because it is a quieter part of Venice and not so touristy/busy or noisy at night! Staff was very nice and helpful, breakfast was good and the room was very clean as well as the bathroom. I would absolutely go back here and recommend very highly. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Posizione perfetta, hotel molto buono”
Reviews.Author: Pappone78
Reviews.Content: Totally loved it. I'm not sure if I loved more the neighborhood (romantic, cut off the main tourist area, but with some of the best spost to see) or the hotel (right in front of a canal and with that local taste). A perfect clean and spacious 3-star room at international standards. It'd be overpriced almost everywhere in Italy, but not in Venice I guess

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little taste of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer W
Reviews.Content: I stayed In March 2012. This is a very nice hotel with a great location. It is easy to find and this is very important in Venice. It is also close to the ferry stop. My single room was tiny but well appointed, with a little balcony. Note that the single beds are narrow but very comfortable. I appreciated having tea and coffee facilities in the room. I had a problem with the kettle which was rectified on the spot. The bathroom was great, though I feel the bidet made it a bit squashed. Breakfast was fine. Ham, cheese, croissants, pastries, bread, fruit, cereals with fresh hot tea or coffee brought to your table as soon as you ordered it. There are some stairs but not many, and my bag was carried up to my room anyway. Everyone at the front desk was helpful and made helpful and appropriate restaurant suggestions. I enjoyed staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but it's worth the location”
Reviews.Author: 29Ice
Reviews.Content: First trip to Venice in 2011. We wanted to stay in a hotel on one of the canals within walking distance to the primary attractions. This hotel is perfect, in a quiet area just a few minutes walk from the Accademia Bridge on the Grand Canal. The rooms are a little dated, but it adds to the flavor of staying in this beautiful old city. Breakfast is simple and sufficient to get the day started, but not anything to write home about. Anyway, you will find plenty of good food out in the city at the many restaurants. Yes, it is definitely more expensive to stay in the city rather than on the mainland, but it is worth it if you want the experience of having the city to yourself in the early morning/later evening when the cruise ship passengers are gone. One piece of advice: if you arrive via the airport, do yourself a favor and take a water taxi to your hotel. It cost around 130 Euros, but you will understand this is a bargain when you imagine dragging your luggage up all the stairs and bridges between the water bus stop and your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the two bedroom apartment next door to the hotel, owned and operated by the Hotel American. It was a terrific experience. The apartment was large, clean and well-equipped. Beds were comfortable. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a wonderful area; far enough away from St. Marks to be quiet yet close enough to get anywhere you want to go quickly on foot. Very close to the Peggy Guggenheim Museum and lots of great restaurants. We would definitely recommend this hotel to friends. We look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable haven”
Reviews.Author: 4peopleonthego
Reviews.Content: A second stay at the Hotel American Dinesen for 3 nights in the attached apartments proved to be just as comfortable as the first stay. The apartments that have kitchen facilities and allow you to self cater are tidy and clean and the space and the privacy is a nice welcome. The strongest points about staying at the hotel are: the helpfulness of the staff, and the location as it is in a quiet neighbourhood, yet conveniently close to all attractions. Ovderall, a really pleasant well priced stay.

Reviews.Title: “Anthony J”
Reviews.Author: Anthony J
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this hotel - excellent situation (quiet by central) staff very helpful and friendly; rooms comfortable and clean - bathroom warm and tea making facilities!!

Reviews.Title: “A great location in Venice if you'd like a bit of peace & quiet.”
Reviews.Author: CORINNE C
Reviews.Content: Right around the corner from the Guggenheim and a fabulous restaurant la pescina (the swimming pool) we thoroughly encores the great staff especially Elizabetha. So helpful and generous with her time. Thanks for making the expense of experiencing Venice that little bit more bearable!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BigMamma35
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights as a family. Really enjoyed it. Staff are really helpful and friendly, always smiling. Rooms are clean and well-presented, Venetian-style without being excessive, and wi-fi is included as well as tea and coffee making facilities (standard in the UK but rare in Europe). Clean new bathroms. Breakfast is great and set us up well for the day (bread, cheese, ham, eggs, pastries, croissants, fresh fruit salad, yoghurt, cake, juices, tea/coffee/chocolate and cakes). Location is really nice - on a quiet canal close to Accademia/Zattere - very close to vaporetto stops and walking distance to San Marco - but not tourist central. There were plenty of local trattorias within 5-10 minutes walk. It wouldn't suit anyone who couldn't climb stairs but otherwise, thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great location but....”
Reviews.Author: Sarah d
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in early March 2012 at this hotel. We had upgraded to a corner room in the main building and had 3 little balconies on this quiet canal near the Accademia in the Dorsoduro area. But every morning you hear the trash being collected and the breakfast is pretty simple (one day the bread was so hard that I'm sure it was recycled from the previous day and not even a good espresso!). The staff were nice and helpful; but we didn't like the restaurant they recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and room”
Reviews.Author: ByronCh
Reviews.Content: Chose hotel from trip advisor after finding many others were not available. However, we weren't disappointed as the location was good as was the room and the breakfast and we will book it again next time we visit Venice

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Ana005
Reviews.Content: It is the first time I am staying in this area of Venezzia and the hotel's location is great. Large clean rooms with new bathrooms. Good breakfast and fast internet. No elevator but this should not create any issue. A bit difficult to find it the first time but some nice locals helped us out. Great value and great service. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hideaway in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CharleyBrown76
Reviews.Content: January is such a great month for a Venice trip if you catch the weather... or even if you don't. I've stayed in the American Dinesen before and it never disappoints. It is worth the extra for a canal facing room - really great value out of season. To wake up in the morning after a silent night to the sound of the first traffic on the small canal is quite something. Dorsoduro is a wonderful backwater itself in a busy city.. there is no shortage of places to eat at night though and nearly all offering local Venetian cooking. I recognise that I was there in a quiet month (some eating places are closed for the month of January) however the staff in the hotel are really attentive, welcoming and friendly. Breakfast was included in my Internet rate making my stay even better value. The usual Italian style breakfast is all you need to kick start the day and the wonderful pot of coffee is perfect. I love Venice - even though it can be colder than cold .. the first night I was there this trip a freezing fog came in off the sea creating a magical closed in end of the world feeling .. every breath was a near death experience ! The reviews of this hotel are excellent .. they are like that for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “nostalgic memories of this place”
Reviews.Author: loverhodeisland
Reviews.Content: stayed here last year on my honeymoon and everything from the breakfast to the room facing the canal was great. we landed here straight from the airport and the staff gave us a very warm welcome

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Wombat R
Reviews.Content: We took three long haul planes and two long haul trains to get here - and it was the perfect place to stay, rest and recouperate. Give my regards to Marco when you stay, as I know you will wantto stay. He was an excellent trip advisor and aide to have at the hotel desk. The ambience, the rooms, the facilities were all Venetian and added to our experience of this unique city. Breakfast couldn't have been better after very restful, quiet nights on very comfortable beds. We stayed in a room overlooking the canal. But ... be careful, you will want to live here forever..Accademia is one of the perfect places to stay in Venice, it is a little more secluded, the hotel is the shortest of walks from the vaporetto and you can go to Le petite gallery de Guuggenheim on the way to brunch/lunch. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Always an excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: D_from_Portland
Reviews.Content: It was our fourth visit to the Hotel American, and it won't be our last. Everything was terrific - especially the staff. The location is close to everything but in a quiet area. We recommend this hotel to our friends as well, who have had the same excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Two-bedroom apartment was a great value”
Reviews.Author: basho88
Reviews.Content: My wife, cousin, and I had just one night in Venice after disembarking from a cruise in late November 2011. We booked a two-bedroom apartment with kitchen and living room. It was perfect for our needs. --Space. The apartment would be good for familes or folks traveling together. However, our apartment did not really have any view to speak of. This was what we expected because we were not looking for a room with a view--just a place to stay for the night. --Clean. It was very clean. --Location. We loved how this hotel is on its own small canal as we find the smaller canals much more charming than the big waterways in Venice. One can easily walk from here to St. Marks, the Salute, and the Accademia. --Service. The hotel's staff could not have been more accommodating. We arrived here after weeks of traveling and with a fair amount of luggage between the three of us. We had planned from the start to take a water taxi to this hotel from where our ship arrived. I have to say this was a fun way to arrive at the hotel. You pull up by boat at the hotel's private pier. It was very fun. But water taxis are very expensive, as you may have heard. For many travelers with less luggage this hotel is accessible via the Vapparetto. And then, as with most Venice hotels, you would need to be able to walk up and over little bridges to get to the hotel. We look forward to returning here in the future. A charming place to stay that is well run and in walking distance to key sites in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Boycee_10
Reviews.Content: Read many reviews before choosing this hotel. Good value in low season. We stayed in Room 202 and were thrilled with it. Three balconies - two facing the small canal and one facing the grand canal! It was really lovely. The Hotel had hung Christmas lights from all the balconies so it looked magical at night. The bathroom was small but clean and nicely fitted. Individually controlled heating in the rooms worked well. Beds were comfy and the room was very quiet. TV had UK and US channels, and rooms had free Wi-Fi - much appreciated by 16 year old son! We met several members of staff and they were all friendly and helpful. Suggestions of places to eat were good. The location was also great - two minutes from the vaparetto stop where the No 1 stops every 10 mins. You could be at St.Marks Square in 5-10 mins, so we did this on our last morning, before breakfast, so we could see it at sunrise. All in all we were very pleased with our choice and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location and great value during low season”
Reviews.Author: maraberto
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel. It's location is key: away from the crowds and yet with easy access to everything. Even though we were in Venice during a very quiet time, it was great to get away from the noise and mini crowds and enter a more serene and equally beautiful part of Venice. The people working there are very kind and helpful. The rooms are very good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay in October”
Reviews.Author: rlkthe2nd
Reviews.Content: This is the best location to stay in. It's convenient to everything, including a must-see: the former customs house that now houses an art museum called Punta della Dogana where you also have a wonderful view of the canal. The hotel staff was very friendly and helped out tremendously with directions and restaurant recommendations. We particularly enjoyed dinner at the nearby Locanda Montin. The hotel room was spotless and the bed very comfortable. Be aware that there are no elevators. The breakfast was OK, but the automated coffee machine produced terrible cappucino. Tip - - you just need to ask the waitstaff to bring you a "real" cappucino. Also, it was nice to have a computer to check emails, etc. for no charge in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: MarcusLondon
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel partly because its location and also because of previous good TA reviews, though I was aware of it from 15 years ago, when I stayed nearby. Both the hotel and staff thoroughly deserve the repeated praise: I really enjoyed my short stay and having visited Venice previously, I think its my favourite hotel to date. I booked online from London with ease: my amended request (for a non-smoking room) was acknowledged speedily and on arrival check-in was courteous, speedy and very efficient - I was even greeted by name. The hotel itself is very attractive: bright and well-furnished, without being too OTT: a set of framed contemporary monochrome photos (of Venice, naturally) sticks in my memory. It has no elevator but the stairs are wide and shallow, so getting to my room was no real effort (and staff were on hand to assist with luggage) My first floor single room (No. 103) was compact without feeling cramped. It was spotlessly clean and well equipped: tea/coffee making facilities were very welcome after a long day's walking; the bed was very comfortable and the shower room/toilet very modern, with quality fixtures. NB: The window faces the adjacent building (also part of the hotel) so there is only a narrow view of the canal. I caught a glimpse of a double room with canal view, whilst the maid was making it up, and this looked very nice indeed. Maybe next time? Breakfast, which is served in a bright, ground floor lounge, was very good with a wide range of options: juices; fruit; cereal; rolls & pastries; meats & cheeses plus fresh tea, coffee or hot chocolate on request. The three staff there were all very pleasant and attentive, as were all the hotel staff I encountered - even the night porter. Marco on reception speaks excellent English and was very helpful - he even lent me a mouse to get my laptop working! His colleague, a blonde lady, suggested some restaurant options, marking directions/locations on a map. On my second night I noticed the desk lamp had a cracked plug and advised Marco on my way out: it was replaced/repaired by the time I returned from dinner. Another member of staff, despite his less proficient English, kindly attempted to explain how the remote control for the TV works. He failed, but I was not in Venice to watch TV, so it was not really a problem and I had the excellent, free Wifi connection to keep me occupied There's also free internet access from a PC in the lobby, if required. I would recommend the hotel and gladly stay there again. It was good value and, in particular, the quality of service and friendliness of the staff, which I have sometimes found a little lacking in Venice, made me feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jlhelbach
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in a quite side canal off of the Grand Canal. Second floor room with a balcony was very spacious, clean and the bed was better than most in Italy. We awoke in the morning, opened the shuttered balcony doors and enjoyed the canal life of Venice. After five hectic days in Rome the American Dinesen was a peaceful oasis in a beautiful city. The staff was very helpful and always available with suggestions on how best to spend our time. Breakfast was typical Italian hotel fare but available until 10:30 am. Free internet and English TV channels were also a big plus. Be sure to visit the out lying islands. Location, service and value will make a return visit an easy decision. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Karlithus
Reviews.Content: This hotel really pleased us. We asked for a superior double room with a balcony, and it was really great to wake up and watch the canal. Everyone at the hotel was really nice, giving us all the informations we asked for. I don't give it 5 stars only because of the breakfast. Although there were many options, sometimes all tables were occupied and onde oncuppied, took some time to be clean up. But it was a really great stay! We stayed there 3 days and we felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, clean rooms, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Errie1013
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel American for the Venice leg of our two-week honeymoon in Italy based primarily on TripAdvisor reviews. We stayed three nights in mid-September, and we have zero complaints. Our room was spotlessly clean, the area was safe and quiet, the breakfast was good, the wifi worked properly, and the hotel staff went out of their way to accommodate our needs. The concierges patiently and cheerfully endured endless questions, drawing maps and offering restaurant suggestions to help us out. In the sleepier Dorsoduro district but within easy walking distance to major tourist attractions, Hotel American was an excellent choice for the beginning of our Italian adventure. If we're ever blessed enough to return to Venice, we won't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly, good location”
Reviews.Author: frolpi
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were consistently friendly and helpful. When asked, they happily made restaurant bookings for us, gave information about travel, etc. English and French are fluently spoken, maybe more... The room was big and comfortable, with long shuttered windows, decorated in Venetian style, with warm-coloured patterned fabric walls, and elegant curtains. We were visiting in late Autumn, with cold fog outside, and the room was warm without being stuffy. Heating/aircon controls are in the room, but we didn't really need to adjust them. The minibar is not locked, so it is possible to use for some additional items from very good nearby supermarket, if required. Free wifi, with good signal strength. English hotels take note... The bathroom facilities are good, with a very useful wall-mounted radiator and retractable washing line. This hotel is not snobby about guests needing to wash and dry small clothing items. Overall an excellent experience. Effort is being made unpretentiously on the things that make it more comfortable. We would definitely use this hotel again. The Dorsoduro location is also very good. Quick access to the tourist hotspots via Accademia bridge, without being unbearably crowded. Also a short walk from the St Margarita piazza which has a more bohemian feel, with later bars and restaurants than the nearby residential areas which close early (8.45/9.00). Also near Zattere, with it's beautiful sunset views and waterside kiosk for romantic outdoor cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Magic!”
Reviews.Author: amjschwartz
Reviews.Content: Pure Magic! We began our 2 week romantic trip to Italy in Venice and couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. Our corner room on the first floor had beautiful views of the canal, with a view of the Grand Canal off one window. Beautiful! The room was spotless, with a fully equipped bathroom. Breakfast offering was suitable, but we really weren't there for a big breakfast anyway. The hotel lobby was lovely. The service was outstanding! Coming from NYC, we were delighted with the outstanding service, value, room and, of course, location, location, location. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but...”
Reviews.Author: brucemac322
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel American Dinesen for 6 nights, 11/5/11-11/10/11. First, the good news. The people at the desk were friendly and fairly helpful, but they seemed a bit bored with the whole customer service routine. The location is terrific, within easy walking distance of just about everything, including many excellent restaurants and shops. The room was fine, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was small but adequate. We asked for an upgrade to a canal-view room, but no luck. Now, the not so good news. It can be noisy. We awakened nearly every morning way too early to what sounded like someone throwing bricks into a wheelbarrow. But you couldn't close the windows because the room was warm, and the air conditioning was not available. And with the windows were open, the mosquitoes came in. And finally, the breakfast leaves a lot to be desired. There's enough to eat, and they have a multi-choice automatic coffee maker, but jn the end it's a pretty basic cafeteria-style experience. The problem is, a simple breakfast at a nearby cafe will run you close to $40 or so. If we came back to Venice, we'd look for a place with a few more amenities in the same general neighborhood. All in all: it was okay, but not the kind of place you rave about.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, Canal View Balcony!”
Reviews.Author: jimmythec1
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at this hotel. We were in room #101 with balcony overlooking a smaller canal 1/2 block from Grand Canal. 2 minute walk to Accadamia Bridge. The room was OK size for Italy, nicely decorated with mini-bar and safe. Small balcony (on 2 sides) with room for 2 chairs if you turn sideways...but still spent several nights sitting outside enjoying wine, watching the activity on the canal and sidewalks. Nice breakfast (our best in Italy), salami, meats,cheeses, hardboiled eggs, GOOD croissants, yogurt, etc. Coffee machine allowed you to make cappacino, espress, American coffee, etc. which was nice. Also, FREE internet computer in lobby. Would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynd50
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. I was pleased to get a room with a little balcony and a side view of the canal as normally single rooms are located out of the way with no views. The room was beautifully furnished and clean. I chose it for the location and that was perfect. I liked to sit in the little square near the Grand Canal and ate at the restaurant next to the hotel. It is also only about 5 minutes walk from the Zattere Alilaguna stop so easy to get to from the airport if you don't want to go to the expense of a water taxi. Everyone in the hotel was very helpful and friendly which I really appreciated as I was holidaying on my own. I loved Venice and there is still so much to see that I am hoping to return some day and would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “FAVOLOSO!”
Reviews.Author: bes0811
Reviews.Content: We recently planned a family and friends vacation to Venice. My friend and I stayed at the FAVOLOSO Hotel American Dinesen while the parents stayed in another hotel in Dorsoduro. The neighborhood is much quieter than the San Marco district but is easily accessible. My sister stayed near the square and was flooded - no such problems for us. Upon arrival, we were greated by a fantastic front desk staff...and my personal favorite - PABLO - a 4-year black lab :-) The entire staff were amazing - I can't say how much I appreciated the personal service and help especially with our luggage after spending a few days in the Cinque Terre carrying our bags up tons of steps. We were immediately given great recommendations on resturants, key sites to visit, and they offered to book reservations and water taxis for us. We specifically requested a canal view - and it was well worth it. We had a room on the first floor and by any standard it was HUGE and the bathroom was the biggest I've seen in Italy. Everything was well-appointed and lovely. I highly recommend the Hotel American Dinesen for their hospitality, service, and value. I will definitely plan on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Least Favorite”
Reviews.Author: michelektel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at two hotels during our stay in Venice, and Hotel American was our least favorite. We loved staying in the Dorsoduro neighborhood, but our experience at Caâ€™Pisani Hotel was much better, for same or lesser rate. I was especially disappointed when, on our first night, we asked Hotel American reception to help us confirm a restaurant reservation -- a service we had relied on during our travels. I was shocked when the man behind the desk wrote the number down and told us to call ourselves. After that "do it yourself" service we didn't expect them to help out with recommendations or booking. Location is great, but if you want larger & more contemporary rooms, a much better breakfast and friendly helpful service, try Ca'Pisani Hotel right around the corner! I really regretted that we switched to Hotel American Dineson for the last few days of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great for a family of 4”
Reviews.Author: BorjesFamily
Reviews.Content: Like many other reviewers said, this hotel is on a nice canal, in a quieter part of town but a nice walk to San Marco. Very close to a water bus stop. The room was huge for our family and one of the complaints we have is that the bathroom was TINY. It was almost impossible to give our 4 year old a shower or bath. Plus, our room had no view so the room is very dark even during the day. The staff is nice and the breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment attached to the Hotel Ameican-Dinesen”
Reviews.Author: GailSmith2190
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the apartments next to the hotel. Venice was hot when we first got there; I had heard about all the air conditioners that didn't work in various reviews, but the one in our apartment was very efficient. The unit was clean, moderately well appointed, and served our needs. We had a washing machine that didn't work very well, but with some help it cleaned our clothes. A bonus was that the internet connection was fast and worked inside our apartment. Hotel staff was very helpful. It was nice to have someone that could make reservations for you, recommend restaurants, and generally help out Americans who had little knowledge of Italian. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the madding crowds”
Reviews.Author: Birchdene
Reviews.Content: Great location just far enough away from all the crowds but still within easy walking distance of most of venice. Very clean and well decorated room and bathroom. Only complaint would be the bed was very hard!.

Reviews.Title: “Probably Unbeatable, for the Price.”
Reviews.Author: FOIA_Chief
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a very nice hotel in Venice that is near â€œthe actionâ€�, but not right in the middle of it, this may be your best choice. The Hotel American Dinesen is located just steps from the Accademia bridge and about a fifteen minute walk from either the Rialto or St. Markâ€™s. It is extremely convenient to reach by either the Number 1 or 2 vaporetto. By vaporetto, the trip is less than a half-hour from the railroad station and much cheaper than a water taxi. There is one bridge, with a dozen steps, to cross from the Accademia stop but if you let the hotel know youâ€™re at the bridge, Iâ€™m sure theyâ€™d send a bellman down to help with large bags. He helped us over the bridge when we left. We opted for a superior room and found the size of our room to be ample, even by American standards. By European standards it was quite large. The view from our window was spectacular. A canal directly in front and the Grand Canal less than a hundred yards to the right. Even facing a secondary canal, the room was very quiet. The modern windows do an excellent job of reducing noise and with the exterior shutters closed it was virtually silent. The room had a Murano chandelier and exposed beams, although Iâ€™m not sure whether the beams were really for support or merely decoration. Although it was early October when we stayed, the temperature was still rather warm but the roomâ€™s air conditioning was both quiet and effective. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Breakfast was standard for solid, but not luxury, Italian hotels. The only (minor) drawback to the hotel is that there is no elevator. Our room was on the 3rdh floor (by European numbering, which is the 4th floor by American reckoning) and the last flight of stairs was a killer at the end of the day. There are superior rooms on the lower floors and when we return we would ask for a 2nd floor room. This is not the hotelâ€™s fault. They have requested permission to install an elevator, but in Venice this is difficult to obtain due to historic preservation regulations. Of course, the bellman takes care of carrying your luggage up to your room. There are more luxurious hotels in Venice, but I think it rates a 5 when you take in to account the price along with the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been happier!”
Reviews.Author: MoltoBeneItaly
Reviews.Content: The best decision I made when planning our trip to Venice was to forego a hotel with a view of the Grand Canal. The next best decision I made was to select the American Dinesen Hotel...and a view of the Vio Canal, and a peek-a-boo view of the Grand Canal. Great location...Dorsoduro is the best, and a great restaurant right next door...we ate outdoor right next to the canal...Cantinone Storico. Yes, the room was a bit small...but neat, well laid out, well managed, good WiFi, quiet, above average breakfast, etc. No complaints...and my wife loved to sit on the little balcony and have tea. Yes...we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A small gem hotel on a beautiful canal”
Reviews.Author: JMG44
Reviews.Content: By Venice standards, this hotel is a real bargain. We stayed 4 nights in September, 2011, and wished we had booked a longer stay. It is located in the Dorsodoro section of Venice, a 5 minute walk to the Accademia vaporetto stop and near restaurants, cafes and great sites, but away from the cruise ship masses that invade Venice each day. From our room we could see the grand canal in both directions and we overlooked a small canal. The staff was helpful. The room was immaculate, well furnished in traditional Venetian fashion, the bathroom was modern and had a bathtub. Our room was a corner room with a side and front facing balcony. The hotel had free wifi and the use of a computer and printer in the lounge. There was no elevator but readily available help with luggage. The small canal had gondoliers and commercial traffic, but was quiet at all appropriate times. The breakfast consisted of breads, fruits, cereals, meat and cheeses and all the latte and cappucino you desired. When we checked out the porter, without being asked, carried our luggage across the one bridge that separates the hotel from the vaporetto stop. My wife and I have stayed at other hotels in Venice in the past, but this area and more importantly, this hotel, will be our future home in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!!!”
Reviews.Author: idontlikechina
Reviews.Content: With Venice hotels and a room overlooking a canal always going for a premium price, I beleive that our early planning and research (Frommers recommended hotel) for a stay in Venice netted us a great room at a great little hotel. We reserved a room well in advance of our trip directly with the hotel and got a room with three small balconies overlooking the small little canal the hotel resides on (book early for the best rates, as they got worse as time went on and closer to our stay dates). The room was small, but manageable. The bathroom was small too, but again, manageable. The room was nicely decorated in a typical Venetian decor (according to my wife) and had AC going for at least two of the three days there (they must have shut it down our last day). Breakfast was OK, nothing too fancy, but good enough to start the day. The location in the Dorsoduro area was a great place to reside too. Getting from the train station on the vaparetto was a lot easier than I thought it would be, and a very short walk from the Accademia stop to the hotel, with only one small bridge to deal with. As others have said, it's nice to get away from the crowds near San Marco, as the nights were quiet. I may have given this hotel a 5, but with the small room, and a bed that was a little lumpy/hard, with hard pillows, a 4 is a good score from me. We enjoyed our time in Venice and the Hotel American Dinesen. I would look to stay here again if we ever return to Venice someday...

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment at American Dinesen”
Reviews.Author: jfsonoma
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our trip to Italy and our stay in Venice and the American Dinesen was the highlight. We stayed in the Apartments that are next door to the hotel and were very pleased. The room was clean and spacious with a small refrigerator and stove, breakfast bar, sofa and TV. The bathroom was large with a great shower and a washing machine. The bedroom was an upstairs loft with plenty of closet space and a comfortable bed. Daily maid service was provided but the breakfast was not included for the apartments. Having our own mini kitchen more than made up for that. As to the staff, I would say they are very business like. Not overly friendly but willing to help if you need info. As I found in most of Italy, if you spoke even a little Italian you were treated more warmly than those who spoke none. If I ever went back to Venice I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Mie_11
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at this hotel in september last. Very nicely decorated, clean rooms though a bit small. A clean recently renovated bathroom and thÃ©/coffe making facilities in the room (lovely for a nice cup of tea in the morning while sitting on the balcony watching the gondolas go by). The receptionist was very helpfull and polite. Leaving our luggage after check-out also wasn't a problem. Very close to the centre (ponte d'accademia) but quiet enough at night. To bad there were some roadworks going on the first morning so sleeping in was out of the question. But you musn't stay in bed too long when you're in Venice anyway :) It may be a bit pricy but I thouhgt it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Roger L
Reviews.Content: We had a very delightful stay at the lovely American Dinesen. The location, the room with its canal view with all its updated amenities was beyond our expectations. Its location within walking distance of the Peggy Guggenheim, the Academia and other attractions including the local quiet neighborhood, and the nearby restaurants on the Canal Della Giudecca, made it a perfect spot for us. We loved just strolling thru the neighborhood as well as the relatively short walk to the hubbub of St. Marks. We wish we could have stayed longer. We also found the front desk very helpful. We have lived and travel through out the world and rate our experience among the best. We highly recommend this hotel. RAL Cincinnati, Ohio, USA

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Ozrusty
Reviews.Content: After a previously terrible experience in a Venice hotel the American was such a pleasant experience. Great staff, excellent apartment, good breakfast, ideal location. Thanks for making our holiday a trip to remember instead of rue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great place to stay, really helpful staff, great value...we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Finnas
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here because my brother and his wife recommended it to us after their stay. We enjoyed our holiday very much and appreciated the friendly and efficient staff who made our week stay very easy. The apartment was also very good. We will recommend Hotel American Dinesan to our friends for their next stay in Venice and will come back for our next holiday in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, great staff, rooms with views”
Reviews.Author: Jared C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel American Dinesen for a couple nights as part of our honeymoon. The staff was great. Our room had a little balcony/terrace overlooking one of the side canals. It was clean, and in a great part of Venice (can walk to everything). We had pre-ordered the strawberries and flowers, so our room smelled great when we got there and we had a nice snack after a long day of travel. I also wrote to them in advance and told them it was a honeymoon, and they gave us a corner room. I'd highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dew333
Reviews.Content: Our family of three booked a triple room here in September. We had a small balcony that looked over a canal that was right off of the Grand Canal. We also had another window that overlooked the canal. The hotel was a short walk from the Accadamia Bridge and a vaporetta stop in one direction, and a few blocks from the lagoon in the other direction. We had several problems with flights and missing luggage and the hotel staff was so helpful to us by making phone calls and advising us in what we should do. Our problems were solved by the end of our stay and we were grateful for the interest and help we received from the staff. Everyone was friendly and the hotel was clean and beautifully decorated. If we ever return to Venice, we will be sure to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: lodding
Reviews.Content: we stayed 3 nites here on our last trip in april. we had 1 of the little apartments which werent so little. huge bathroom with washing machine, great lounge dinning/ kitchen area and a loft bedroom. it .was all very modern compared to their hotel rooms which are very authentic. staff are fantastic and recommendations for resturants we spot on. our luggage was lost at the airport and the staff went out of their way to help us track it down and speaking to airport staff for us. upon it finally arriving they even txt us to stop us worrying and having to come back to hotel to check. the apartment was spotless had everything we needed. reception and breakfast room beautifully appointed. breakfast (not included in apartment price) was excellent and well worth the money. having the washing machine was a bonus after 2 weeks away. a just cant find anything to fault this hotel 5 stars at every point and id recommend this hotel to anyone who will listen

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: court123s
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a quieter neighborhood, but a short walk to most attractions. The rooms are small and musty, but I have heard that is what to expect in Venice. The staff was helpful calling us a water taxi when we needed to get to the train station, since all other transportation was on strike.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: verorocket
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the hotel was wonderful. The room was clean, comfortable and lovely. The staff was exceedingly helpful! The restaurant recommendations provided by the desk staff were excellent and the room service was prompt and polite. We enjoyed the breakfast. The quality and assortment of food was outstanding. I don't think we could have been more pleased at a five star hotel! Not the best value in high season, but booking directly will save you money. Nice private patio for a cocktail and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Great LocatIon- Water Taxi to front door”
Reviews.Author: IrishEyesSA
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel -comfortable bed beautiful room friendly and helpful staff good breakfast - what more could you want? A landing stage where a water taxi can drop you and all that luggage right at the front door. This hotel is a pleasant walk from San Marco with lovely views for the Grand Canal if you have a balcony room - does not have a lift if you have problems with stairs although they are not steep stairs. Hotel offers a free water taxi to Murano Water taxis are not cheap but well worth it to get you to and from airport or rail station - no struggling with luggage up and down steps to get over the many bridges in Venice. The public water "bus" system is good to get you to the islands

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice people, good (though potentially quiet) location”
Reviews.Author: EP99
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal here during the off season. My understanding is that it, like most of Venice, gets really expensive in the summer. The flip side of the cheap prices is that it was very quiet at night near the hotel. Almost too quiet. During warmer months it is probably great because there are so many more people in Venice. It is removed from the worst of the tourist mass, which is great. Either way, it is just a short walk from a water taxi stop, so it is easy to get in from the train station. Also regarding the location, there are at least a couple museums close by, one full of Renaissance art (if I remember correctly) and one modern art. The room was nice and large. Well decorated. Buffet breakfast was good, better than most Italian hotels. Wireless worked well.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong here”
Reviews.Author: priscilla v
Reviews.Content: After reading every review of this hotel (and many others) we selected the American to stay a week in Venice. Of all the reviews we read, two people had semi-negative things to say, including a comment about a hard mattress (I found the mattress to be perfect) and a disappointing breakfast. We thought if that's as bad as it gets, we're in. And we have no regrets. We stayed in the annex with the courtyard, which was a delight after a day of schlepping around the streets in the heat and sun. The room was new, clean, stylish, and a nice change from the lovely tatters of the city. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. Maid service was very good. Honestly, you can't go wrong staying here. If I would say anything about what others have written, it would be to NOT recommend the restaurant next door. I would rather recommend Ai Cugnai up towards the Academie Bridge, or Trovaso Restaurant (not the one with the same name and a garden) further on past the Bridge. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. ps Even the American Express travel help gave this hotel rave reviews, for what that's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Solo traveler to Venice”
Reviews.Author: AmandaEsteroFL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in Venice during my travels around Italy. I am a solo woman traveler and rely heavily on TripAdvisor before planning my trips. This hotel did not disappoint. The location was great, staff friendly, and it felt very safe. The front staff were were helpful and gave me suggestions on things to see during my 3 day visit. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “an outstanding property”
Reviews.Author: Megan R
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights in early august in the apartments next door to the hotel. The staff were extremely helpful and kind. The apartments are perfectly set up for a family stay. We were able to eat breakfast in the unit and some lunches as well. There was plenty of space for ourselves and 2 teenage boys. The location is a close walk to St. Marks but far enough away to be in a quieter area of Venice. We would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Chris N
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to our first trip to Venice, and this hotel ticked all the boxes and more - we were not disappointed. It is in a quiet location in Dorsoduro near Accademia Bridge, yet within easy walking distance of all of Venice's main sights and attractions. Service at this hotel is second to none - all the staff are very welcoming and helpful. Although we stayed as a couple, we noticed how good all the staff were with families and children. The good-sized bedrooms are furnished and decorated in classically Venetian style (and teas and coffees in the room are a big bonus), while sitting on the balcony watching daily life on the canals is a delight. Breakfasts offer a good choice of fruit juices, cereals, rolls, jams, cheeses and meats, etc. We will have no hesitation in making it our first choice of hotel when returning to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Chrisandreou
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Nice and comfortable rooms in the modern-style section of the hotel. Rooms are quiet and allow good quality sleep. - The TV had a large number of channels (sky package), several in English - A modern bathroom with many amenities and a powerful shower - Excellent hygiene - A nice patio - A good cold breakfast with enough variety (10 euros p.p.) - Very friendly and helpful staff - Conveniently located: very close to the promenade Zattere, within a walking distance (~15 min) from San Marco square and 2 minutes away from the waterbus stop Accademia. The hotel also has a private docking area for water taxis. - A water taxi ride to the island of Murano is covered by the hotel. We enjoyed a scenic journey to the island which is famous for its glass (jewelry, household objects, works of art) and glass-blowing craft. Cons: - None that I can think of

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Patrick W
Reviews.Content: We booked the American Dinesen at the beginning of August, one of the busiest weeks in Venice, after an extensive search of hotels on Trip Advisor. The reviews helped a lot and it was the best choice we could have made. It totally lived up to our expectations. The location is perfectly central near the Academia (bridge) and yet still far enough from the crowds so that itâ€™s also quiet. From there you can easily visit the whole city, which we did by foot, not needing to take vaporettos or water taxis. We booked a double superior canal view room for two nights on which we got a very good internet rate. The room was awesome. We got the first floor corner room on the second (white) building with a balcony overlooking the canal and an extra window on the side. It was spacious enough especially for Venice standards, but I suppose that itâ€™s because it was the superior room. It was tastefully furnished, very clean and well equipped (free wifi!). The beds were perfect as they were firm and long enough for us tall people. The bathroom was also well equipped and very clean and up to date. Breakfast was included and served in the dining room. It was not lavish but they served everything you need to start your day. I agree with most of the reviews I have read about the staff. They were overtly friendly and helpful. Checking in went perfectly and at check out they stored our bags so that we could visit some more till we had to go. Concierges, bellhop, cleaning personnel and dining room staff were really nice and courteous, not only to us but also to other guests too, as we noticed how professionally they solved other guestâ€™s problems (we didnâ€™t have any!). Okay, if you really want to hear a minus point, hereâ€™s the only one I could think of. There is a restaurant next door, which has tables outside right under the balcony of the room, so it can get a bit noisy around dinner time (8-11 pm) if you want to keep your balcony door open. When you close the balcony doors you donâ€™t hear a thing though! Iâ€™m sure Iâ€™ll return to Venice and when I do I wonâ€™t spend any more time searching for hotels, I will definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: pinkymay
Reviews.Content: The American Hotel was perfect. Perfectly easy to get to from the Alilaguna Blue Line. Perfectly situated on Canal S. Vio. And it looked perfectly, exactly like the photos on the website. Breakfast was wonderful, rooms were immaculate, location is amazing. Walk towards the Canal (right as you leave the hotel) and go right to find a wonderful little neighborhood with great restaurants. Less crazy than the Rialto or Saint Mark's. Will definitely recommend and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Unpleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellaesq
Reviews.Content: My family of six arrived at the Hotel American Dinesen at the end of our trip to Italy, looking forward to seeing Venice. The concierge was very unwelcoming, greeting us with a surly look at our baggage, clearly annoyed that the bags were cluttering up the tiny lobby. On the other hand, the bellhop, who had to make mulitple trips up the stairs to our third floor rooms carring all of our luggage - there are no elevators - was very courteous and never complained. The guest rooms were very small. After we settled in I went downstairs to ask the concierge for a knife, and some glasses and plates. We had traveled through the Chianti region, and Parma and Prosecco, and we wanted to relax with some wine, cheese and proscuitto we bought during are trip before we went out. I was rudely told that we could not have these items, and he angrily warned me that we better not spill red wine in the room. Shocked at this admonishment, I went outside and found a little shop where I purchased a knife, and some paper plates and plastic cups. My husband, who did not know of my efforts, went into the restaurant or kitched area and spoke with the chef who was accommodating, and provided him with a sharp knife and a platter. We later learned that the concierge was furious the chef did this, and he actually WENT INTO OUR ROOMS AFTER WE WENT OUT TO TAKE BACK THE PLATTER AND THE KNIFE! Which, by the way, we had washed and dried and were going to return in the morning. I doubt that the hotel had a knife and platter shortage of an emergency nature and really needed our one knife and platter back that night. We stayed for two nights, and never got a warm or friendly vibe from anyone on staff except for the bellhop and the woman concierge who was working the front day on the Sunday morning we checked out. She actually smiled asnd engaged in conversation with us. Everyone else made us feel very unwelcome. Everywhere else my family and I travelled through Italy was amazing. The people we met were fantastic - warm, friendly, and accomodating, and the staff at the other hotels we visted were great. Hotel American Dinesen was a tremendous dissapointment and ended our trip to Italy on a low note. We will never recommend this hotel to anyone, and we will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Mary V
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exactly as pictured -- right out of a fairytale!! We had a "quadruple" room which was spacious enough for 2 adults and 2 adolescents with LOTS of luggage. The room was clean and the bathroom was immaculate. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Our visit was wonderful and we would definitely stay at the American Dinesen again if (when) we revisit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: William D
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel American following a cruise to Greece. It was our second hotel stay in Venice near the end of our vacation. I had researched different hotels when I was planning our vacation. The first hotel we stayed at was located near Piazza San Marco. It was a good choice for our first arrival in Venice. However, after several days of walking through Venice and dealing with the almost constant crowds around Piazza San Marco, my choice of Hotel American for our last hotel was absolutely perfect. Hotel American is located east of the south side of the Accademia Bridge and is away from the crowds. This hotel has its own dock, which makes it very convenient for arrival and departure by water taxi. We arrived at the hotel at 11 AM and we were quite happy when the staff advised that we could check into our room early. The staff seemed to anticipate what we needed before we asked. We were provided with maps, suggestions for restaurants, sights to see, access to concert tickets if we wanted, a free taxi ride to Murano, and free wifi Internet access! On our departure day, the hotel stored our luggage after we checked out so we could spend a little more time exploring Venice before we had to leave for the airport. It is not easy to find clean restrooms around the city. When we returned to the hotel to claim our luggage, we were offered restroom access without asking for it. The beds at Hotel American and the other 2 hotels we stayed at were very firm. We are accustomed to a softer bed, so be prepared for a firm bed. The pillows were also very firm. I don't know if softer pillows were available because we didn't ask. The next time we are in Venice, Hotel American will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute booking, discovered by chance. Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Lausanne-Geles
Reviews.Content: I was looking for 2 rooms for 2 nights on the eve of a public holiday. Hotel American was one of very few with vacancies and based on favourable reviews, I went ahead with the booking. No regrets whatsoever! The hotel is a short distance from the Accademia vaporetto stop and can easily be found. It is ideally located along a small canal running between the Grand Canal and the Lido. Although close to everything, the area is quiet. Both rooms were clean and nicely decorated, one on the first floor and a smaller one on the third floor. The bathrooms were spotless and of generous size. All staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet offered good variety. A complimentary water-taxi ride to Murano can be booked at Reception for pick-up at the front door jetty. However, you are taken to a glass-making demonstration (15 minutes)and have to visit a large showroom (30-45 minutes) before being able to wander around the town . Public transport vaporetto is the cheapest way to return to Venice/San Marco. This is a nice way to get to Murano on a first visit, but to avoid the compulsory glass factory visit on subsequent trips, vaporetto would be the way to go. Overall, a very pleasant stay at the Hotel American. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: VinhasL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and well located. Walking distance to San Marco Plaza and other attractions in Venice. Yet, it is in calm street. On the downside the rooms should be renewed. I didn't like the old carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Our Second Stay - Still Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: sugabtoronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night prior to our cruise. We had stayed here last year, had a wonderful stay and so decided to return. The area cannot be beat, if you like to be away from the maddening crowd of Venice. It is quiet and a lovely 5 minute walk down to the boardwalk where you can stroll and watch the activity of vaparettos and the cruise ships sailing in or out. The room was small, but then most European rooms are. We paid extra to face the canal which was lovely and were our water taxi dropped us. Last year, we arrived by allilaguna and this year we took a water taxi, which was a breathtakingly beautiful way to arrive in Venice. The breakfast was good and inclusive. There is no elevator, so if stairs are a problem, please take this into consideration. The hotel staff is polite at the desk, answer your questions, but do not really go out of their way to help. All in all, it is a great hotel and we would be back!

Reviews.Title: “Superb all around”
Reviews.Author: fabuechner
Reviews.Content: Cannot say enough good things about this wonderful hotel situated in the quiet sestiere of Dorsoduro, and their superb staff. Third stay here; no desire to investigate any other Vrnice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, ideal location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Canuck_travel_girl
Reviews.Content: Our choice to book this hotel was mainly based on the TripAdvisor reviews, and the hotel certainly lived up to what we read. We stayed for 3 nights in mid-July. We used Alilaguna to get from the airport to the hotel, and it was just as easy as promised (and a scenic ride). The stop was a very short walk from the hotel. However, do note that you need to cross a canal and therefore must be able to haul your luggage up and down some stairs. We left from the vaporetto stop at Accademia, and again, it was a quick and easy walk (another canal crossing required, but less steps this time). The hotel itself is attractive, and the staff is friendly and helpful. As someone else mentioned, our suitcases were carried up to our room for us. In addition to the free wifi, there is also a computer in the lobby for guest use at no charge. Our room was quite nice and very clean, although small. The location is probably the best part of all. The hotel is close to everything that you will want to see, yet out of the most touristy area. There are some really decent restaurants in the area (ask the staff for suggestions), and there are also some very scenic restaurants close by that look out over the lagoon. Thanks for helping make our time in Venice so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in quiet location - but close to everything”
Reviews.Author: PortiaG
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on TA ratings and were not disappointed. We stayed for four nights and found the location perfect. A short walk to the Accademia and San Marco and easy access to the vaporetto. We took the Alilaguna from the airport to the Zattere stop and it was a quick and easy 5 minute walk to the hotel (with only one bridge to carry our luggage over). Our room did not have a canal view but on the first floor there is a small balcony that we used to sit and watch the canal. There is also a lovely patio out back where we sat and had a drink in the afternoon. The room was a good size and was very clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very standard for hotels in Italy. The only thing we didnt like was the coffee that they served but there is a wonderful little cafe, Bar da Gino, just around the corner from the hotel that served the best cappucino we had in Italy. I would highly recommend Hotel American Dinesen and will stay here again when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay in Dinesen”
Reviews.Author: lieve_dc
Reviews.Content: We booked a modern room in the Dinesen. Our room and bathroom were very comfortable and nice. It was on the ground floor next to a courtyard. The hotel is on a good location, close to the waterbus-vaporettostops Accademia and Zattere. We didn't have breakfast there, it was not included. In the neighourhood there is a good winebar-shop where you can eat very good cincetti's. 'cantinone gia schiavi', in fondamente Nani, with next door a good small gelateria 'squero'. In the wineshop we bought a bottle of Masi costasera Amarone we drank in the evening in the courtyard of Dinesen. That was very tasty, great wine! In the neighbourhood we didn't find a good restaurant. We went to the Montin, as the receptionist of American-Dinesen recommended, where we ate well but payed too much. It's better to take the Vaporetto and go to Piazza Roma for example and have dinner in this area, for example 'In bacco felice' near campo Tolentini. Better value for your money. Or to take the waterbus to S. Marcuola and have dinner in Gam-Gam with view on the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Chuck757
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights based on the reviews i read on here. Hotel was beautiful with a great staff. The location was perfect. Not too far from the sights but far enough that prices in shops were cheaper and crowds were much less. Room was nice and in the Venician decor with great air conditioning and a wonderful breakfast. Cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “great location, somewhat pricey”
Reviews.Author: wandering-soprano
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights in October 2010. The hotel is easily accessible from both Accademia and Zattere vapoletto stops. If you take private taxis to/from airport, the access is even better. Water taxi gets you right in front of the hotel, and hotel staff will take care of your luggages. Nice restaurants within walking distance. The hotel does not have elevator, so you should think about how much stairs you can manage. When I got in touch with the hotel staff and asked for a room on the first floor, the hotel staff was quite helpful. I was happy with the location, room size and cleanliness, but found the room rate rather pricey. Don't mind going back there, but then if I visit Venice again, I might choose either more luxury or economy.

Reviews.Title: “Total comfort away from the noise”
Reviews.Author: fairfax425
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was ideal for us: one block each way to the Accademia (with its vaporetto stop) and the Goggenheim museums, in a quiet part of town, a 30-minute walk from St. Mark's. It's located on a small canal (rio) and some rooms (not ours) have windows opening to it. Our room was excellent -- large, comfortable, well decorated -- and the staff immensely helpful. The room was two flights up; no elevator but the staff carries the luggage to the room. St. Mark's square and the area around it were jammed with tourists and we were so happy to be in a quiet, Italian area on the other side of the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: jfehrenb
Reviews.Content: Hotel American Dinesen was recommended to me by discriminating friends. I was not disappointed. The hotel was in a great location, yet was sufficiently quiet. The room had a lovely smal balcony overlooking a canal. The room was well appointed and recently updated. The staff was very, very helpful. I highly recommend the Hotel American Dinesen.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!! Thumbs up!!!”
Reviews.Author: Custain
Reviews.Content: We saw this hotel here on Trip Advisor and it seems to have great reviews so we went there. It was as good as people said! We stayed in the "modern" room in the Annex (not in the main building) and it was fun and private with it's own little courtyard. The staff was GREAT - all very kind and helpful with recommendations on where to go and what to do. We would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Chealy1
Reviews.Content: We liked the location, close to the alilaguna (waterbus) stops and the bridge over the grande canal. The hotel looked good inside and out and the room was really well decorated and appointed with the unexpected addition of a little balcony with a side view of a canal. The bathroom was good but a little on the small side with not much space to move after a shower. There was free wifi which was welcome, especially to my son. The minibar prices were reasonable given the prices in bars and restaurants. Also complimenary tea and coffee in the room. I was impressed by the cleanliness of the room with sheets changed daily. The reception and dining room staff were friendly and helpful. All in all we enjoyed our stay. If we ever visit Venice again we'll book with Hotel American. Tip: We found a good big supermarket about 10 mins from hotel. Turn left out of hotel and walk to Zattere promenade. Turn right over the bridge and keep going past several restaurants until just before a dock area. The supermarket is on the right but not well signed. Its the only one we found in Venice in the 3 days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: brettmeister
Reviews.Content: Just got back from honeymoon in Venice, a special trip made even more special by the hotel, fabulous room (302) location just perfect, away from the bustle and noise, but close enough to walk with ease into the main tourist bits. Staff were superb and couldnt be more helpfull!! I was recommended this hotel by a freind and needless to say i will be recommending it to anyone who will listen!!! 10/10. Mark Brett, Norfolk, UK.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: coffeegirl9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel American Dinesen for 3 nights in July. Easy to find from the Accademia vaporetto stop. The staff was friendly when we arrived and the porter carried our bags up to our room (no elevator). Lovely canal view from our room. We had a triple room which was spacious compared to other hotels we had stayed in during our trip. Breakfast was typical, although the coffee was the worst we had in Italy. The desk staff was very helpful in assisting us whether we needed to quickly find the closest Farmacia or find an appropriate restaurant for gluten free dining. The only thing I would be aware of or avoid is the complimentary boat to Murano for a glass factory tour. It turned out to be a couple of minutes for a "tour" and then a heavy sell in the gallery.

Reviews.Title: “Bitter Taste in the mouth”
Reviews.Author: Jayanta C
Reviews.Content: Lovely room in the Annexe, renovated with a small courtyard inside... with all facilities incl. coffee machine. Location is okay, behind Accademia - with all sites easily accessible by Vaporetto (Bus # 1 & 2). Some good restaurants on the other side near Zattera stop. Found it over-priced for location and facility. Worse was being charged 5 Eur everyday for my 3yr old baby's breakfast, which was ridiculous. This was not even communicated to us when we checked in and was charged later. The behaviour of some of the staff seemed a little 'racially intolerable'. Left a little bitter taste in the mouth overall

Reviews.Title: “Location superb and a little less touristy than some other areas!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTravellers008
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed for 4 nights in this gorgeous hotel, location superb, right on a small canal, handy to Accademia bridge, Peggy Guggenheim Museum and much more. Our room had 3 sets of doors opening to patio overlooking the canal, what more could you ask for? We parked our car in garage San marco and caught a water taxi, with porter service directly from the car Park, 80 euro, to the hotel, what we imagined was going to be a struggle, with numerous cases, was a breeze! We couldn't speak highly enough of the staff accommodation and location here, after returning from the area around San Marco square with zillions of tourists, it felt like returning to a haven, sitting on the balcony, enjoying a drink, and watching the 'canal traffic'! Enjoyed dinner at a restaurant recommended by the hotel, in a lovely garden setting called Locanda Montin, a 10 minute stroll away and also one rediscovered on Trip Advisor, excellent food and value for money, particularly for Venice, called San Trovaso, and in fact went there twice! Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed at this hotel at least 6 times in the last 12 years and I have never been disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Tintoretto_11
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Venice almost every other year for the last 20 years and have stayed in at least 4 other 3 star hotels. Hotel American Dineson have maintained their high level of comfort and standard in the years that I have been staying there. You are always assured of a well appointed room and their attention to detail and their warm welcome. I am a picky traveler and while Hotel American's typical Venetian decor may not be to everyone's taste, compared to other 3 star hotels in Venice, the comfort and cleanliness of the room are never compromised and it is very good value for what you get. The Dorsoduro area is also a nice quiet and convenient place to return to after being with hordes of tourists in the main areas. I do not stay anywhere else when I go to Venice now.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: flo1020
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel situated on small canal in lovely dusoduro neighborhood near the academia. great breakfasts with lovely breakfast staff. beautifully appointed room of adequate size. helpful hotel staff in general. nice outdoor balcony space where one can relax in a quiet setting. easily reached by water taxi, which docks at the door of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Compliments to the staff”
Reviews.Author: Dredkins
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at Hotel Dinesen in mid-June. The staff was extremely helpful from the front desk to the porters. The location is also excellent being an easy five minute walk(only one small bridge) walk from the vaporetto. Our room was small but clean. However they used what for me was an unpleasant air freshener to mask the local smells. Just don't keep the door open to the little balcony for long!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a quiet but convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ccmcNottingham_UK
Reviews.Content: A super hotel near tha accademia bridge ,so easy access to all the must see sites.quiet position away from the crowds.lovely Canal frontage .book a room with a canal view.great breakfast a friendly helpful staff. Book a water taxi from the airport takes out the arrival hassle and you get great view as you come down the grand canal.the Zatterre taxi stop for the return is v near.don't miss Nico,s gelateria for some fantastic ice-cream .book ahead on Venice connected to avoid the museum queues

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view just off the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Richtersaint
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from the reviews on TA and it was everything that it has been billed as. Obviously hotels in Venice are extortionately priced, and this hotel is a solid 3 star when viewed as the building only, but you are really paying for the view. We had a room with a small balcony overlooking a canal, just off the Grand Canal. I wouldn't bother staying here unless you do have a room with a view, as I'm sure there are plenty of cheaper options available. Service was friendly though a little stiff at times - no glassware provided in the rooms? Beds were poor - at $450 a night surely they could be better than this. Breakfast - I have to disagree with others' reviews - whilst being ok, it was the poorest we had in our 10 day Italian sojourn. The Dorsodurso is a lovely part of Venice. A bit quieter than San Marco, but yet still very close to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice hotel with wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_galTN
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel American! The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are extremely large and clean (we had a triple). Breakfast is good and offers a variety. The hotel is situated close to Accademia Bridge and a 10 minute walk to St. Mark's square. We enjoyed our time at Hotel American and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: LRO2008
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. We had to move from another which didn't suit for personal reasons, and the American Dinesen arranged for assistance in getting our luggage moved over. We had one of the rooms in the apartment which was very suitable. Very large room, and bathroom, with coffee making facility. Access available to a very private patio outside the rooms. Very good breakfast buffet, free wifi, and easy walking distance from Accademia water-bus stop. All the staff were very helpful and made our stay very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: caitemaire
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here two day, but if..or hopefully when...I return to Venice, I would not hesitate to stay here again. A fairly small hotel, it is full of charm, in a great location, very comfortable, with a very pleasant staff. We arrived quite early from the airport, on a water taxi that could pull right up out front, on the charming side canal the hotel is located on. Our rooms were not quite ready, so the man at the desk suggest a short walk to a nice place to have lunch. And very nice it was and the staff was always very helpful. We returned to our rooms, very nicely decorated, with spotlessly clean, modern bathrooms, great A/C and a wonderful view that I could never get tired of from the balcony. If you can, spring for a balcony room! Within a couple of minutes walk of two water bus stops that can take you anywhere in the city and passing some very nice little store to buy everything from a piece of art to a souvenir. Another nice restaurant right next door for dinner if you do not want to travel too far. What is better than sitting at a table by a small canal, watching the boats go by as you dine? A nice breakfast in the morning and we were off tour cruise ship the next day, happily to return for another stay at he end of our journey before returning home.

Reviews.Title: “Great times in Venice”
Reviews.Author: sdgoat
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on a Family trip through Italy. The last time I was here, my wife and I stayed at the Pensione Guerrato, which was perfect. We were somewhat sad to see it was sold out for our stay, so we were on the hunt for a new place. Luckily I came across this find of a hotel, but to be quiet honest I was a little thrown off by the name. I figured tourist trap, at best. But the reviews were solid, and we had little other option at this point. When I made the reservation they sent along a map and directions in email to help find the hotel, which was good because Venice is a MAZE. We found our water bus, found the stop, and made it to the hotel, piece of cake. The hotel is located in a very quiet part of Venice away from the tourist mobs. We all had rooms overlooking the small canal in front. It was very quiet. Breakfasts were the typical breakfasts found in most Italian hotels: rolls, meats, cheeses, some eggs, and cereal. Perfect for us. The staff was exceptionally helpful, and even arranged a dinner for us at a local restaurant to serve us moleche, which apparently were not in season (or maybe they were and we got taken for a ride). If you have never heard of moleche, or have been to scared to try them, just do it. So delicious. They are the softshell crabs that are basically molting, so they've lost their shell, and are fried. You eat them whole. So so so good. the rooms were very quiet, the beds comfortable, the staff were nice and friendly, couldn't ask for a better time. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Lewpet
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very pleasant, the staff was helpful, the breakfast good. The location was ideal and the staff helped us with concert, vaporado, and restaurant reservations. The hotel was quiet, being located on a small canal near the Rialto Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful first holiday as a family”
Reviews.Author: Cariemay
Reviews.Content: We were taking our 8 month old on her first holiday and we couldn't have picked a better hotel. The staff were wonderful and bent over backwards to help us, from providing a travel cot in our room to a highchair at breakfast and storing our pushchair for the duration of our stay. The room was a Canal View Superior and was comfortable and cool and the view of the grand canal from the balcony was perfect for watching Venice come alive in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, great location, agreeing staff.”
Reviews.Author: LKTB
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel - spacious, well-designed rooms and perfectly adequate communal areas. The staff are friendly and helpful and the location is fantastic (3 mins walk from Accademia and about 5 mins from Zattere). Only complaint was somewhat erratic air-conditioning unit and firm beds, but I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - a real 10 out of 10 experience”
Reviews.Author: ECFC-Rustle
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was exactly as described on its website and just as we hoped it would be, there were no misleading descriptions or hidden problems or charges often found on some sites. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially when we needed emergency dental help. The continental breakfast was ideal with a wide choice to satisfy both European and mature English tastes with plenty of good Italian coffee. The hotel is well sited on a canal off the Grand Canal, within easy reach of most tourist sites, vaporetto stops and a multitude of good restaurants. We were there to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary and it was a real dream. The only improvement we can advise is to have some music played in the dining room, at a volume such that conversation is easy without being overheard.
