This is not a cheap hotel but it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: esmari
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in a quiet area of the Dorsoduro District. The vaporetto stop is convenently located nearby. Also, it is within walking distance to St. Mark's Square and the Musica a Palazzo. The Rialto Bridge and Fish Market are a little further away, but we walked to these landmarks as well. The hotel has no elevator, but that was not a problem for us. A generous breakfast and a tour to the Island of Murano is included with your hotel stay. However, I believe the tour does not include the return trip and you must buy that separately from the vaporetti (waterbus) company. All the staff is very nice and attentive, especially the gentlemen that helpswith the luggage and the breakfast room staff. The rooms are a little pricey and not a good value for the cost. However, we did enjoy our stay. I recommend purchasing unlimited waterbus transportation if you are staying for 3 days or so. The venicelink website charges 60 euros per person ofr the unlimited prestige pass, if you prepay it and this includes your to and from airport transfers, unlimited on and off the various stops, as well as the Islands tour (Murano, Burano and Torcello) and the Civic Museums (Dolce Palace, etc.) and Churches. Note, it does not include entrance to St. Mark's Basilica. Also note that we saw people being turned away from entering the Basilica after making a long line because no sleeveless tops, no shorts and no backpacks are allowed. For a great meal, visit Giudecca Island and have lunch at the Alla Palanca Restaurant. This Island is directly accross the Zattere stop (the stop of for the Hotel). Lastly, always verify the direction of the Vaporetto and become familiar with the routes and stops which are available online. Don't forget to just walk about the streets and enjoy a gelatto and the local flavors.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: pbates36
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel - stayed in the modern suites and found them to be clean and well attended. Great location and helpful, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for a special trip”
Reviews.Author: DOW7730
Reviews.Content: For a very special trip to celebrate a major birthday, this was a perfect hotel. Good location without the noise of tourists and outdoor restaurants Excellent advice from the front dest, very comfortable rooms and rooms with a canal view were extra special.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: garciapena
Reviews.Content: my husband has never been to Venice and it's been years since i have visited so i couldn't remember exactly where to stay. I found Hotel Dinesen and wasn't sure i wanted to stay off the main area but it turns out it couldn't have been more perfect. we were literally steps away from a small bridge that you walked over to go towards San Marco Sq. It's a perfect location for everything and it is on a small canal which i found to be more charming than the Grand Canal. The hotel was beautiful, nicely decorated to represent Venice, the room was alot bigger than we expected (as was the bathroom!), and the staff was absolutely fabulous! They could not have been nicer or more helpful (and always happy!!!). The man who helped us to our room with our bags (quite heavy) was a bit shocked at us giving him a tip (yes, they don't expect BUT PLEASE DO, HE WORKS HARD!). it was nice to know they do nice things and don't expect anything for it (but again, it's nice to show your appreciation!). They offered adivce to restaurants (good ones) and helped us get around. i couldn't have wished for a better experience in Venice and for my husband's first visit. Thank you! I will definiltely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great small hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jgilbertie
Reviews.Content: Sue and I had a wonderful time at the Hotel American in Venice. It is a beautiful hotel and the staff was very courteous and helpful. We liked the fact that it is on a quite side canal yet still within easy walking distance of St Marks. It is a short walk from the Accademia Bridge. We plan to stay at the hotel again the next time we visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful.....can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: CalChris
Reviews.Content: We thought this was a lovely hotel in a fabulous part of Venice. We stayed in one of the 'Dependance' rooms and couldn't have asked for more. The room was spacious (unusual in Venice!), very clean and had all the amenities you could ask for; tv, safe, good shower, hairdryer, minibar etc. Being slightly away from the rest of the hotel it was the perfect spot to relax after a day viewing the delights that Venice has to offer. The outside garden was a fabulous secluded spot to enjoy a chilled glass of prosecco in the evening or an early morning coffee. The free wifi was a great bonus. Although this room didn't come with breakfast we chose to eat in the dining room on three occasions and felt that the good choice of continental food set us up well for the day (all very reasonably priced for 10EUR). The service throughout the hotel both in the dining room and at reception was excellent but not intrusive. We were thrilled with the location of the hotel in Dorsoduro. The canal that the hotel is on is gorgeous but just far enough away from the crowds. The Peggy Guggenheim museum was just around the corner and there were some interesting arty shops nearby. There were also some great book shops and other interesting places a stones throw away in the studenty areas. We had lots of lovely walks around the area in the early evening and found some great places to eat all with lovely views. The hotel's location close to the 'Academia' bridge means that all the major attractions including St Marks Square and the Rialto Markets are only a short walk away. Getting the water boat back to Marco Polo airport at the end of our stay was really convenient as the hotel helped us with the timetable and the stop (Zattere) is only 5 mins walk away. If you're looking for a great little hotel in an interesting area of Venice with good service and excellent facilities the the Hotel American is for you.....enjoy! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Would thoroughly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Yoda19
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely 3 night stay. Great location, 2 minute walk from Accedemia bridge and galleries. About 15 min walk to San Marco, but all the better for being quieter. Very friendly and helpful service. Upgraded to balcony room which was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless!”
Reviews.Author: jonnygib1
Reviews.Content: For my wife's 40th, we had a long weekend in Venice, and stayed here, the Hotel American Dinesen. We chose it based on reviews here on TA, and it exceeded our pretty demanding expectations. Everything about it was perfect, and we have stayed in a large number of hotels over the years. This is a real gem. All the categories have been given top ratings, and each is absolutely deserved. The staff, the accommodation, the location, the decor and furnishings, the breakfast, the level of service we received (I could go on and on...) were, as it says above, faultless. Stay here if you go to Venice. It is a fabulous, fabulous place.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: NIRS3
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed for 4 nights at this lovely hotel. As everyone has said it is ideally situated for getting to from the airport, getting into Venice or simply discovering the lovely Dosoduro part of Venice. The room safe and tea and coffee facilities were a really useful. Compared to our rather small room our friends were accommodated in much larger rooms, one even had a chaise lounge. Perhaps I should have told reception that I did the tripadviser reviews for the group!! All rooms were immaculately clean and well decorated - no signs of shabbiness or tiredness in this hotel. We did have a minor problem with our shower but it was fixed very quickly. The beds are enormous, if a little firm and the sheets seemed to be changed every day. The continental breakfasts were very good with plenty of rolls, croissants, bread, boiled eggs, cheese, meats, yoghurts and fresh fruit. The coffee was excellent. We were recommended to go to a couple of restaurants (trattitori) Taverna San Trovaso and Casin Dei Nobili. These were more budget type restaurants but the food was very good especially at the second one. Both cost about 55 Euros for two including drinks. The receptionist booked tables for us which was very much appreciated as there were six in our party. The Billa supermarket is quite a walk away - go down to Zattere and turn right and it is about three hundred yards. Whisky was cheap as was the local wine. You pay extra to be upgraded for a canal view but the canal is quite small and as you spend so little time in the room I wouldn't bother. We spent one day with a 12 hour vaparetto ticket! (16 Euros) to do the length of the Grand Canal and visit the islands of Murano and Burano(our favourite.) one day exploring St Marks. Rialto etc and the last exploring Dorsoduro using a walk from the guidebook.

Reviews.Title: “My kids loved it”
Reviews.Author: Frappolo
Reviews.Content: the hotel reception was perfect and the room clean and pleasant, rich breakfast, staff very helpful and polite Only note:, the room temperature was very high, even switching off the heating inside the room The position greatly helped us in taking the bigger pleasure out of our staying in Venice will recommend the hotel to anyone going to ask us a hint to Venice

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: mjbjr
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay at this hotel after reading other reviews on this site. Honestly I am not sure some of the reviews here even do this hotel justice. The location, just off the Grand Canal, and within a couple of minutes of the Accademia ACTV stop was perfect for exploring Venice. On arrival at the hotel we were met by Marco who was extremely friendly and welcoming. After being shown to our room Marco provided us with a map and suggested sights to see and routes to take. Later during our stay Marco booked us a table at the Venice Jazz Club which proved to be an inspired move as he knew the guy there and we ended up with some of the best seats!! The breakfast was your typical continental buffet and provided the perfect start for each day of exploring. The free internet within the hotel was also extremely useful in planning our daily explorations and to make any necessary bookings. Overall, this was a fantastic find on tripadvisor and I would have no hesitations in recommending it to others. If we were to visit Venice again it would certainly be our first place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Service from a quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoonerPaul1964
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel, couldn't fault anything. The service would put some 5 star hotels to shame. Situated 5 minutes from the San Marco region and a couple of minutes from the Grand Canal. this was an ideal location for sight seeing and with the hotel overlooking a canal, what a lovely sight to wake up to. The hotel is a couple of minutes walk from the Accademia stop for the Waterbus so it was so easy to get from the airport via a coach then on to the waterbus and a 15 minute boat ride for 6.5 Euros. Breakfast was typically continental, but ample.

Reviews.Title: “THE PERFECT HOTEL WHEN YOU VISIT VENEZIA”
Reviews.Author: SNOTTENTAP
Reviews.Content: It was our second time in Venezia and also thus the second time in Hotel American. Once again we enjoyed this typical quiet hotel, perfectly located to discover Venice. Very nice rooms, great breakfast and nice staff. Fully recommended by us in any case and we shall certainly take the same hotel whenever we visit Venezia in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venetian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spurs321
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this hotel and it was just as good as the previous two. the location of the hotel is fantastic, in a quiet location on a beautiful canal away from the hustle and bustle of San Marco, but only a 15 minute walk away through some of the most interesting and pleasant streets in Venice. The staff at the hotel are always welcoming and are very friendly, from those on reception, tot he staff serving breaklfast in the lovely breakfast room in the morning. On this trip I stayed in one of the new apartments in the building right next to the hotel (and still had breakfast in the main hotel building). it was more modern than the rooms in the main part of the hotel and the room was enormous, with the bed on a mezanine floor, a very large bathroom, a seating and dining area and a small kithchenette. this was excellent value for money, being cheaper than the main hotel. Overall, I cannot fault this hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a traditional Venetian hotel in a lovely part of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RyeBearss
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great!! Don't let the name foul you- it's a great hotel run by Italians!! Away from some of the touristy stuff but nice little walk to Accademia section and close to Piazza San Marco. Nice breakfast room and the staff is SUPER friendly with directions and made booking to Opera. Pls. make sure to give a big pat to the dog Pablo - my daughter loved him. Rooms in the front overlook a channel and your taxi to and from train and airport are right at your door. Rooms are a bit small but most are in Europe. Bathrooms completely renovated and are in good shape!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: MartysQueens
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed her in Feb of 2011, I was very concerned, not knowing anything about hotel. The rooms are small but very clean. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, the breakfast each day was good. The location was not far from the Accademia bridge. We would go back to this hotel again. Marty in Iowa

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a romantic weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Jshakes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel American Dinesen in February to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary and it was the perfect choice. Venice is a lovely city for a weekend break with the final leg of the journey down the Grand Canal making a perfect introduction. The hotel is just minutes walk from the boat stop at Academia bridge which is also the route across to all the main attractions in the city. Tucked away in a quiet area overlooking it's own canal which we had a balcony over was perfect. The hotel was immaculately kept, and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. We would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Venice in January”
Reviews.Author: atrist
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful trip we had to celebrate my partner's birthday. We had sunshine and mist showing off Venice in true atmospheric fashion. Location of American Dinesen couldn't be better in our view. We have both stayed in Venice before a couple of times and this was our favourite location. The water taxi brought us right up to the hotel. Room was fine with good shower/bathroom facilities. I had booked directly with the hotel and ordered the special "romantic" in the room - bottle of prosecco was nice but the fake rose petals and cushion a bit of a joke! If I have to be critical the only downside was that our was room terribly warm at first and took a while to cool down but some people might have thought that was a good thing in chilly January. However - we were so stuffy that first night until we sorted the climate control out - not a problem though once you do. Breakfast definitely worth having - nice room and service. Staff easy going, helpful and friendly. Nothing too much trouble. Yes I would most definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again on return trip to beautiful Venice. I think you would find it hard to better "Hotel American Dinesen" in all respects!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Kelleth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the American for 3 nights in Jan and would certainly return there if we visited Venice again. We had a twin room with a beautiful view of the picturesque San Vio canal. The room was a good size with plenty of storage, flat screen tv, heating/aircon, mini bar and electric shutters. No tea/coffee making facilities though so bring your travel kettle. The bathroom was modern with a bath with overhead shower. Breakfast was available from 7.30 â€“ 10am and was plentiful. It was buffet service with a member of staff serving tea/coffee. Food consisted of cereals, fruit, croissants, jams/spreads, eggs, ham, cheese, toast, juicesâ€¦.. For 2.50 euro you could have breakfast brought up to you. We found the hotels location to be quiet and very convenient, just a few steps away from a small campo on the Grand Canal and barely 2 minutes from the Accademia bridge and vaparetto stop (1 of only 3 bridges over the Grand Canal) which means you can reach San Marco square in under 10 mins (once you know the route through the maze of alley ways!) and also only a minutes walk in the opposite direction to the Zattere (promenade overlooking Guidecca, which also has a price-busting Billa supermarket at the western end) We walked all over the city for the first 2 days and thought it was absolutely stunning. We got a 12 hour vaparetto pass for our last day as our legs were rather tired! If you are taking young children to Venice, leave the pushchair at home! The countless bridges would make getting around the city very arduous. A cheap way of getting across the Grand Canal if you are not near a bridge is by using a tragetti â€“ look out for the signs â€“ these are small gondolas which take you over the canal for 50 cents (you may have to stand up on the small boat so make sure you have good balance!). This is also a great way of getting the gondola experience without the hefty price tag. We found eating out to be very expensive, but you can find many cafÃ©â€™s restaurants that have a tourist menu if you are watching your euroâ€™s. We found the â€œGhettoâ€� area by the Guglie vaparetto stop to have some great reasonably priced restaurants. Also, make sure there is no cover charge â€œNo Compertoâ€� before you sit at a table as this can easily double your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and economic apartment with all the ease of a luxury boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Conor186338
Reviews.Content: When I go back to Venice I will do it exactly the same way and stay at the Hotel Americano Dinesen. The apartment was perfect. All the staff were perfectly friendly and very helpful, and their fluency in English put my pathetic Italian language skills to shame. Fantastic location with really easy and great access to transport and walking distance to all the main Venice attractions. A large self-catering studio appartment with daily maid service effectly meant I had a suite at normal room rates. With the guidance of the Reception staff i found the local shops and market very easily and saved a bundle on eating out. I felt like I owned my own apartment in Venice for a week and that is a great feeling. My only hesitation in recommending hotel American would be that it might not be available when I next come to visit., however having visited once I am assured that a room will be saved for a return visit and have been sent a promotional code to use next time. Perfect, go here do not hesitiate, Venice in early spring is a tranquil apology / precious gift to your eyesight. Go, go now.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: TracyEV
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the back end of a Italy - Greece adventure and loved it! Really easy to find even in the maze that is Venice! Stayed on the new Depandance side of the hotel and I wish I could live there. Huge rooms and fabulous bathrooms that are just not normally available in Europe! Bring slippers or socks, floor is cold but everything else including the outside patio is primo! Free WiFi worked awesome in the common areas but a little harder in the room, however the section we were in was so private we could just leave the room door open and use it that way when we need to. Front desk clerks were all very helpful, both the two gentleman and the lady in the morning, plus a lovely young boy who chatted us up in the afternoon:-) They also let us leave our luggage for most of the day after we checked out so we could squeeze in some more sightseeing on our final day in Venice. Would go back in a heartbeat, thank you for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing city, amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DedraDe
Reviews.Content: We came to Venice after a not so great stay in Florence and it was a breath of fresh air. We arrived shortly before midnight and the staff was helpful and even lugged our bags upstairs for us. Venice was so relaxing we decided to add another night to our stay. The hotel is in a great location, close to St. Mark's and the Grand Canal, but far enough out to get a quiet night's rest. We got a room with a balcony over the canal and it was worth it. We got to wake up each morning to a beautiful view. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Canal view, central location yet quiet”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne1304
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the apartments attached to the hotel and enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel staff were always available to ask questions and were courteous and helpful with offers of umbrellas and wellies if needed. The American is in a brilliant location and I would return to Dorsoduro because it is so well placed. From here we walked all over Venice but it is only a 10 min walk to St Marks Square and about 2 minutes to the Accademia bridge, a minute the other direction takes you to the Peggy Guggenheim museum. Not that we went into any museums, Venice is one big museum and we just walked around for 4 days in wonder - absolutely beautiful. The hotel is less than a minute to walk to the end of the street and you are standing at the edge of the Grand Canal, but it is in a very quiet area so no problems with noisy boats etc. The apartments look out onto the San Vio canal and walking straight out onto the canal each morning was lovely. A couple of minutes took you to either the vaporetto stop by the Accademia, or walk the other way and you are onto the Zattere within a few minutes with more vaporetto stops. It was lovely to walk along the Zattere in the late afternoon and evening where you can catch the last of the sun (further into Venice you don't get this because of the buildings casting so much shade) and go for a walk along the promenade. One of the best icecream bars along the Zattere only minutes away, and a Billa supermarket at the end of the Zattere so easy for picking up shopping. The apartment was pretty basic but suited us as we were out a lot. It was off a central lobby with two other apartments - we found it quiet which was good. The apartment consists of one large room with sofabed and kitchenette; adjoining shower room/toilet and an upstairs mezzanine with double bed, safe and wardrobe. The kitchenette is limited to a hob, sink and fridge. It would have been good to have a microwave or oven and we found that limited its usefulness. The windows of the apartment are quite high so unfortunately you cannot get the view of the canal from the ground floor of the apartment, but you can see it from the mezzanine which has the double bed. Sofabed downstairs was fine and comfortable enough. Good powerful shower. Large clean shower room/toilet. Overall, this apartment suited our budget this time around, but I would upgrade another time to get a room with a view and slightly more luxurious surroundings. I would however consider coming to the hotel again and definitely think Dorsoduro is an ideal location. In the evenings, or by late afternoon, we were tired mostly because of all the walking all day. This location is lovely and with a very short walk to the Zattere, you feel you are at the seaside and can unwind away from the business of the centre of Venice. Tips: buy the vaporetto tickets which you can get to last several days as they are well worth it. After a long walk around Venice, it is good either to get you back to your hotel, or to just sit and sightsee while resting your legs. We also found that if you want to 'picnic' in Venice it isn't easy. They don't seem to believe in benches so you simply cannot find somewhere to sit while you eat. Very tiring too as you are constantly on the go. We ate on the vaporetto a couple of times while sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific for a Venice getaway”
Reviews.Author: Jason11201
Reviews.Content: Will definitely be back. This is a great little hotel on a relatively quiet canalside street in Dorsoduro, yet close to the vaporetto and the Accademia Bridge. Courteous, efficient staff and good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: solotraveler18938
Reviews.Content: I spent a short quick getaway weekend in Venice in December 2011. I picked the Hotel American Dinesen based on reviews in tripadvisor and wasn't disappointed. Venice hotels can be pretty expensive and shabby (this was my 3rd trip). The Hotel American Dinesen provided a nice, well decorated modern decent sized room in a pleasant centrally located area. Location was a couple minutes walk across the Accademia bridge. The Peggy Guggenheim museum is a couple minutes walk further. Breakfast was nice (typical cold continental but good), staff was very friendly and helpful, and it even offered free wifi. I've paid quite a bit more for less nice rooms in Venice. This hotel is great find and I wholeheartedly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: manlyloft
Reviews.Content: My sister and 2 daughters and I saty in the family room, which we found to be very clean and comfortable, The modern bathroom had all the toiletries you need, and Elly love the bidet! The room was warm and we didn't know how to turn it off at night, so we slept with the window open, (sorry), but this made waking up to the most amazing sound of all the church bells tolling at 7am. The most wonderful sound to wake up to! We were greeted by very friendly staff, who took the time to greet you properly and helpfull in finding the best restaurants within walking distance. The porter carried our cases and came back with a complimentary bottle of bubbly, thankyou!!!! Finally the breakfast was fantastic, and catered all our needs and a great start to the day, even fresh coffee! Swiss Cheese and delicious Ham, fresh fruit salad, pastries and cereals, etc! Would highly recommend staying here! Oh and Venice breathtaking! Take the public Ferry to your destination, as it takes you the length of the canel for 6.5 euro's and is the best way to see Venice from the water. Winter Cold didn't allow us to do the Gondala's. From Sally Burnes, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “So quiet in a very busy city”
Reviews.Author: Rob T
Reviews.Content: Our selection of this hotel was based purely on its location and its reviews. And we were not disappointed, the hotel deserved its rating if not a liitle higher. We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel American Dinesen and loved every minute of it. Our room had a little balcony with flowers hanging over its railing, which overlooked the canal in front of the hotel, this was pure Venice. You could not beat the location, room and staff. The location was incredible, for a hotel to placed in such a great position in such a vibrant city, it was so quiet. 10 out 10 in our book.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: brendan75
Reviews.Content: Reception staff were very friendly and helpfull,breakfast was good,great location about 15 mins walk to st marks square.Theres a sky decoder box in the bedroom but it only has mostly news stations on it.room is fine and the bathroom is modern

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ItalyfanNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 3 nights at the American Dinesen Hotel in Venice in early November, 2010, and it met (and surpassed) our every expectation. It had been recommended by a usually-demanding friend who had stayed there 2 years ago. We had a superior double room with a delightful canal view at a very fair price. The street and canal were very quiet, important as we are light sleepers. The room, though not large, was comfortable and very nicely decorated and kept immaculately clean by the very friendly cleaning staff. The front desk personnel were likewise pleasant and helpful, rendering assistance using the lounge's computer internet and printer and with recommendations of excellent nearby restaurants. The breakfast buffet was superb, with a myriad of choices from cereals to cold meats and cheeses, fruit, yogurt, juices, breads and croissants, etc. The hotel is very close to the Accademia Bridge, the Accademia vaporetto stop, the Accademia gallery itself, and the Peggy Guggenheim museum. We will gladly book a room there on our next trip to Venice. Bravi tutti!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ValueTravler3
Reviews.Content: Great location - close to transportation, sights, safe ATM and food. Breakfast ample, good quality of food, and varied. Helpful staff - some more helpful than others. Room small but to be expected. Bathroom unexpectedly spacious and modern. Wonderful to take water taxi to hotel door and not to have to haul luggage around. Loved the terraces. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good, some annoying bits”
Reviews.Author: needtoholiday
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic - in the arty, museum district of dosoduro. Even if not an art buff, the gallery displays make for an interestingly and delightful walk to the hotel from the vapouretta stop, which is only a few minutes walk away. We stayed in the new dinesen apartments which were modern, new and very comfortable and stylish. So in terms of the things that matter in a hotel, room and location, couldn't reccomend more highly. Just a few annoying things, which the hotel could improve on: - There was no lift, so we had to lug our bags up 2 floors. - Breakfast is cold continental only. Choice was limited, coffe was bad and fruit salad not refilled. Go to a local cafe instead. - They have this silly system where they don't give you the key. Have to go to reception, everytime we want to go to our room. Sounds fine in theory, but many times we had to wait for more than 5 minutes for someone at reception - we closed thw windows and house keeping always opened them back up - letting in mozzies

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel in excellent location, with a lovely breakfast”
Reviews.Author: valise
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a small side canal that runs between Zattere and the Grand Canal, in the quiet and charming Dorsoduro section. It is a few minutes walk from the Accademia vaporetto stop and the Accademia bridge, making it very accessible for anywhere you might want to go in Venice. I took the Alilaguna waterbus from the airport and it is a straighforward walk from the Zattere stop to the hotel, with a only a ramped bridge to cross. It is a notably pretty hotel from the outside, painted a warm yellow with flower filled window boxes. Inside, the decor is fairly ornate. I had a room on the first floor (ie the one above the entrance floor) - although there is no elevator, there is a porter to carry bags up the not very steep staircase. My room was small but adequate - it was a single, with a single bed, but I saw into the double next door in passing and that looked generally more spacious. It was adequate to my needs, with a sweet little balcony that had a side view onto the canal. The bed was quite firm, which I prefer, but those who like softer beds should enquire about whether they have variations. Although I had neighbours either side, I did not experience any sound from them or from outside the hotel - something that is very important for my sleep! The bathroom was modern and sparklingly clean, with a decent sized, 'proper' shower cubicle. The housekeeping was generally very good (especially the bathroom) but I thought the carpet in the bedroom (although vacuumed throughly) was due for an end of season shampoo - my only slightly negative thought about the whole experience. A very fresh and generous breakfast buffet was served in a room behind the small lounge area - a wide choice of breads, pastries, cereals, meats and cheeses, and juices with a big bowl of fresh (no tins) fruit salad . The friendly serving staff remembered beverage orders after the first morning. There is a PC available for free guest use in the reception area ( you have to obtain a code from reception) The reception staff are multilingual and very professional. My overall impression is of a professionally run hotel in a very good location, offering good value for money - I booked through the hotel's own website which offers a good discount for stays over 3 days. I had been looking at cheaper hotels, but the discount brought the price down to that charged by lesser hotel. I would recommend this hotel and choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No hesitation in recommending the Hotel American Dinesen”
Reviews.Author: iain029
Reviews.Content: Just spent four very enjoyable days in Venice staying at American Dinesen hotel. The hotel is ideally located overlooking a small canal only afew minutes walk from the Accademia Bridge and Vaporetto stop.The accommodation was excellent ,with clean comfortable rooms,very good breakfast facilities and very friendly and helpful staff.There are reasonable restaurants in the area but if you want to be more adventurous,then St Marks Square vicinity is easily reached .

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable city...& hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patricia838
Reviews.Content: Just spent twelve nights at the American Dinesen Hotel in Venice, Italy. My husband and I have been to Venice a dozen times. Until now, we have not found a hotel where we wanted to return. This hotel, is without a doubt, a well-kept secret. Small, elegant, lovely, beautifully maintained, well-located without the crowds. We are already thinking about our next trip and will definitely plan ahead so we are able to stay at the American Dinesen. Our room was on the second floor, overlooking the canal. I am an extremely persnickety lady who highly recommends this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ppmmeijer
Reviews.Content: We had wonderfull suites with canalview. The rooms were nice and clean. The only thing I missed in the room was a coffee and teamaker. Most of the hotels (3*) I've been to, have this nowadays. The beds are hard and so are the cushions. If you have breakfast here make sure you eat before 8.30, after this time the big bowl with fresh fruitsalat is finished and they won't fill it up. We were late starters (9.30) so no fruit for us except the last day we were leaving and eating early. You can use the computer in the lounge and internet for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Gem1966
Reviews.Content: The staff here are really helpful, and the location is great â€“ close enough to some of the main tourist sites, but not in the thick of it, so itâ€™s quiet too. If there are a few people in your group, do consider booking one of the apartments, which are located right next to the main hotel building. We stayed in apartments 2 & 3, which are different in size, no matter what the website says. One sleeps 4 (max 6), the other 2 (max 4). The restaurant 2 doors down is great.

Reviews.Title: “A small gem in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Skyetop
Reviews.Content: This hotel was all that we expected for our stay in Venice. The (private) water taxi took us right to the door of the hotel, which was a welcome treat after the trek from the airport to the water taxi location. The staff was helpful and attentive with the exception of one woman at the reception desk who continually gave us wrong information. The rooms, as small as we expected, were spotless and had plenty of storage space so we could totally unpack. Breakfast was enough to satisfy the heartiest eaters. Our only complaint was the very sporadic wireless service, but we were able to use a computer in the lobby as needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: DanielleBoston
Reviews.Content: The Hotel American Dinesen was a great find. It is in a great location- close to the Academia Bridge/stop and still in a quiet location. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They were able to put up with our large group with a smile on their face. The rooms where nicely decorated in a Venetian style and very spacious for the European standard. The breakfast was delicious. We (a group of 9) had no complaints. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty and comfortable hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: SafetymanUK
Reviews.Content: We paid a little extra to get a canal view and got exactly what we asked for with a balcony and as the weather was great it was nice to sit out in the evening. The only problem was that the balconies are typically so small you have to do it in shifts as they only fit on chair and a table. The room too was a little small but again this is typical but it was very clean and comfortable and beautifully decorated in a traditional venetian style and the mini bar prices were cheaper than the cafe and bar prices which was a bonus. All the staff were helpful and efficient. The breakfast was a continental buffet and varied enough to suit most tastes. There is access to a computer and the internet available in the foyer but it is widely used so you may have to wait to use it. The location of the hotel is one of the main reasons we booked it. It is close enough to a vaporetta stop to be able to walk with your suitcases. The hotel also has it's own jetty so if you want to take a water taxi they can stop outside the door but this will cost around 95 Euros if you take one to or from the airport but if there is a group this may be cost effective way of travelling - the vaporetta is 13 euros each. There are also usually gondolas for hire just outside the hotel as well. The hotel is in the Dorsoduro part of the city which is the other side of the grand canal from most of the tourist spots but still within relatively easy walking distance and ther nearest bridge across the canal is only around 100 metres away. Being away from the crowds does also make it much quieter which is what we prefer. There is a restaurant right next door if you don't want to stray far for food although it is a little pricey but many more are within easy reach expecially along the waterfront looking out across Canale della Guidecca. The hotel is a little expensive compared to some 3 star hotels in Venice but we felt it was still reasonable value for money and would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet, and cozy describes this hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Readalot936
Reviews.Content: Great location in a quiet side canal, just steps from the Accademia Bridge and a few minutes walk to San Marco Plaza. Staff spoke excellent English and were very helpful. Our room with balcony was clean and had such extras as an in-room safe and free WiFi in our room as well as internet service in its public sitting room. The breakfast room was homey and food selection ranged from cereals, breads, fruit, meats and cheeses, and pastries. A free water taxi ride was provided for guests who wished to visit one of the Murano glass factories. This would be our 1st choice if we ever return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “AMERICAN DINESEN E PERFETO”
Reviews.Author: sotosf
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel in a fantastic place with fantastic staff in Venezia,what else would someone ask more of this. We have visit many places in Europe and usually we stay in 4 stars hotel but due the hotel prices in Venezia we choose a 3 star hotel but i think is like a 4 star. Our room was 109 just over the canal a romantic spacious clean room decorated in venetian style. The view was perfect and never mind for the small balconies there are nice too..... enerything is nice if you are in Venice. Elizabeta and Marco are very helpful and kind, sorry but i can\'t remeber the name of the man who works the nights in reception anyway thanks for all and thanks for all Bruno and Nicolleta too. AMERICAN DINESEN E PERFETTO.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: HENRY28970
Reviews.Content: Why on earth anyone going to Venice stays anywhere but Dorsoduro escapes me. Quiet, convenient, close to good restaurants, away from the madding crowds. Close to the Accadamia and other wonderful sights. Hotel is lovely, close to vaporetto, pleasant helpful staff, near good cafes for those who want to breakfast with the locals, immaculately clean.

Reviews.Title: “Just far enough off the beaten path.”
Reviews.Author: KelinSaratoga
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and comfortable and in the absolute perfect location for us (mom and teen daughter). It was within walking distance of everything, but far enough away from the hustle and bustle to be relaxing at the end of a long day of sight seeing. The front desk staff helped me with anything I asked of them. There is a lovely canal right outside the front door to catch a water taxi. The much less expensive water buses are about a 10 minute walk away. The breakfast was very basic but good, and the coffee was amazing! There were shops right around the corner for souvenirs, post cards, drinks, etc. I'm not terribly into the Victorian decor, but it seemed to fit the area and wasn't at all "old" but well thought out. The bathroom was TINY, but modern and super clean. The double room we had was also tiny, but comfortable and clean. A little creepy that the English TV channels were Fox News and MSNBC, but that was my biggest complaint, which I think says a lot! I certainly didn't go to Venice to watch TV!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, friendly and wonderful location. Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: philfran54
Reviews.Content: Real family feel to this friendly hotel. Staff were always helpful and the decor, location and ambience were delightful. Great breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “charming spot, great location”
Reviews.Author: Buzzie7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and found the hotel very pleasant. Our room had a tiny balcony, facing a quiet canal. the location, Dosoduro, is a wonderful area of Venice. You are near great museums and restaurants and a short walk or vaporetto to St. mark's. Yet. it is quiet and less touristic than being near Piazza San marco. We plan on returning. the staff was helpful, the breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “a super little hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: BrianG54
Reviews.Content: Have just spent a week in this great little hotel in magical Venice. We booked a "room with a view" which overlooked the little canal that runs past the hotel. Well worth the money for the view and ambiance - idyllic and very romantic. Room was very comfortable, very well prepared and kept spotless during our stay. Air-conditioning was effective and necessary. Breakfast room was terrific - comfortable, best of produce well presented and efficiently provided by helpful and polite staff. Management were most helpful, courteous and delightful to deal with. They genuinely cared that they were helping us to enjoy our holiday and did their best to see that we did just that. Hotel is in a great location in Venice, on a quiet peaceful rio just across the Grand Canal less than 5 mins. walk from Accademia bridge and vaporetta stop, which makes all the city sites very accessible yet leaving you with a delightful spot to come home to after the days sight-seeing. We have no hesitation in highly recommending this lovely hotel in an amazing city - and we even spent a hot sunny day lying relaxing on the beach at the Lido - quite feasible, even if you are in Venice! Go there and soak up the culture, the music, the history, the art and architecture, and the ambiance of a truly unique city - and stay in the Hotel American Dinesen for a great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “The Apartment Is A Fantastic Option”
Reviews.Author: ferndalemale
Reviews.Content: I came through with my fiance to show her venice and having been there before, I knew to stay well away from St. Marks, Rialto, etc as it is akin to being in the middle of Disney Land at peak season. The area around this hotel and the Academia is much less traveled, much more authentic, and really perfect for your stay. For those that don't know Venice, even if you stay here away from the tourists, you'll be able to walk to St. Marks in 10-15 min easy and perhaps a few moments more to Rialto. And because everything is so beautiful, you won't even know that you are walking. In any case, if you stay amongst the tourists you will be treated like tourists in that your hotel staff will have no patience for you, the food you eat will be standard fare at outrageous prices, and you will get the American experience of Venice as you are overrun by large crowds. It's everything you don't want. This hotel, on the other hand, is everything you do want. Close enough to walk easily to all of the major sites in Venice yet far enough not to be around obnoxious tourists. The area around the hotel is a student area or very close to it so the restaurants are good and much less expensive. And if you want a night life, something Venice mostly lacks, you are much closer to it staying around here. And this says nothing of the property itself. It's clean, the staff is friendly, and the apartments next door (just next door, close enough for the free wi-fi, don't worry) are a fantastic value. They area spacious and for almost the same price as a smaller room inside the hotel you get your own space. Breakfast isn't included in the apartments but if you want it you can pay a bit extra. All in all, this hotel and its staff live up to the recommendations. I am thrilled that we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, helpful staff at hotel in quiet, lovely location”
Reviews.Author: eatdrinkread
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in our clean, sparsely decorated apartment in a building next to the main hotel. What sets this hotel apart is the amazing staff! Upon our arrival, the bellhop showed us to our room. I feared that the fabric-upholstered walls would be harbingers of dust or mold that would bother my asthma. He immediately showed us an apartment with little upholstery that was perfect for our needs. The hotel rented it to us for the same cost as the room! We were amazed and amused that the same bellhop made our cappucini the next morning at breakfast, and later, helped fix our air conditioning. Similarly, Marco at the front desk answered somewhat esoteric questions about Venice off of the top of his head, and was there early in the morning until late in the evening. We highly recommend this hotel located on a small canal in the Dursoduro, a quiet area that we found a respite from the more packed, touristy areas of Venice. We also enjoyed the proximity to museums such as the Peggy Guggenheim Collection just around the corner, and the Accademia Galleria not much further away, as well as quality art galleries. I believe the location actually enhanced our trip to Venice. We had one complaint: we had trouble getting OUT of the front door of the apartment building. The lock there was tricky, and could potentially be a hazard if there was an emergency such as a fire. This problem would not be an issue to guests in the main hotel, however.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, canal-side hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SGordon217
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel American Dinesen for two nights in late August, our first stop on a 12-night, multi-city journey. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the canal below which was breathtaking. The room was nicely furnished and had a private and clean bathroom with a tub/shower. We liked the Dorsoduro location and being a 10-15 minute walk from the San Mark's crowds. The area was extremely quiet and peaceful at night. We enjoyed the Sky TV and free internet, the nice breakfast, and the restaurant recommendations from the gentleman at the front desk--Locanda Montin in particular is a must-visit. I definitely recommend staying at Hotel American Dinesen during your next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnneAsh
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here in July and would recommend this hotel to all. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were very comfortable. Breakfast was fine and a good start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: bostonbobby123
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my husband, mother and four children to Venice. The service was great, but the lack of an elevator was a problem. It was really hard for our whole family to carry our very large suitcases up to our room on the second floor. We had a triple room and a quad room. The quad room was great, but the triple room had a broken a/c. When we told the front desk, we were told that our a/c was broken because every other room was using its a/c. No a/c on 90 degree days was a bit of a problem. The breakfast was pretty good, and the service at breakfast was excellent. It was very quiet at night, and being in the neighborhood of Dorsoduro was great-- a very cute area. The walk to San Marco and Rialto is not too long. Overall, this was a pretty good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to end to our Italian adventure!”
Reviews.Author: WLH80
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I ended our travels through Italy in Venice, staying at Hotel American Dinesen. We stumbled upon the hotel on Trip Advisor and ended up so pleased with our experience! The hotel itself is very conveniently located, and Venice is super easy to get around, provided to allow yourself to wander and get lost. That's part of the whole experience. Our room was very spacious, modern, clean, and comfortable. The open room included a large hallway, beautiful bathroom, and huge bedroom with floor to ceiling windows. We shared a common area and outdoor patio with others, but we never saw them. Because it was the end of our trip, we were a bit lazy, sleeping in and lingering around the room. I think this says a lot about how comfortable and inviting Hotel American Dinesen is because I would not have just lounged around in any hotel room. The staff was very helpful and friendly. This hotel is family-owned, and we met the son who runs the place. He was absolutely fabulous, providing restaurant recommendations, gondola ride suggestions, advice for airport transportation. We were thrilled with this hotel, and you won't be disappointed either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: pixie_confusion
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day stay at the Hotel American in Dorsoduro and have only praise for it. The location is excellent, just a couple of minutes away from the Accademia vaporetto stop, yet in a quiet area in lovely Dorsoduro. We had a beautiful corner room with three balconies, two of them overlooking a lovely quiet canal and a glimpse of the grand canal from all three. The hotel is very clean and the breakfast is more than adequate. All in all, excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for the prices in Venice! And friendly staff. Sometimes a rarity in Italy.”
Reviews.Author: DementedPenguins
Reviews.Content: If you want friendly service, a good safe location, a clean room, and nice views- this is the place for you! We travelled from Rome to Torino to Venice to Greve and to Florence. After comparing service and accommodations, Hotel American Dinesen defintely is one of our top choices. Our only complaint is the bathroom tub that we had was only separated by glass that only covered 1/3 of the bath tub and the rest was open for water to roam freely. After each shower, our bathroom floor was pretty soaked. There was nothing they can do since it is by design and obviously a drain was in the middle of the bathroom for this purpose.

Reviews.Title: “In short - perfect”
Reviews.Author: HonzaCi
Reviews.Content: Will not replicate all the flattering reviews, I can only confirm them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: mardrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in one of the Hotel American-Dinesen Dependance apartments. These are on a room only basis. The 3 Dependence apartments have their own separate entrance that is down a small alley to the right of the hotel. Two of the apartments are on the ground level and there is one up a flight of stairs. (That's the one we had.) The apartments are done out in a modern style which suited our tastes perfectly. I especially liked the courtyard that the 3 apartments shared. It was so nice to go back and sit out in either in the evening or once we had done our day's sightseeing and before going out for dinner. (The pictures on the hotel's website do not show the lovely outdoor furniture that they have in the courtyard.) We found the hotel very easily from the vaporetta stop (and if we can do that then it must be easy!) and thought the location was perfect as the Academia vap stop that you got on/off at was midway between St Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. We would have no hesitation in recommending these apartments and if we ever to go Venice again then I'm certain we will stay in them again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Option”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Janakat
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a night We arrived late because of the boat transportation in Venice and asked for a late check out and they allowed us until 12!!! This was frustrating And way the money value for this hotel is very good and you donâ€™t need to hesitate to book this hotel

Reviews.Title: “One in a million! A gem!”
Reviews.Author: sugabtoronto
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending 3 nights in Venice and stayed at this wonderful hotel. It has a fabulous location - 5 minutes from the Academia, 5 minutes from the Guggenheim - 5 minutes from the Vaparetto stop. We found it easy to find. It is in a quiet district which was extremely appealing to us, away from the maddening crowds of Venice. Our room overlooked the canal, was well airconditioned (a necessity in the recent heat wave) and was a great size for a European room. The breakfast was delicious. What made it really terrific was the attentive staff and in particular Alessandro who gave us advice on where to shop for particular items as well as dinner recommendations in the area (and has a great dog!). Would we go back - absolutely! This is a hotel which really made our stay in Venice magical.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: newsak
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the American-Dinesen was wonderful. The hotel is located in a quieter area of Venice, but within easy walking distance to all the major attractions. It was HOT when we visited and really enjoyed the cold air conditioned room. At night it was quiet, cool, and we slept soundly. The breakfast offered was your typical european style and was sufficient and filling. The staff was very helpful and pleasant, and the room was clean. We chose a superior room overlooking the canal and we were happy with our decision. The room is not very large, but this is to be expected in Europe. We were hardly in our room except to sleep so it was fine. I loved taking the water taxi from the train station and getting delivered right to our hotel via the canal. Being it was our first trip to Venice, it was a wow experience! I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Venetian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: csg
Reviews.Content: Hotel American Dinesen was a very clean, quiet hotel with a very good and helpful staff. The location was hard to find the first time, but after we got our bearings, it was easier. (It is actually pretty near the Academia ferry stop). There was free internet and free breakfast which was plentiful and tasty. The hotel was nice and quiet, and we slept well. I had not been to Venice in many years and I enjoyed seeing it again. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, should I return.

Reviews.Title: “Great to go back”
Reviews.Author: ASherriff
Reviews.Content: We recently returned to the Hotel American having stayed there last year. My daughter and her partner discovered it the year before and recommended it to us. We had a double superior canal view room and it was beautifully furnished and very clean. Worth the extra for the view of the San Vio canal. The staff are all very friendly and helpful and speak good english. It was like coming home. The buffet breakfast is extremely good and although they do not serve evening meals there are plenty of restaurants nearby - several on the Zattere with lovely views across to Giudecca Island and our favourite, Ristorante San Travoso ( there is also a Taverna San Trovaso not too far away ). The Hotel is extremely well situated, being so close to the Accedemia bridge with the Peggy Guggenheim museum near by and also the Accedemia Gallery. It is also handy for the airport and you can get the Alilaguna boat to Zattere for 25 euros return. The surrounding area is tranquil compared to the crowds that you get around the Rialto bridge and St Marks Square. The webcam is on our browser favourites and we regularly look in to see how the weather is over there. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and hope that we can return soon. The GBP is finally improving against the euro !

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tambo_10
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through TripAdvisor and found it lived up to our expectations. It was very well located out of the tourist area but within 5 minutes walk of the Acedemia bridge and Vaperetto stop. We stayed in Apartment 1 for a week so can't comment on the hotel rooms, breakfast or other hotel facilities. But the apartment was just what we wanted and the hotel staff were very good. Someone said eating was a problem in this area. We didn't find it so with a lot of choice at the lower end which, in Venice we think is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel provided one of the capstone experiences of our vacation in Italy.”
Reviews.Author: jj3948
Reviews.Content: We spent three glorious days in Venice, and the Hotel American Dinesen was a wonderful home base for us. It was located on a smaller, quieter canal, which made for a more restful experience. We were very glad we opted for the balcony with the canal view as it provided a pleasant, scenic experience. The room was clean and perfect for us. The breakfasts were delicious. Most of all, though, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We spent more for this hotel room than we did in Milan or Florence or Rome or Ravenna, but it was worth it. Thanks to everyone at the hotel who helped make our stay in Venice a truly marvelous and memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room, good amenities”
Reviews.Author: MelvinaSt.Louis
Reviews.Content: We were to stay here two nights, but due to a missed connection (thanks, US Air) we were only here one night. Will definitely return. The location is ideal, in a quiet neighborhood. Booking a canal view was so worth it, we had a great view and really enjoyed watching the "traffic" go by. Enjoyed the free wi fi and the american styled hairdryer. Breakfast was good, with great coffee! The staff here were the friendliest of our trip. Our room for our boys wa slightly smaller, but still nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Venice in everyway”
Reviews.Author: Halifaxduo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderfully located in a quiet neighbourhood in elegant Dorsoduo. Away from the maddening crowds of San Marco. It is on a small, pretty, working canal. Neighbours chat to each other across the canal.Locals walk their dogs, children play. In the mornings you will see the laundry boat arrive at the hotel. We even saw a backhoe ...ON a boat and one day the garbage boat. This is the real Venice - yet just an enjoyable walk away you can be in the midst of the must-see venues of San Marco. Once the mandatory visits there, try hanging out in the quiet calles and campos of Dorsoduro. Explore beyond Accademia Bridge deep into Dorsoduro to uncover its daily life. Encounter centuries-old community wells in delightful uncrowded campos. Leave the tourists behind, walk down your canal to the Zatterre- turn left for a stroll to Dogana and the Salute. Closer to the hotel, do not be surprised to find that Campo San Vio is under construction with one building shrouded due to restoration. It is Venice so embrace the sights of restoration. It is part of the culture, the way of life. The immediate neighbourhood around San Vio offers local shops and the fabulous Ristarante Storico. It is peaceful and fascinating to 'join' the neighbourhood for a few days whilst staying at this charmingly elegant hotel. There is even a neighbourhood gondalier. Alexandre is usually tied up by the foot bridge across from the hotel. I highly rcommend that you take a gondola ride with him. He speaks English very well and he does a great tour which takes you across the Grand Canal to smaller interesting quaint canals. Again, he is also apart of the neighbourhood charisma. The location is a big asset..however there is even more to enjoy. Please ensure that you splurge for a canal-view room. We did and we were delighted with the value for the investment in doing so. We got just what we had requested. at the time of booking. Canal room with King bed. We had a a lovely corner room which had three window/doors onto balconies.The room is Italy-sized however it comfortably accomodated the full King bed-a comfy one indeed, Shutters and black-out curtains make for a sound sleep. When just hanging out in the room, it was so fun to be on the balconies or lie on the bed with windows open to the sounds of the canal neighbourhood and the lapping of water. The furniture was pretty and functional.There was lots of storage space. One feels totally imersed in Venice whilst still inthe room Service was top-notch - front desk, housekeeping and breakfast room staff all provided warm and professional service. eg) front desk staff were VERY helpful with all water taxi arrangements both arriving and departing; helpful tips on mask shops just a few calles away; breakfast staff even remembered our beverage preferences; and everyone always seemed to know us and our room number.High calibre service from professionals who cared about the guests well-being and contentment. Fron start to finish this hotel ensured that our stay in Venice was spectacular and memorable. Highly recommended in everyway.I so enjoyed this hotel that I am happy to discuss further details which I was unable to squeeze into this review.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, with easy access to the best of Venice”
Reviews.Author: cgeorgeBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this charming hotel, which has a very helpful waitstaff. It is convienently located only a 5 minute walk from the Accademia vapporetto stop (public transport system). The rooms are lovely with comfortable beds and sparkling (I'm assuming newly renovated) bathrooms. The breakfast is great, with a good variety of foods and beverages every morning. The location is very convienent, but is located on a side canal "street", so it didn't feel like we were overrun by other tourists, and it was quiet at night. Unlike areas closer to the Rialto and St. Mark's. Stay here if you go to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel ... Location Close to the Action, but In a Quiet Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: mgmcpa
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at the Hotel American in Venice and it is still perfection. The rooms, while small, are well equipped with extras like free wi-fi, American-style hair dryers, extra pillows and even an American-style plug for your razor in the bathroom. We paid the extra for the Superior Canal View room and it was worth it. We had two balconies, one on the front of the building, and another looking down the canal away from the Grand Canal. The windows all have shutters to keep out sound and light, so we easily slept in each day and didn't wake up from the constuction down the canal since we couldn't hear it. Beds are the typical two twins put together, but quality was good. Decor is typical tacky/over-the-top Venice style, but that's what you need when staying in Venice. The walk to the Accademia bridge is short (two minutes walk and only one foot bridge), so you are very close to a main bus stop. Neighborhood is the art area, so very quiet and not as touristy, but still super close to the main action across the Grand Canal. We spent 4 nights here this trip and were thrilled by the location and service we received.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel, in one of the best locations in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: NPG25
Reviews.Content: My husband had a week-long international meeting, Oceans from Space, held in Venice every ten years since 1980, when we stayed at the Hotel American. Different city locations in 1990 and 2000 prompted different hotel choices. However, this year we wanted to return to the Hotel American, despite a longish walk to the meeting--an excellent decision. We were warmly greeted as returning guests (after 30 years!) and were permitted an early check-in. The room was not large but well appointed and large enough for two tall people and luggage, and the bathroom was a welcome more modern space than our 1980 bathroom. Breakfast was a treat--wonderful coffee, cheerful service, a wide choice of food. The location is great--near to restaurants and places you might want to explore, but on a relatively quiet street and canal. We recommend it enthusiastically and would gladly stay there again. (Among other good points, we were able to reserve a nonsmoking room, and the beds were firm.)

Reviews.Title: “Near Everything Except The Crowds!”
Reviews.Author: onero
Reviews.Content: My step-father, Australian artist Graeme Inson, discovered this hotel on a painting trip to Venice, and since he always researched his hotels carefully, I decided to give it a try when I followed his route a decade later. I'm glad I did. The Hotel American Dinesen is located in the picturesque Dorsoduro area, beside the San Vio canal (which runs off the Grand Canal, just after the Accademia vaporetto stop.) It is very easy to reach. When you arrive at Venice Santa Lucia railway station, walk straight out the front to the Grand Canal, where you will find a booth selling tickets for the Vaporetto (small passenger ferries that carry people up and down the Grand Canal and around the island.) Buy a Vaporetto ticket (it is cheaper to buy a three-day ticket if you're staying that long) and look for a Vaporetto going to the Accademia stop. Each Vaporetto has a destination board, so it's not hard to work out where they stop. Accademia is the third bridge along the Grand Canal (takes about 15 minutes pleasant cruising down the Grand Canal to reach it) and you'll recognise it as you approach because it is the only bridge across the Grand Canal made of wood. Get off the Vaporetto at Accademia, and walk left, right, and left again, and you'll see 100 yards in front of you a small white marble arched bridge crossing the San Vio Canal. Cross this bridge and turn right, and you will see the Hotel American in front of you! Easy! The walk from Vaporetto stop to Hotel takes two minutes, so you are really close to the main transport up and down the Grand Canal and to all the sights, but just a little away from all the crowds. This is good for two reasons. First, the area is quieter ... the million-odd tourists who visit Venice every day don't really venture into Dorsoduro. Second, the rooms in hotels hereabouts tend to be larger and less expensive than hotels closer to the Rialto Bridge or St Mark's Square. So Dorsoduro is a great suburb to stay in, and it has some great restaurants, like the Ristorante San Trovaso which is our favourite. The Hotel American Dinesen is actually two 18th Century buildings linked by an overhead bridge. The rooms are large, and many have baths, and overall they felt fresh and clean and attractive. Each of the front rooms has a small balcony overlooking the San Vio canal (see photos). The hotel serves breakfast in a front room each morning, and has a free internet service. A short walk outside brings you to the Accademia museum and the Peggy Guggenheim foundation and lots of other interesting sights along the Grand Canal. It's great fun exploring the little canals and laneways; bridges, shops, restaurants, palaces, churches and sights from here. You can also reach both the Piazza San Marco and the Rialto Bridge on foot or by Vaporetto (they run from Accademia every few minutes.) We booked a front room with canal view by email and had no problem whatsoever. The staff were friendly, the location was ideal for us, and we will be staying here again whenever we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Staff went out of their way.”
Reviews.Author: srhs1961
Reviews.Content: We stayed a the Hotel American Dinesen March 30 and 31, 2010. There were six of us traveling and two were teenage girls. The hotel was charming and in a quiet area where we could relax after our busy days in Venice. The hotel was very close to the Acadamia Bridge so walking to St. Mark's or taking the water taxi were both easy options. Our granddaughters were using the free internet in the room next to the lobby one night and we overheard the staff talking to people who could not locate the hotel. It was easy to locate for us but we arrived during daylight and this family was having problems finding the hotel in the dark and because of a language barrier. One of the desk clerks left the hotel and actually went and found the family and brought them to the hotel. It was a large group including 3 young children and we were so impressed with the staff for going out of their way to get them to the hotel. The hotels rooms were very clean, breakfast was very good, the desk clerks (night and day) were very helpful, the area around the hotel was safe and the lobby and breakfast rooms were very inviting.. We had a great stay at Hotel American Dinesen and some great memories were made for our granddaughters 16th birthday trip. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “courteous staff, excellent location, quiet, and attractive rooms”
Reviews.Author: Alan4x4
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are courteous, and the rooms are very quiet and attractive. My wife and I have stayed 4-5 times in the past several years. The location is great - near the Accademia Bridge and vaporetto stops. This is why we keep returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous view, wonderful repose, a great place to call home while on the road.”
Reviews.Author: nonamevirginia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the canal view rooms and i was very much worth the extra few dollars. We had floor to ceiling windows on two sides with a view of the local canal as well as the grand canal. The location is very quiet and very close to several of the vaparetto stops but you can really walk anywhere you need to in a few minutes. The beds were firm and the room was very good size. The breakfast was fine and the staff was very helpful with recommendations. A don't miss is the opera in three acts in the private palazzo!

Reviews.Title: “A beutiful hotel in the best location imaginable.”
Reviews.Author: dannja22
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a balcony overlooking a canal. Make sure you ask for one of those rooms; you won't regret it. The room was clean and very roomy; they offerred a avery nice breakfast. The location is right next to the Academia; across the bridge you are a pleasant 15-minute walk to San Marco. The view from our room was wonderful. The staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly family hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: milliej27
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a holiday here with our daughters aged 5 and 8, which overlapped with the end of the busy Carnival festival in Venice. We took one of the three apartments which are part of this hotel, consisting of a galleried area with double bed, kitchenette (hob, fridge, freezer), shower and further sleeping for 2 on sofabed. This is a fantastic solution for a young family - offering the flexibility, and economy of feeding ourselves (there is a supermarket within 10 mins walk), instead of eating all our meals out in this expensive city. The location is perfect - a quiet street away from all the hustle of the main tourist centre, yet less than 5 mins walk from the Accademia, 15 mins from St Marks square, and convenient for both Accademia and Zattere vaporetto stops. The staff could not have been more welcoming or responsive, and the apartment was serviced every day and kept spotlessly clean. We got an excellent rate booking direct with the hotel - and all in all felt this was a holiday to remember for all the right reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: Austraveller1111
Reviews.Content: We loved every moment from our arrival at the front door by water taxi. Room was splendidly furnished and more spacious than we had anticipated (tho' bathroom was small). Breakfast had a huge choice. Staff were smiling and helpful, particularly Marco at the front desk and the lady providing coffee at breakfast. Recommended restaurants were just what we wanted. Hotel was in a quiet canal side location yet very close to everything. The "aqua ulta" caused floods but the hotel even had loan galoshes or boots for that. All in all an excellent package and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem... and more than that!!”
Reviews.Author: rockmedude
Reviews.Content: Were to start.... as I arrive they tell me they are not going to give me the room I reserved... and instead this friendly man tell me he will upgrade me.... then I'm hungry.... he recommends me an awesome out of the path place that was delicious... then I wanted to see the landmarks... and you can walk almost to every remarkable place.... This hotel is a gem and more.... When back in Venice this will be among my options....

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Carcaru
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, the bathroom very new and clean, and the rest of facilities were clean and with nice decoration. Also the breakfast was good and staff were very kind with us. The Hotel is located a 10 minutes walking from St. Mark square, very quiet place and very near from the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: marcopapallo
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was clean and nice BUT the staff were disgusting, extremely rude and unhelpful. Venice is an amazing, beautiful place The staff at this establishment ruined it. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable hotel and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: FernandaThome
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very quiet location with a beautiful view to a small canal and 15 minute walk distance to Piazza San Marco (main attraction). The room is big and confortable however I'm not so fan of the scandalous wallpaper and carpet. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Merveilleux!!!”
Reviews.Author: lenglaise
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated at a 15 minute walk from St Marc's Square & 10 minutes from the Rialto Bridge. The hotel is lovely, cosy & decorated in a venetian style. The corridors & stairways are decorated with Murano glass mirrors & light-fittings, beautiful! The staff are very friendly & helpful. My husband, my 4 chidren (ages 4, 11, 13, 17) & myself spent a wonderful few days in Venice & were made to feel really at home in the hotel. Loads of Thanks to all the Staff. We will definately come again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the best part of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Robin-Towns
Reviews.Content: To say that the new apartments give you the best of both worlds - independence yet the breakfast & other facilities of the Hotel - is an understatement. I hesitate to praise too much for fear of exciting interest & uncreasing the number of people with whom I shall have to do battle next time to book an apartment! Truly marvellous with no black marks. Unique qualities: Location, friendly helpful staff, cleanliness, accessibility. One of the best hotels in the best part of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bderk
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here in Oct 2008. Great location in Dorsoduro on a side canal. Very clean room. Nice breakfast/eating area and very helpful staff. Spent a nice evening on a rooftop sitting area. Would definitiely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My first full 5 star review and they deserve it!”
Reviews.Author: Clea700
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. We arrived really early from the night train from Munich (we had very little sleep as it was such a bad trip!) so we were so glad that our room was available to check into straight away. The man at the front was always friendly and helpful, the room was on the 1st floor overlooking the canal and the room was HUGE. It's right near the Accedemia bridge so it's really convenient to get to the touristy areas only a 10 minute walk away. The breakfast is hearty and filling (croissants, ham, cheese, salami, cereal, bread rolls and toast) and the breakfast lady was helpful and friendly. We had no noise at night and the hotel has free wifi (although it does require you to log in each time you come back which got annoying.) Would definitely stay here again - strongly recommend you book early and request a canal view room as this hotel is very popular and some of the rooms are smaller.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable, cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrselett
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights. We booked directly through their website and got a pretty good rate for a canal view. In my correspondence with them, I'd requested to have a room with multiple balconies, as I'd read about these rooms on Trip Advisor. They did not disappoint. We had one on the side, where you could see the grand canal in the distance and two that faced the small canal. The people at the hotel were great. We arrived before 10 am..well before check in. They were able to accomodate us within an hour of arrival. They made reservations for us, made recommendations and were just pleasant overall. There's a computer in the lobby with complimentary web access. The rooms were pretty standard for Europe. They had air conditioning that worked very well. The breakfast room was nice and spacious. The breakfast in the morning was good to tide you over for lunch. The coffees were great! I would recommend others stay at this hotel. It was so convenient and in a great location. My only complaint would be that the beds are way too firm for our taste. Be sure to try Ristorante San Trovasco in Dorsoduro...about 3 blocks from the hotel. Itâ€™s has a lovely courtyard and indoor seating. It was the most delicious, yet the least expensive meal of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NickyU
