Reviews.Content: We visited here for 3 nights with our two teenage girls. The hotel is located on a really pretty canal, which had a restaurant next door, but was really quiet as well. We had a family room which was really big, for Venice, and had a well appointed modern, but small, bathroom. Breakfast was very good, with very attentive staff. We found it good value as we got a good deal through Expedia, but can see that usually it is expensive. With the Euro being strong at present, don't expect to find anywhere cheap to eat in Venice. There was a supermarket relatively close to the hotel which was useful for drinks etc. All in all we really enjoyed our short break, hope to visit again someday.

Reviews.Title: “clean and quiet room , nice location”
Reviews.Author: kouroshmo
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed there between 25 to 27 Sep. 2009 . The location was so nice near accademia bridge and good location for walking toward Rialto Bridge , Pizza St. MArco Lots of restaurants nearby . The hotel has good staff that give you all useful information you need .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jamo9
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a very good location with access to the Water Taxis. Our room, which overlooked the canal was great and the service and breakfast was excellent. The Hotel is in a quiet location but close to the Accademia Bridge. We will definitely stay there again. Barbara J

Reviews.Title: “Great location with very comfortable lodging.”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaCdntraveller
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was very good. It was located very close to the water buses and walking distance to St. Mark's Square. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Breakfast was tasty with a large selection of items. Service was prompt and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Well located but disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: frogntoad75
Reviews.Content: The hotel was disappointing. We were shown to a room on the top floor (no elevator) that was stuffy even before the employee carried our 2 heavy bags up the stairs, leaving a cloud of sweat behind. It was also not well appointed, with dingy drapery and bedspread. But, the person at the front desk was always pleasant and helpful and the location was excellent. Breakfast buffet was adequate, but had the only bad coffee I had during the whole time in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: ice_rider
Reviews.Content: We did our research and decided to stay at this hotel for four nights. We had a wonderful time. We arrived by train, and took a water taxi here. We were given a beautiful room with a canal view. Our room had three little balconies (enough room for 2 chairs, so perfect to sit out and watch the world go by!) and was airy and bright. The staff were friendly and professional. Breakfast every morning was well-organized and had a plentiful selection. We just loved the area -- close enough to the Accademia bridge to be able to walk to the action, yet far enough away to still be quiet and largely residential. We simply loved our time in Venice -- to our right, a view of the Grand Canal, in front of us a beautiful home across the little canal, and to our left the Giudecca -- where we would walk down to the Zattere and sit watching the ferries chug by and the locals wheel their cases down to the grocery store (very handy). We are boaters, and, as such, loved the very concept of Venice. We will return, and when we do we will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect and peaceful place to stay in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: carspa
Reviews.Content: Wow! We booked this trip as a belated 40th birthday treat and requested a good room. We were not disappointed-the room was perfect. Decorated in traditional venetian style but with all the mod cons we required (and spotlessly clean)! The view over the canal was gorgeous and the location couldn't have been better for us, being peacefully situated yet only a short walk to the many attractions of Venice. The main thing I must mention is the friendliness and efficiency of the staff (even late at night when we ordered wine for our room). The breakfasts are great, with a large selection to cater for every palate, and again, the staff are lovely. For us, it really was the perfect place to stay, and I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Foxboro1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay in Venice at this hotel. We had a large superior double room with an excellent side canal view (Room 301). We really loved this place and its location. It was a bit further from St. Marks than we expected but still an easy 15 minute walk. There is a great affordable supermarket nearby with excellent wine prices, just ask for directions at the front desk. Breakfast was decent and included. The staff were very helpful but not overly friendly, no problem. I would reccomend the private taxi to the airport at the end of your stay, it is 95 euro but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in great neighborhood of venice, italy”
Reviews.Author: jazzmiles
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at the American hotel in Dorsoduro section of Venice. I recommened it. IT's got nice rooms, great atmosphere, extremely nice and helpful front desk staff, and wonderful location right on a small canal very close to the Academia ferry stop in Venice. The free breakfast is very good. The price was also very reasonable, around 175 euros per night for two twin beds. I stayed there with my 11 year old son, and everyone was friendly to him. There is also a Yamaha upright piano in one of the hallways, always important to us, as we're both musicians.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Location”
Reviews.Author: inchkenneth
Reviews.Content: Canal view (with a peek at the Grand Canal) at a reasonable price. Convenient location. Good service.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jim148
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel in Venice we stayed in during a trip to Italy so I had another similary priced hotel for comparison. This hotel was great and very easy to find, the decoration of the hotel and room was lovely. The room was also a great size (standard room). Staff were very welcoming and friendly and the breakfast was typical but nice (lots of fruit as well).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travelbeebuzz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel American for 3 nights and thought it was wonderful. The location was perfect - especially when arriving, it was only a 5 minute walk from the Alilaguna stop at Zattere and very easy to find. It was near the common tourists spots: San Marco and Accademia - the former was a 20min walk away which was a really pretty walk (although doing in the middle of the day meant battling with the rest of the tourist crowd!) but could also be easily reached via vaporetto from Accademia (5 min walk from the hotel) or Zattere. The rooms were lovely and the one I booked was a standard double room. Although it didn't have a direct view of the canal, you could see if by leaning a bit out of the window - and it was probably quieter at night being off the canal anyway! The room was beautiful, a great size and was well furnished with no signs of wear and tear. It was very clean and the staff cleaned it each day - making it look perfect each time I came back from a busy day of sightseeing. The airconditioning was bliss since the temperatures were 28-30C each day I was there. I didn't have a problem with mosquitos like some others have mentioned, but apparently I was there at the good time (according to others I've spoken with!). The TV in the room (with lots of english channels - or at least channels that could be changed to english) and free WiFi were definitely welcome! The staff were welcoming - the front desk staff weren't as welcoming as I was expecting - however they did answer all of my questions and after a day or so were lovely. The breakfast staff were very efficient and the cleaners did a brilliant job. Breakfast was good - I think it was pretty standard fare but gave you a good start to a busy day of walking around the city! I'd definitely come back - and as an incentive, they give a "Fidelity Card" when you check out - with 10-15% savings for your next visit - I'd use it but it wouldn't be the reason I'd come back - the real reason was because it was a great 3 star hotel that couldn't be faulted!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MBColumbus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located - it is on the quiet, neighborhood area of Dorsoduro which is across the Grand Canal from the tourist sections, yet is a two minute walk to the Accademia Bridge and Museum, and to the Peggy Guggenheim Museum. It is about a ten minute walk to St. Mark's Square and the Doges Palace, through interesting alley ways and piazzas and across several delightful footbridges. Our room had a private balcony overlooking the canal, and it too romantic for words. The staff is attentive and helpful, breakfast was good (especially the croissants), the rooms were clean and the air conditioning worked well. My husband arranged with the hotel to have fresh flowers in the room when we arrived - a perfect touch of Venetian romance. There are several very good ristorantes within a two minute walk, as well as gelaterias and neighborhood churches. I am eager to return!

Reviews.Title: “nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Jim050
Reviews.Content: We don't have that much to add to other reviews, (we liked this place- friendly/helpful staff, great location, etc.), other than to say, with the name American Dinesan, and all the positive reviews here, the hotel attracts a clientele that is, well, mostly American. Which can be a positive, or a negative, depending upon how you look at it. The lack of a lift/elevator was a bit of a disadvantage; the provision of free WiFi was a distinct advantage (not a given in Italy). We should also point out that, out of all the hotels we stayed at in Italy (Rome, Venice, Cinque Terre, Menaggio, Milan), this was the most expensive. Overall, we'd recommend American Dinesan, especially for first-timers, but we'd also want to explore a few other options on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “A real jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: RCKOttawa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best kept secrets of Venice. It's a small, beautiful hotel. I was traveling with family. The location is excellent, very close to the point Academia Bridge. The staff was excellent, friendly, and accommodating. It's 15 minutes walk St. Mark's Square and most other locations in Venice. From the moment we arrived the hotel felt homey and comfortable. It was very clean and had excellent staff. The rooms had a Victorian coziness to them and our room overlooked the canal where the Gondola's would pass daily. Every morning there was a wonderful buffet. What else can I say, it was better than a lot of 4 star hotels I'd seen. The atmosphere was one of comfort and friendliness. We'll be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Venice!!”
Reviews.Author: sucakina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem and I was tempted to keep it a family secret. However, I decided to share our experience. The location is perfect; a stone's throw from the Ponte Accademia across the Grand Canal and the waterbus stop. It is away from the bustle of the centre but within easy reach of everything. We walked to St Mark's Square and to Rialto; approx 12-15 minutes each. The accomodation was superb. We had a family room for four. It comprised 2 x 3 foot beds together and in a separate area 2 more single beds for the children. It is traditionally decorated in Venetian palazzo style and was very clean and comfortable. Continental breakfast was great and the hotel staff all speak good English. We will definitely be going back there

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CamilleInVienna
Reviews.Content: Best hotel of a 2-week European vacation. Travelled with 2 18-year-olds and a 21-year-old, and this was our favorite hotel. Splurge on the canal view -- after a day of walking Venice it was wonderful to come back to sit on the balcony and enjoy the canal and the street below. The hotel was immaculate and the staff was knowledgeable and courteous. Quiet location but convenient to the busier Rialto (which the kids liked) and San Marco. Lovely walks down alleyways to the Peggy Gugenheim Museum and on the other side of the Accademia. The Zaterre is a fun stroll with a Billa grocery store to the right to save a bit on food. A good art store -- BAC -- right across the canal, as well as restaurants and wine shops.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Botique Hotel That's Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: ScipioAfricanus
Reviews.Content: This is a cozy, small hotel located off of the busy areas of Venice, but well within a short (10 minute at most) walking distance to just about everything. The rooms are adequately large, which we stayed in with 4 people. We had a canal view, which I'd highly recommend, on the 3rd floor. It's a great place to watch the world go by, with the Grande Canal off in the distance. Breakfast is included, with free Wi-Fi, and a really nice little garden terrace that we had breakfast on one morning. The staff were happy to oblige any request and were always ready with a smile. A truly outstanding value and hotel for those not wanting to be in the bee hive of St. Mark's Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable,clean spacious rooms, and accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: travelcouple97
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Venice and Italy. We chose this hotel from Fodors book and were not sorry at all. It was easy to find just 5 minutes walk the boat stop at Zaterre - easy with our luggage. In a lovely area, ate next door at Storico which was so picturesque by the canal. Easy to get to San Marco but far enough away to be less touristy or crowded/noisy. Staff were friendly, multilingual, helpful with all our questions. Air conditioned room, window shutters and push button shades on the windows, kept out the light at night. Updated bathroom and spacious room with king bed. we stayed 3 nights and wound definitely recommend this hotel to others. Also has internet, breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Quiet hotel, just off the Grand Canal.”
Reviews.Author: vanbc24
Reviews.Content: Hotel American Dinesen is located just off the Grand Canal away from the hoards of tourists and the loud canal traffic. Just a short walk from the vaporetta stop. The rooms were nicely decorated and the beds were comfortable. We booked directly with the hotel, on their website as it had the best deal. If you aren't going in the high season I would recommend booking the standard room and then asking if you can be upgraded to a canal view once you arrive (we paid an extra 15 euro a night which was a steal in comparison to what they were asking online at the time of booking). Even if they are full the doulbe room is still quite nice looking. The breakfast was nice and the staff were friendly. The hotel staff can also make suggestions on good places to eat which are close to the hotel. We would definately stay at this hotel again if we were in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little jewel box of a hotel -- quiet part of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Ccrosby60
Reviews.Content: If you love the Dorsoduro/Accademia side of Venice, or want to be somewhere out of the path of tourists streaming back and forth from the Rialto to Piazza S. Marco, this is IT. Immaculate, perfect little hotel tucked away on a side canal halfway between the Guggenheim and the Accademia museum. Sweet rooms, large bathrooms by Italian standards, very nice breakfast buffet, very kind and helpful staff. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “great quiet location”
Reviews.Author: saf60
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Hotel American Dinesen. The hotel is very easy to find from the Accademia bridge and vaporetto stop. Our quad room was small but comfortable with bathroom with shower/bath. The neighborhood (Dorsoduro) was quiet with excellent shopping and restaurants, especially next door. Breakfast was good and included. It was nice to leave the congestion of San Marco after sightseeing and return to our peaceful room.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: summerIreland
Reviews.Content: Excellent in every way, the staff are so helpful and professional. The location is perfect for all the major attractions on foot. We travelled Ryanair to Treviso and caught the bus to Pl de Roma. From there the Best and fastest way to get to the hotel is to catch the water bus fom Pl de Roma to Zatterre. it is a very short stroll to the hotel. Breakfast is good with Tea and excellent coffee. Good buffet

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: sovta
Reviews.Content: This well located comfortable hotel was a great place to stay. We booked a room with balcony facing the canal and were not disappointed. The staff at the front desk was most helpful getting us internet access at the public computer as well as recommending a close by restaurant with delicious food for dinner. We enjoyed the more than adequate buffet breakfast set out in the clean dining room on the hotel's first floor.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel in a Peaceful Convenient Breathtaking Location.”
Reviews.Author: PaulWimbledon
Reviews.Content: Bit late for this review,having stayed there last year but may well visit again end of July this year-2009.Better than other Hotels I have Stayed in,in Venice in a far Higher Price Bracket. Good Roomy Air Conditioned Hotel with Lovely Views from its Balconies,and a couple of minutes from the beautiful Zattere. Friendly efficient Staff and Reception including a good daily breakfast. Rooms,Bathrooms,General areas Very Clean and Room Prices Spot on. Even Better 2 Seconds,from my favourite Restaurant-just come outside and look to your right. Looking forward to another trip in the next few weeks and Hotel American Dinesen is top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in lovely area of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Matt-Sas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the American Dinesen hotel on the recommendation of family members who had stayed there twice before. The hotel is in a lovely location very close to the Academia Bridge. The staff were wonderful and friendly - nothing was too much trouble for them. The room we had, 104, was extremely comfortable. Large bed, sky tv, and wonderful bathroom with bath & shower. Make sure you close the wooden shutters outside the room at night! A nice variety of continental breakfast choices was provided every morning. The little terrace on the first floor of the hotel was a lovely relaxing spot to sit out on.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Venice's Dorsoduro area”
Reviews.Author: dlibr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 weeks at the American Dinesen. The hotel is located close the Accademia Gallery, the bridge and vaporetto stop, and the Peggy Guggenhein Collection. Despite the name, it is very Venitian, with a delightful staff who are multilingual. The hotel is well kept, very clean and quiet. Our room was tastefully decorated, not overdone, and had a lovely modern bathroom. The breakfast buffet is more than satisfying, providing meats and cheeses along with croissants and other breads. The Cappuccino and Hot chocolate are fabulous. A nice touch was the rose every woman received on St. Mark's Day. There is a very nice restaurant next door and the Zattere is nearby for great strolls in the evening . . . and gelato.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a gem of a location”
Reviews.Author: roblindag
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the early hours of the morning with a small baby but we needn't have worried as the hotel is only a 5 minute walk form the Academia Bridge and a young man was very helpful in pointing the hotel out to us. The bus from the airport is very easy and drops near the Grand Canal. The hotel is 15 mins beautiful stroll to St Marco and 2 minutes along the small canal to the promenade on the other side of Dorsoduro, looking over to Guidecca. The hotel staff are very welcoming and helpful, bringing a lovely breakfast up to the room when my daughter was unwell. The room was plenty large enough for the cot and 2 single beds and in lovely old Venetian style. Will certainly return to this hotel with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “A good bet in Venice”
Reviews.Author: RichFromRoch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently completed a 16-day tour of Italy, covering four major cities and several side trips. The journey began in Venice and our base there was the Hotel American Dinesen. A caveat: we travel a step above backpackers. Two soft-sided expandable (Steves-type) bags and two shoulder bags for travel guides, cameras, electronics, etc. are all we need. Venice is expensive â€“ even in the off-season â€“ so we shopped for a good hotel with a reasonable rate and a convenient location. The Dinesen fit the bill. It is in a quiet neighborhood on a small canal very close to Accademia and the Guggenheim. The airport bus docks at Zattere (the last stop) on the Canale della Giudecca, which is just a short walk (the equivalent of 2 U.S. city blocks) to the hotel. From the Stazione (train), a water bus will leave you at the Accademia stop on the Grand Canal. From here it is a longer walk (3-4 U.S. city blocks). If you are burdened with lots of luggage, consider a water taxi to the front door of the hotel. Our room was a typical size for Europe. Not big by U.S. standards, but comfortable and clean. It had a large (king), low, firm bed with enough walk-around room. The bath was new and exceptionally clean. However, some folks will have trouble negotiating the tall-sided bathtub. It requires a high step over to get into the tub for bath or shower. Breakfast was very good. The dining area was bright, clean and nicely decorated. The offering was typical of all the hotels we stayed in â€“ several cereals, salami, ham, cheese, a basket of rolls, three juices, croissants, yogurt, fresh fruits, hard boiled eggs, and, of course, choice of hot chocolate, tea or coffee. It was all good quality. Service was above average â€“ but it was off-season. The hotel staff was pleasant, helpful and friendly. The hotel offers wi-fi in your room. Just get a logon/password from the front desk and youâ€™re in business. My IPOD Touch worked just fine and I was able to e-mail the family about our daily adventures. There is a computer available in the lounge area. Venice is a great walking city and the hotel is about a 15-to-20-minute walk to St. Markâ€™s across bridges, down narrow streets, plazas and back alleys. Signs on the side of buildings point you in the right direction. Itâ€™s a great walk. Of course, you could take a water bus from the nearby Accademia stop on the Grand Canal. I have /will also review hotels in Florence, Sorrento and Rome, and I will comment on personal security in Italy in the near future. The usual disclaimer: I have received no personal gain from this review. I hope it has been helpful and I hope you enjoy Venice and Italy. RE Rochester, NY

Reviews.Title: “Excellent manners, great comfort, quiet location, high value.”
Reviews.Author: Green1001
Reviews.Content: Our three nights here passed all too quickly, as our room, 202, offered more than we'd expected, in appointments, views outside and absolute calm overnight, thanks to the quiet residential neighborhood. Breakfast was completely satisfying. Everyone on board was anxious to please these guests and did so with sincere politeness. Seasonal room promotion made the experience even better. We'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Superb,second to none”
Reviews.Author: Diane013
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th trip to Venice and my husbands 1st.Previously I had stayed in and around St Marco,always very comfortable ,with canal views etc and in very expensive hotels.We chose this hotel through reviews on trip adviser and were thrilled we did.As far as i am concerned this is the best hotel in Venice and certainly the best value for money , in a fabulous location.our room overlooked the canal as requested and was really spacious and spotlessly clean.The breakfasts are brilliant,the staff couldn't be friendlier or more helpful .We stayed two weeks in this hotel and were sorry to leave.There is no lift but believe me after the breakfasts you certainly need the exercise.The stairways are a very roomy by Italian standards so there is no problem with moving suitcases,ours were taken to our room by the very charming Guiseppe. I have been a serial traveller for the past 9 years staying in places such as the Hilton Cavellari in Rome and never before have I been compelled so strongly to bother writing a review. Well done American Denison !Keep up your very high standards and competitive rates.We shall definately return before long Diane and John McQueen Australia

Reviews.Title: “Good things come in small packages.”
Reviews.Author: brendaVictoriaBc
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my husband and I have stayed at the Hotel American. We loved it the first time, and love it even more the second time. The first time, in the midst of the heat of summer,we noticed its Venetian details - the blown-glass chandeliers, the exquisite fabric on the windows, the cozy nook of a reading room, the perfect breakfast capuccino. The second time, in the chill and dampness of January, we noticed its caring details - hot food for breakfast, tea in your room, excellent heating, umbrellas ready at the door, advise on the perfect site, the best meal. Yes, the rooms are tiny , but as they say, good things come in small packages, and that saying most definitely applies here. Thank you again, Hotel American, for a wonderful few days. Heidi

Reviews.Title: “Lovely traditional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tropicsexporer
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a wonderful stay at the Hotel American, Venice. I can highly recommend this traditional Venican hotel. Good location by a small but pretty canal in a quiet yet accessible location. Literally 2 minutes walk from both Accedemia and Zatterre vaporetto stops. St Marks Square and Rialto bridge areas are an easy and pleasant stoll away. The staff were most welcolming and helpful without being pushy. Nothing was too much trouble. Help with bags, extra pillows, the loan of an umbrella and internet access supplied free of charge. All areas were well furnished and clean. I won't hesitate to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: melay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel American Dinesen in December 2008 with my husband. We stayed in a canal view room on the second floor and ordered a bottle of prosecco to be ready upon arrival. I loved our room with Italian decoration; rooms are small but spacious, clean and lovely. It is definitely worth to pay extra for a canal view room. Reception clerks are very helpful, breakfast is delicious in a small breakfast area. The hotel is close to the St.Markâ€™s Square, 15 minutes by walking in the narrow lovely streets full of souvenir shops. Hotel is also very close to the Academia and Guggenheim Museums. At our last night, the clerk warned us that we were leaving the next morning and the tide (aqua alta) will be at highest level at that time. Thanks to him, we changed our departure time; otherwise we would have to stay in our room till afternoon. They are very kind and served coffee and croissant in our room at 6 a.m. before we left the hotel. I would definitely stay at American Dinesen again!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: PamelaGLondon
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay in the Hotel American in the Dorsoduro district. The hotel is delightful, room with canal view very comfortable and quite oppulent for a 3 star hotel. Good breakfast. Friendly and helpful staff. Excellent location near the Academia. Highly recoomended. Pamela & Peter. London.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: MyMuse
Reviews.Content: We get off at the Accademia stop, and take the quick walk to our hotel, Hotel American-Dinesen (left at stop, follow signs, go over small footbridge, immediate left; one sees the hotel as one is walking over the footbridge). The hotel is located in the quiet Dosoduro section of Venice, but still close to everything. The bellman immediately takes our luggage, which leaves us a bit breathless and we have a swift check-in. We get room 204 and it is lovely. The decor is all venetian decor. No balcony, but our hallway has one that is just as good. Beautifully furnished, breathtaking. We also have a full bathtub shower (high step-in!), though the bathroom itself is very small. We rested a bit, get ourselves ready to go out, stop at the frontdesk for map and head off. Very easy to get to St Markâ€™s â€“ quite literally follow the signs after crossing the Accademia bridge. It is maybe a 15 minute walk. For breakfast, there is an array of the usual cold items along the bar and a waiter will take your drink order. The breakfast room is quite pretty. What a way to eat breakfast! They have these cute salt and pepper shakers that are ghost-like & hugging. The breakfast room is also decorated with Venetian scones, pink & white mirrored chandeliers and scones. The staff were nice and helpful. The beds were perfectly comfortable. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most excellent stay at the American”
Reviews.Author: g_stirling
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, staff very helpful - they had great recommendations on places to eat and see. We were even there during the big flood, and they had all the right supplies. I would highly recommend them. We were there in the off season so even the price was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: OhioButterfly
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel for two nights in early November. The Hotel is in a great location (Dorsoduro Area) away from all the crowds. Most of the staff are great except for the gal at the front desk, she was kinda rude! Breakfast was ok. The hotel is decorated quite nice and is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Not through hell but definitely high water!”
Reviews.Author: travels4europe
Reviews.Content: I managed to be in Venice during the worst 'acqua alta' flooding they have had for the last 30 years. Fortunately I was staying at the Hotel American which is on high ground (for Venice). The flood waters did enter the hotel but the staff dealt with the situation as best they could and were very accommodating to all the guests. They were constantly on the telephone organising water taxis (the vaporetti were on strike) and helping guests by carrying luggage to the water taxi stop. They gave out plastic wading covers to everyone to, which was the only way we were able to walk through the streets. This is the second time I have stayed at the hotel and each time has been a very pleasant experience. The hotel is very well located (near the Accademia museum) and the rooms although some are small, are perfectly formed. The ambience is totally Venician - Venician mirrors, glass chandeliers and lights. Nothing was too much trouble for the breakfast staff. Although on arrival, the receptionist was rather off-hand and it was initially a struggle to convince him we had booked a twin room, when he noticed it was on the booking form, he grumbled something and didn't apologise. The room was made up as a twin while we were out. Although I did not check all the rooms, other couples who wanted matrimonial beds did mention their beds were actually twin beds pushed together and made up as if one bed. You might want to check this with the hotel if you want a 'proper' matrimonial bed.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: dtjammer68
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel American Dinesen based on the information found on this website and were not disappointed. The location was ideal and was only a short walk or vaporetto ride from all the major tourist sites such as St. Mark's Square, Rialto Bridge, Accademia, etc. Upon check-in, we received a free upgrade to a room with a balcony view of the canal. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The front desk staff was helpful with restaurant recommendations and with booking a water taxi to the train station on the day of our departure. The continental breakfast in the morning was the typical Italian style breakfast with breads, cereal, cheese, etc., but the breakfast room attendants were very pleasant and the capuccinos, tea, etc., were very good. Overall, this hotel was an excellent value for the money and we would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - avoid the tourists!!”
Reviews.Author: Pardelote
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in great area of Venice, the Dorsoduro. Just a two minute walk from the Accademia ferry terminal.Try wandering away from the hotel, south, through the small lanes to find the real Venice - restaurants and canal side bars frequented by locals. The hotel rooms are relatively small, but they are clean, quiet and comfortable. Staff are very friendly and willing to help at all times.

Reviews.Title: “perfect little hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: sarahyam
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The location is wonderful. Dosoduro is very quiet, but full of places to see. Only a five minute walk to the Guggenheim and Accademia museums. The shops in this area have a higher quality of merchandise and we bought beautiful glass and scarves that were much better than the places near St Marks. The hotel was simply perfect. Our room had a canal view, tiny balcony, but the room was very spacious. There was even room for a cozy cot for my adult daughter who came up to visit from Rome. The bathroom had a great shower and was incredibly clean. The decor was very charming, with fabric wall coverings and bright colors. Very comfy bed. The staff was very pleasant and the breakfast was good. I would stay here again in a minute. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanTourist201
Reviews.Content: We four friends got a 4-bed room for â‚¬ 260 through booking.com In the beautiful [and expensive] city of Venice, it was a cosy and friendly lodging. Staff was helpful, location was almost perfect, breakfast ok â€¦ so it was a pleasant stay, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: FrugalFly
Reviews.Content: A few pleasant streets from water-bus terminal, canals, and restaurants. Everyone gets lost in Venice, so get closer to hotel before sundown the first day or two, although Venice is very safe. Beautiful hotel. Clean room & bathroom with amenities & bidet & 110 volt outlet, but small shower. Great AC. In-room safe. Multi-country satellite flat tv. Canal-view balcony is small, but very nice. Free wi-fi internet in room. One public pc in lobby den, and a small piano room. No elevator. Free breakfast with several juices, teas, coffee, cereals, breads, pastries, cold meats & cheeses. Very friendly staff. Wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: hall999
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is on one of the smaller canals and easily accessible from the Acadmie vaporetta stop. The rooms were up to date and very clean. The staff was very helpful - no language problems at all. The double rooms are spacious - however the single rooms are tiny. Traveled with companions who had a balcony room which was very nice. The breakfast was free with the room and very good. I would definitely stay here again. Note - no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Canuck55Canada
Reviews.Content: We just spend 2 days in Venice and stayed at the Hotel American it was beautiful. The rooms were clean, quiet and the location excellent for visiting the city. The front desk very helpful and informative. We had a canal view room that was well worth the the extra cost. The hotel is situated in not a heavy traffic area that makes it all the more relaxing after a day of seeing Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: travelers2Travelers2
Reviews.Content: We received outstanding service at this hotel! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and appreciated the friendliness/helpfulness of the staff, the delicious breakfast we were offered, the complimentary taxi to Murano and the very comfortable room along with the wonderful location of this hotel. We will tell everyone we know to stay in the Hotel American when they travel to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanderNorman
Reviews.Content: The American Dinesen hotel is a beautiful place, located in a great area. Perfect for couples, wanting to spent great nights and days in a wonderful city. I can advice you to get a room with canal view. It is more expensive, sure, but this little bit extra will help you experience a far more greater stay than when you have a smaller room in the back, with view on ugly rears of buildings. (We had both rooms in this hotel, so I know). The breakfast was very nice, but no great buffet or anything. And the bread was not that great. But the rest was very tasty, I can say. Most important is the ambience there. It's typical Veneticianic. You feel like the rich trademan from the 15th century in their pallazo, and that, believe me, is a great experience. Practical info: Aircondontioning good and quiet. Bathroom extremly nice. Beds are comfortable. TV with satelite with a lot of channels (but don't watch them when you are there with your partner for a romantic stay ;) 90% (or maybe more) of visitors are American Ignore the attitude of the female italian behind the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful--would go back”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth73
Reviews.Content: Mom and two adult daughters--one large bed and a very comfortable cot--charming room with sunny balcony overlooking small canal. Spotless bathroom with plenty of room for all our toilet articles. Plenty of space for our clothes. Quiet at night, but activity on the canal and church bells woke us up early in the morning...not a bad thing! Good breakfast in a pleasant room. Courteous, helpful staff. Great location--easy walk to San Marco and vaporetto. Stayed three nights--hated to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the hotel”
Reviews.Author: joy020806
Reviews.Content: We were ablsolutely happy with this hotel. We loved that it was away from the busy crowded area and on a side street. The water bus stop is only a few minutes walk from the hotel and about a 15 minute walk to st mark's square if you walk straight to the square and not stop to view all the the things on the way. The only thing that really bothered me at times is I wished it was a bit closer to st marks as we were there in july and was really hot and crowded. But at the same time I loved that it was away from the square as it got pretty crowded there. The hotel staff was very friendly and we felt very welcome the moment we checked in. Loved that they had free internet access in their lobby. The rooms were clean and neat. We had a nice corner room w/a canal view. The room was on the small side but its Europe and that's normal. I highly recommend this hotel. The staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Location - Didn't like the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoCit
Reviews.Content: I've taken several trips to Italy, and have stayed in all of the major cities. I loved Charming Venice, but had issues with our Hotel. While the location was great, the rooms were noisy and the concierge was unpleasant. A very polite request for towels on our 3rd night (after not receiving new towels on the 2nd night) met with the comment "we have other guests you know". There was a restaurant on the same street though that had the best fish stew I've ever had though - and shouldn't be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Venice Hotel away from the busy crowds but close to all the attractions”
Reviews.Author: 1-Christopher-Lee
Reviews.Content: As you would expect Venice is expensive and crowded but if I stayed again i would consider this hotel. The hotel is in the academia district just around the corner from the main water boat stop. It is also away from the busy crowds but close enough to all the sites to make it the perfect location. We booked this hotel 6 months prior to travelling on a very good promotional rate via one of the links on Trip advisor. We had 2 double rooms that were a reasonable size and 1 single that was quite good compared to some i have seen. They were clean, comfortable and the air-con in your room was heaven. If left turned on your room became a walk in fridge that was a must in the July heat. The staff were helpful and the breakfast area was a reasonable size with a bar and the food was generally OK. The area around the hotel has a few restaurants but if you look further afield in the same area. You can find some very nice restaurants in a 5 minute walk from he hotel. For the local attractions they are only a couple of stops away on the main water boat. Alternatively you can cross the main bridge and take a leisurely stroll through the alleyways upto Piazza St Marco Overall I would rate this hotel for its location, comfort and price if you can get it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Easilyburnt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel American in July 2008 and found it very nice indeed. The hotel was situated in an ideal position in Venice with only a short distance from the grand canal. The room was small but furnished beautifully. We have stayed in many hotels in city centres before and this has been one of the best. We chose this hotel as it was recommended to us by other family members and we would definitely recommend further. Breakfast was included in the price but was nothing special and a bit hectic but stayed open until 10.30am which was excellent if you fancy a lay in. Overall a very pleasant hotel with great location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it- full of charm”
Reviews.Author: starting2travel
Reviews.Content: On our first out of country trip I was alittle overwhelmed with the planning. After many hours reading over reviews, I chose this hotel for our 3 nights in Venice based on the great reviews. They did not lead me wrong. This hotel was very charming, and in a wonderful location. It is off a small canal in a quiet area, but very close to the Accademia museum. It is within walking distance of San Marco Piazza (about 10-15 minutes) and also the Rialto Bridge ( a bit longer, perhaps 25 minutes). The check in and check out were amazingly easy and quick. The room was alittle small, but not by European standards. We had a quad room, so there was a king bed and a large chair pulled out into a bed, and a pull in twin. If it had been a double, it would have been very spacious. It was beautifully decorated and very clean. I definitely knew I was in Italy, which was my goal. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and all spoke excellent English. The breakfast was very good, with cold cut and cheese slices, boiled eggs, pastrys, breads and spreads, croissants, coffee, juices, and water. I had been very apprehensive prior to my arrival, but after walking all around Venice, I am thrilled with the hotel I picked. There are certainly some nicer (more expensive) hotels in Venice, but this is the hotel I would choose again, because of it's quaintness, and it's peaceful location. Only drawback- no elevator. We were on the top (4th) floor, and this was not a problem, but for older folks or people with limitations it may be.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: piratediver
Reviews.Content: This is a great place in an excellent location, certainly one of the cleanest and best run hotels I've ever stayed in, the staff is very friendly and accomodating. The breakfast is a buffet style spread with all kinds of food including fruit, yogurt, cereal and the usual meats and pastries. The waitstaff will make any kind of beverage you desire and seem actually happy to be serving you, maybe because they get to live in Venice! The location is convenient, just a 3-5 minute walk with suitcases from the Accademia stop. The hotel fronts a small canal which runs from the Grand Canal to the Canal della Giudecca which means you can take a private water taxi to the front door if you want to spend the extra money. My wife and I opted for the bus from the airport into Venice and then the vaporetto to Accademia, the cheap and fairly quick way to get there. The front desk staff is friendly and speak English very well and gave us directions to a fantastic restaurant, Locanda which is about a 7-8 minute walk. The neighborhood is quiet, especially at night but you are just a few minutes from the bridge which brings you to the area surrounding St. Marks, a place which is nice to leave due to the crush of tourists in the day time. The hotel itself looks to have been updated recently and as with most hotels in Italy has no elevator but there is plently of help with baggage if needed. The rooms are large and the bathrooms are modern and very clean, the AC works well and the electrically operated blinds keep the room dark and quiet. I would return here in an instant, you can't go wrong with this place. The Italian Frogman

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: Rickebob
Reviews.Content: 6 of us stayed two nights at the Hotel American June 20-22. The hotel appers to have recently been renovated and we found the rooms, while small, to be quite comfortable with very nice bathrooms and most amenities we expected. Check in was painless, continential breakfast was good enough and the staff were more than willing to assist us. When our flight home was cancelled at the last minute we were accomodated with an extra nights stay at reasonable rates. we ended up not having to stay an extra night but it was nice to be treated well. Venice is a magical place and if you choose to stay at the Hotel American you will not be disappointed. The location of the hotel is very convenient to with easy access to the Galleria bridge and the Grand Canal. All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel. If you have specific questions just drop me an email. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend. Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: sundans
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is ideal for those who want to be close to major tourist sites, but prefer a more quiet retreat after the pace of the day. It was easy to catch the vaporetto or walk across the Accademia bridge. Evenings were quiet and restful. The canal is romantic and there are numerous good restaurants and wine bars nearby. Recommend a room with a balcony if you are staying more than one night. Nice that they have a computer in the lobby that guests can use (you have to get a password from the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room and noisy guests”
Reviews.Author: vettaman64
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in mid-May 2008. Room was absolutely tiny. A lot of hallway and guest noise at night. Breakfast was good. Location is great. Front desk was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: keydet
Reviews.Content: Booked through Austrian Air Lines on their City Steal Deal. This was our second visit to Venice ,the first being on a tour. The location is fantastic. Just minutes from anything you want to do. The people you come in contact with are helpful, friendly and really care about the quality of your stay. Restaurants are close by . We had a 8:00 flight out so we had to meet the water-taxi at 6:00 to get to the airport. The night manager fixed our breakfast and pulled our bags to the water-taxi pickup point. Needless to say, we were impressed. Our room was very satisfactory!! We would definitely stay here on another visit to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Magmosh
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel American Denisen. We highly recommend it. We arrived by water taxi to the hotels private dock. The concierge and porter were outside waiting by the dock to give us a wonderful welcome. Our first impressions were excellent. The porter (who was wonderful through our entire stay there) was there to assist us with our luggage. He didn't speak English, but came into the room and showed us the electric shutters/blinds. And all with a friendly smile. We had a canal side room on the 2nd floor - we loved it. The little balcony was a perfect place to soak up a little sun and read. The room was beautiful and felt very homey. The bathroom was immaculate. Beds were a bit too hard for our taste, though. Since it was a bit warm, we slept with the balcony door ajar and could hear church bells ringing in the distance - a great way to wake up. The desk staff/ concierge were friendly and helpful at all times, even just coming and going - always asked us how the day was and if we were enjoying Venice. Recommended a great place for dinner on our last night. The hotel is in a beautiful area, much to see in Dorsoduro. We loved the area. We spent lots of time strolling on the Zattere. Very accessible to San Marco - an easy walk, in fact. Breakfast in the hotel was my favorite in Italy (we stayed in a few other cities that were definitely not as good for breakfast). It was relaxed and quiet, coffee was amazing! The breakfast room wasn't at all crowded, nothing was rushed. Food was very well presented and delicious. Very much enjoyed the decor of the hotel, as well. Nicely done in Venetian style. The facility seemed to be very well cared for. Our stay at the American was by far the most relaxing and enjoyable during our time in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the American”
Reviews.Author: DelightedKent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the American for our daughters 21st birthday as a suprise and what a surprise it was! It was in the perfect location for getting around everywhere and the hotel was of a very high standard - we had 3 rooms booked and every room was decorated in its own unique venetian style and why this hotel is only a 3 star beats me its definately 4 star standard. We travelled with Ryanair to Treviso and within 20 minutes of landing were on the bus to plaza roma and then by vaporetti to the Academia stop and the hotel was easy to find. We landed at 22.10 and were at the hotel at 23.30. For out daughters birthday the hotel recommeded the restaurant Moutin about 10 minutes walk where all the locals eat and we had a fantastic meal - a bit pricey but then you are in Venice. We booked direct with the hotel as it saved us about Â£100 and would definately go back

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Room”
Reviews.Author: pamjazz1
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at Hotel American. The Hotel was easy to find from the Accademia vaporetto stop and we only had to carry our luggage over one small foot bridge. We were travelling with our two teenaged children and booked a quad room. It was more than adequate with a king sized bed in one area and twins in the other. It was almost like a suite. The bathroom was not overly large but was modern and spotless. The breakfast was adequate even for our voracious 15 year old son. The staff was friendly and helpful. After navigating the route to San Marco square a few times, we didn't need the map. It was only a 10-15 minute walk but the vaporetto stop was 2 minutes from the Hotel in the event we wanted a ride. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It was reasonably priced by Venice standards and there were no glitches in our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A nice quiet place”
Reviews.Author: theodgers
Reviews.Content: I never got around to writing my review of this hotel. So, here goes... This was just what I was looking for. I went with my husband to celebrate our anniversary and I was looking for a quiet, romantic reasonably priced place centrally located. Hotel American was all that and more. Our room was decorated venetian style and a bit small. However, for the two of us it was just fine. Breakfast was included and was delightful. The staff was courteous and friendly. The hotel was also very clean. We were able to walk everywhere due to the hotel's convenient location. And, I had been told that the streets can be loud at night but, our room didn't have any noise at all. In fact the hotel is happily situated on a quiet side street away from the busier areas. However, the down side is that the hotel was a bit difficult to find the first night when we arrived. But, we did eventually find it. And there are not many restaurants nearby so, you have to venture in the city more for a variety of restaurants. But, this is a small price to pay for the privacy and service the Hotel American has to offer. All in all an excellent place to stay for a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Pitt1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews in Expedia and they weren't wrong. This is a lovely little hotel with friendly staff and a good buffet selection for breakfast. It doesn't have a restaurant but in a city like Venice there are plenty of places to eat so it isn't a problem. It is just far enough off the 'beaten track' to be lovely and quiet at night but close enough to the Accademia bridge and water bus stop to make travelling around easy by either foot or bus. Everywhere in Venice is easy to reach by foot but if travelling to the other islands use the water bus as they are cheap and frequent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Nice views!”
Reviews.Author: mochataz
Reviews.Content: Hotel American Dinesen is a very nice hotel. It was pretty easy to get to. You can get a water taxi right up the the front of the hotel (this is the easiest thing to do, as long as you don't mind spending the euros to get the water taxi), otherwise, the hotel isn't too far from the water bus stop. The hotel was clean and had nice views of the small canal. The air conditioning in the hotel works really good and it's great if you're travelling during the really hot season. The hotel is also within walking distance to a lot of places. The breakfasts were kind of busy at the hotel when we were there, but we expected it to be pretty busy at that time of year. My husband and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, shame about the room”
Reviews.Author: dozydai
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful few days during the carnivale, As there was four of us,we had prebooked a water taxi by e mail and it worked well, we arrived via the grand canal up the rio di san dio and moored outside the hotel. when we arrived in the evening,the night porter was on duty at reception and the checking process was painless, however there was no baggage porter on duty ,and as all rooms are on the upper floors(we were on the second floor and we had to carry our suitcases ,and with two of our party having back problems was not easy),and with no lift in the building( i was informed by the reception they had looked at it but as it was an old building ,a lift was not possible, something to think about if you are less abled or has difficulty with stairs. The room was without doubt the smallest hotel room i have ever stayed in, being L shaped the bed at one end had about 10inches space either side of the bed and wall, when getting into bed you had to walk sideways between the bed and the wall. A pair of doors opened out onto a small balcony looking out over the roof tops, there was a wardrobe,mini bar,sideboard/chest,one chair and a flat screen tv with sky. The bathroom had recently been refurbished and was very nice with the exception on the small bath(i believe one of the venice xperts had the same trouble getting into the bath lol) The breakfast was ample with plenty of variety setting you up for the day. The best part of the hotel was the staff, reception,breakfast,cleaningetc, all staff were very friendly and helpful. Checked a few of the rooms and they all seemed to be of differing sizes,which as the hotel was converted from a residence ,i suppose is the only way it could be done. I discussed the size of the room (206) with the reception staff,who informed me that prior to my next stay,if i e mail them, they will make sure i have a different room.The size of the room did not bother us too much as when we stay in venice the room is for sleeping and baggage storage. The hotel is in a nice area of the dorsoduro a few minutes from the accademia, peggy guttenheims etc. Getting to the hotel from the airport,1) water taxi to the hotel, 2)alilaguna to the zattere, then a few minutes walk 3) bus to the piazzale roma then vaporetto to accademia and few minutes walk. Lots of places to eat in the area, my favourite is the ristorante san trovaso where the food is good and the staff are very friendly. In conclusion,a nice quiet hotel in a nice quiet area, would i stay there again yes i would. ps. i liked the sign on a table near the compliments book, asking guests if they enjoyed their stay to log on to tripadvisor.com and put comments to upgrade the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: JayPeakDistrict
Reviews.Content: We would recommend the Hotel American to anyone. The situation was quiet but stunning - we had a room with a balcony overlooking the Rio San Vio, a little canal just off the Grand Canal. The room was comfortable and we could adjust the heating which was useful as the weather was really cold. The area was beautiful but we were not in a tourist thoroughfare - it had some bars and small shops, which we liked. The situation was incredibly convenient - 2 minutes to the Accademia Bridge. The staff were friendly and welcoming, with good English. Breakfasts were excellent, with a wide range of rolls, croissants, pastries, ham and cheeses. There was also plenty of fruit. We were recommended to eat nearby at the San Trovaso restaurant and taverna, where we enjoyed reasonably priced food and wine amongst tourists and locals.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: newtonmatraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great small hotel in Venice. Although it is not in the main center of Venice it is one of the most easiest to reach from both the Airport and train. For the Airport take the shuttle boat (12 euros) to Zaterre. For the train station the Vaparettos to Academia stop. The hotel is on a quiet narrow channel off the Grand Canal and about a 10 minute walk to San Marco. The hotel has free Internet access (wireless) that works in the rooms. The breakfast is also very good (best we had in Italy). The rooms aren't huge but well appointed with large screen TVs, good size bathrooms, and comfortable beds. The canal view rooms are nice, but really not worth the extra cost. The hotel can arrange a free trip to Murano Glass works. Its worth the time.

Reviews.Title: “A Venesian Haven”
Reviews.Author: Tilly9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in beautiful Venice.The Hotel is in a great location near to Accademia and within a ten minute walk to St Marks Square but positioned in an ideal spot by a canal,just away from the hustle, between Accadeia Gallery and the Peggy Guggenheim museum.Lovely comfortable room,we only booked a standard room but this was more than adequate,very clean ,immaculate bathroom,mini bar,safe etc. and the decor was very tasteful!Staff were very hospitable and keen to help with any queries.Continental breakfast lovely,as much as we could manage !The waterbuses were easily accesible and cheap to get around on ,we managed most sights in three days .The only downside is the food in the restuarants ,which was either very expensive or tourist meals that are adequate but not that excitng.Loads of cafes and icecream parlours were available to make up for the bland offerings!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cb76London
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying 3 nights in this hotel for a weekend break. We were slightly dubious because of the name thinking that it may be 'themed' or something similar! Rest assured it is 100% Venetian. It is in a great location, very easy to walk to from 'Zatterre' or 'Accademia' Vaporetti (water bus) stops. The room we had was small but perfectly formed with a mini bar big enough to put your own drinks in, flatscreen tv, sky tv, phone, air con/heating with individual room thermostatic control. The bathroom was spotlessly clean with shower over a bath, toilet, bidet, sink, heated towel rail, other towel rails, hair dryer, shaving socket, retractable washing line and even 'french' doors to a small balcony! The bed was very comfortable and the towels very soft. There was also a small safe in the wardrobe which had plenty of hangers and hanging space. The breakfast was superb with fresh croissants, bread rolls, ham, cheese, salami, cereal, toast etc etc. All self service and very laid back. Breafast was between 7:30 - 10:30am so none of this getting up early to make a last dash for breakfast! Our flight home wasn't until the evening and the hotel kindly looked after our bags all day for no extra cost. The only thing I did miss, but not for more than 5 minutes, was tea and coffe facilities for a cup of tea first thing in the morning. But when in Rome...! There is currently some building work happening to the front facade (Feb 2008) but I'm sure this won't be forever but it didn't disturb us at all, however we were staying over a weekend. Maybe worth checking with the Hotel what time the builders start in the morning if planning a weektime stay. All in all a brilliant hotel with great staff, brilliant rooms and very clean bathrooms. Also great location, walking distance to everything in Venice, but make sure you get the water busses as they really are the best way to travel in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “40th Birthday Treat!”
Reviews.Author: berges
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend to celebrate my birthday and were delighted with it! The hotel is so close to the Zattere waterbus stop it makes travel from the airport easy. It is a lovely walk to to St Mark's (approx 15-20 mins) and the Rialto Bridge (probably about 25 mins if you don't get distracted by all the wonderful shops and sights!) The hotel is traditionally decorated, extremely clean and we found all the staff friendly and helpful - they recommended a superb restaurant not far from the Accademia Bridge. All in all an excellent place to stay in a truly wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: left_at_eaglecap
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent several weeks in Italy last summer. Venice was the last stop on our trip. The Hotel American has an awesome location, very much off the tourist beaten path. The rooms seem a bit dated but the hotel is very quiet and quaint. The front desk was most helpful in our securing a water taxi at 4AM to catch a flight to Amsterdam. Great resturaunt right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Newmania
Reviews.Content: We spent 12/23-26 at this hotel and had a wonderful stay. The staff was helpful even before we arrived; they had emailed information regarding museum passes and advice on how to get to their hotel. Upon our arrival, we were welcomed and were very pleased with our room and location- we had a small balcony overlooking the canal. The bathroom was large and furnished with nice amenities and lots of towels. The breakfast was very nice and had a good selection. My favorite part of the hotel's amenities was the free internet access and printer- very convenient. Elizabetta and Marco were wonderfully helpful finding restaurants that were open on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. The location of the hotel was great as well, although on a side canal, it is only a minute or two walk to the Accademia vaporetto stop. We will stay here again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: cambridgeboy
Reviews.Content: A pleasant few days stay at this hotel. Could find no fault with staff who were helpful and friendly and the rooms were very clean and well tended. It is not a modern hotel and would need an extensive re-fit to look modern. It had a feel of days gone by - which I am normally not that keen on when it comes to hotel interiors. However, somewhat oddly I liked it at the Hotel American Dinesen. I would certainly recommend this hotel, particularly at this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and good value”
Reviews.Author: PaulandCaroline
Reviews.Content: American is a small, very friendly and good value hotel on a quiet canal well located close to Accademia. All staff are very friendly, more than willing to help with any question and speak very good English. Rooms are comfortable, warm and quiet and the (cold) buffet breakfast is more than adequate. We booked, including an exchange of emails in English, on the internet with no problems, and a 5% discount is available for payment in cash. Access from the waterbus is quite easy - either at Accademia or Zattere - the latter has a service direct from Marco Polo airport (details on airport website). Most bedrooms are on the second and third floors and the hotel does not have a lift, but otherwise we could not fault the property or the service and would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “great position”
Reviews.Author: dacredame
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel, very convenient for all main attractionsand transport particularly the Alilaguna boat which for 12 euros takes you direct to the airport. Staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. Room not huge but spotless and very comfortable and with balconies overlooking a charming canal. Definitely will stay again. Great hot chocolate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for the Money”
Reviews.Author: pvittoria
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, friendly staff, excellent location. Can't beat the stay for the money. Walking distance to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Canal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mypinkparis
Reviews.Content: This was an absolutely beautiful hotel. It is located on a very quite canal and very close to the Zaterre Vaparreto stop. The hotel is located on the Dosodeuro side of the island and is across the large canal to St Marks Square. It is a completely different area as it is must more artsy and quite with fewer "tourist" shopping joints. We had a corner room with a canal view and it was just stunning. The bathroom was exquisite, the bed comfortable and the view was amazing! Hotel was extremely clean. We only enjoyed breakfast one morning because of our early morning schedules. It was fabulous compared to other Venice hotels I had just stayed at. We had an early morning flight so we were forced to take a water taxi (be prepared to have sticker shock!!!). It was $150 for a 30 minute ride to the airport. There is virtually no other way to get there that early without taking a taxi. It was pure luxury and very nice but unfortunately my pocketbook doesn't always allow for such splurges on a regular basis. The hotel does have a private dock though which they alway had lit with candles. It was beautiful at night. Now for the not so great things. I agree with the earlier post of the staff not being warm and fuzzy. Never really felt welcome by anyone at the front desk. Never felt they really wanted to help us with our excursions, water taxis, water buses, etc. When we checked out I gave the man my credit card to pay with and he promptly told me they declined it. I knew there was no way that was possible and told him to try it again. Again, seeming miffed, he did and it went through. We generally had some problems with the locals as they really don't seem like they want to welcome Americans. The girl in the breakfast room was quite nice, although she spoke no English. Another thing that I wasn't quite pleased with was that the internet was right in front of the front desk. I felt like I was being watched. Also, on the desk with the internet computer is a sign that asks people to go to tripadvisor to "upgrade" their internet status. I normally use tripadvisor all the time anyway and post my reviews but I feel it inappropriate to ask for the review. I would however stay at this hotel again because of the location and the beauty of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: MissChris007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel in the Dorsoduro neighborhood and thoroughly enjoyed the Venetian part of our vacation. We stayed two nights in a regular room without a canal view, but we took full advantage of the balconies and terraces on our floor to make up for it! The hotel is very warm, very clean, the decor beautiful and the staff friendly. The breakfast was above average. Make sure you enjoy one of their decadent cappuccinos... The hotel sits on a quiet canal, nestled a pleasant walking distance between Piazza San Marco and the Rialto. It was a very safe location and we never felt uncomfortable there, even late at night. The following attractions are near the hotel: the Accademia, the Peggy Guggenheim Collection, and the Accademia Bridge, one of only three bridges that cross the Grand Canal. Upon our arrival in Venice by train, we walked to the hotel. This would have generally been a 45 minute excursion, but we became a bit lost in the winding streets of Venice, as it was our first time there. Locals and carabinieri were no help in finding our way, as they were not familiar with the hotel. I would highly recommend taking the Vaporetto to the Accademia stop to save time (and avoid a why-canâ€™t-we-ask-for-directions argument!) Overall, we had a lovely stay in Venice at the Hotel American, and are planning to stay there again when we return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “pay for a superior room”
Reviews.Author: El_Timon
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to Venice - a two nighter to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary and I spent a while researching hotels in Venice with a view to getting a nice room in a quality hotel with a room overlooking a reasonably pretty (or at least quaint) canal without paying an arm and a leg. The Dinesen fit the bill. I booked a superior room for which one has to pay extra (I suspect the reviewer a few before this one did not appreciate that) and got a superb room on the first floor with two balconies and three windows overlooking the canal. Found the staff friendly and helpful - we did not encounter the rude waiter mentioned below and suspect that he may have departed - the "nice waitress" seemed to be training in another witress. Breakfast was typical continental with an acceptable variety of coldcuts, fruit, cereals, breads etc. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet,old world charm”
Reviews.Author: ladywithbaby
Reviews.Content: Great central location close to the Peggy Guggenheim Collection, within a short walk across the beautiful Accademia bridge to the 'heart' of San Marco. Rooms have character, not the generic chain motel look here! Even my single room, although of course small, was nicely appointed with very clean shower. Morning breakfast buffet very good. Stay here for a quiet and more authentic view of Venice, around the corner were even the daily fish and fruit/veg market stalls.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Location, Shoebox Room”
Reviews.Author: shoop
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel based on trip advisor recommendations. Hotel location was on a side canal and rooms were very clean. I was disappointed since I had booked our room 6 months in advance and asked for a canal view since it was our 25th anniversary. No canal view and had one of the smallest rooms we saw in the hotel. We were disappointed, but the hotel was impeccably maintained. The staff attended to our questions in a perfunctory manner, no one stood out. We would consider staying here again, however would research other options with a more helpful, attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with a few drawbacks.”
Reviews.Author: LiFrannie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel fro 3 nights with my sister and elderly mother. We had a balcony room on the second floor. Room was nice but a little tight for three people. Stairs were hard for my mother to climb after walking all day. The staff was very helpful and friendly except when it came time for breakfast and we needed a table to accomodate the three of us. Waiter was very rude to us and to other hotel guests who also tried to squeeze three chairs at a two person table. Breakfast room only had two person tables. One woman actually got up and left and said she did not needed to be yelled at and went else where for breakfast. They did have a woman waitress who more than made up for her counterparts rudeness - and I did tip her each morning for her excellent service! Breakfast food was definately a "continental breakfast" and was nothing special. Though the location was great - I think I would try another hotel in that area the next time I venture over to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet But Convenient”
Reviews.Author: 92Karen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 5 year old daughter in August 2007 for 4 nights. The trip to the hotel by water taxi was fabulous! The hotel is situated about 5 minutes walk from Acedamia bridge and the Gugenheim museum but only about 15 minutes walk from St Marks square and Rialto bridge so is well placed for all the major sights but just far enough from the busy areas to be peaceful. There are a variety of restaurants within 5-10 minutes walk. The hotel's rooms wre venetian style in their decoration and we found the beds to be comfortable. The breakfast was limited but good quality and we couldn't fault the staff, they were friendly and helpful at all times. There was free internet access in the lobby whioch was great for CBeebies. We really enjoyed it here, if you want to be right in the centre this may not suit you but if you like to walk and see the scenery then it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected generosity”
Reviews.Author: nocciolaLeekEngland
Reviews.Content: September 19th We stayed at this hotel in July when visting Venice for the Feast of the Redentore .We selected the hotel on location and from other reviews and as junior suites were on offer we enjoyed the front views from the balcony. Other attractions are the 5 minute walk to the Alilaguna ferry service to the airport on the Zattere,itself a wonderful water front with lovely views,good restaurants and of course Nico's ice cream parlour . When we returned in September we were happy to stay here again .This time we had a standard room which was absolutely fine ;-good size-especially considering some of the shoebox experiences in pricier hotels -big,comfy bed and spotless well equipped bathroom. What prompted this review was the response of the hotel manager to the fact that we missed our flight from East Midlands airport .This was as a result of a 4 hour holdup only 4 km away caused by a race event at Donnington Park (be warned). When it came to settling our bill we were delighfully surprised that we hadnt been charged for the first cancelled night . Thats service worth celebrating.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: tvloftboy
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note to say that our stay was fantastic - trust me we are very picky. The reason for the 'excellent' rating came about on the last day. The person at the desk in the morning told us to take the ferry back to the airport. We went. We stood. No ferry. The day before the schedule had changed to 'off season'. We walked back to the hotel and after many apologies they gave us a free water taxi ride (90euros) to the airport for their mistake. Now that is service. Overall, the staff make it. Knowledgeable and helpful. Fall is the best time to visit Venice -- few people about. Hope you have a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hidden Retreat”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaJester
Reviews.Content: We were overwhelmed by all of the hotel choices in Venice (especially since the room cost is so high!). My husband found this on Trip Advisor and we decided to go for it. I will admit that I was a bit nervous about finding the place, but it was nestled between 2 major museums (and right off of a "water bus" stop) so it was easy to find. We loved that it was close to the action but, at the same time, it was tucked away in a significantly less touristy area of the city. We spent much of our time wandering around the residential streets and going to restaurants where the locals hang out. Our room was beautiful (and well air conditioned!) and we had 2 balconies that overlooked the canal. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to have a true Venitian experience while holding onto modern comforts. If we ever return to this wonderful city, we will not hesitate to come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tynan_Family
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3-night stay at the American Dinesen Hotel, and can honestly say it lived up to all our expectations (having read the great reviews on tripadvisor). We'd booked a double superior room with a canal view and were not disappointed with room 302 on the top floor. It was a lovely large room with great views of the canal and a decent sized bathroom with a modern suite. It really got our visit to Venice off to the best possible start. The location of the hotel is excellent - just off the Grand Canal and only two minutes walk from the Accademia Bridge taxi stop. The hotel was close enough to explore all the main attractions, while still being away from the hustle and bustle around the San Marco district. You really appreciate the tranquil atmosphere the area offers, particularly in the evenings when you want to unwind and relax. All the hotel facilities were good (there's a security safe in the room and an internet facility in the lobby) and we found all the hotel staff friendly and very helpful throughout our stay. The cold buffet breakfast with croissants and plenty of Italian coffee was the perfect way to start the day. We took advantage of the Orange Venice Card on our arrival at Marco Polo Airport, which turned out to be a great investment. It covered the Alilaguna boat transfer to San Zaccaria (next to St Marks), with unlimited use of the vaporetti (water taxis) around Venice and entrance to many of the city's museums and churches. We were able to make good use of the public transport, with visits to the island of Murano (to see the glass factories and shops) and the Lido to take in the Venice Film Festival (unfortunately we didn't spot Keira Knightley or Jude Law, who were both attending their film premiers). The Lido has a very different feel to the other islands of Venice with a long sandy beach and overlooked by grand hotels and private villas. Certainly a resort for the rich & famous, but great to explore or just chill out on the beach. We enjoyed three fantastic days in Venice and would definitely return to the American Dinesen Hotel again. Brian & Angela Tynan

Reviews.Title: “Kraft Cheese Singles = Horrible Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ChazMalibu
Reviews.Content: Okay, the location is really nice. Quiet, beautiful and clean neighborhood. The staff was snobish. They acted like they could care less. Hotel 8 has a better breakfast than this place. Trust me, Im not a snob! I'll go somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “I "smell a rat" in Venice at the American Dinesen”
Reviews.Author: NickSkiathos
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that Venice is a spectacular city - I was disappointed in the American Dinesen.
