I'm generally a very positive person and I stay at a lot of hotels in Europe and the US and don't write a lot of reviews but felt compelled to write this one. Trip advisor reviews set expectations very high and they were not met. It was overpriced (2 rooms - 285 and 325 + EU per night) and overrated although I really can't compare it to any other hotel in Venice. The hotel is old and feels dated. Its tacky and very small - dead mosquitos and stains extremely worn rug . Let me also say that the "free" internet access had a nice big sign next to it asking for people to post thier comments on Trip Advisor - my compliments to the shrewd management - I think that's cheating though. No wonder there were so many comments ! The charming Canal smelled in room 201 - many Mosquitos at night - I saw rat outside the front door of the hotel ! And another 2 on either side! Where should my family walk - or should we take a gondola? I called the front desk twice from the US to try to arrange tours in advance and they said "wait until you get here". Once I got there they had nothing but excuses for a secret tour of Dogges Palace. I finaly got a walking guide with my own contacts. Breakfast was very weak. Service was great though. The bellman was great but what's up with no elevator? The blonde at the front desk was not helpfull the one day she was there. She made me feel we were bothering here. The asian boy pulling the all nighters at the front desk was helpfull - Management - can you hire at least one other person for God sake? How can you charge so much and overwork your staff so much?

Reviews.Title: “so happy with our choice!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 16canuck
Reviews.Content: After much deliberation, we settled upon this hotel for the last four days of our vacation, and are so happy that we did. After a day of crowds and sightseeing, it was wonderful to come back to such a tranquil area, yet still only a short walking distance away from the sites and the waterbus. A small landing right outside the hotel made it very accessible for water taxis. We chose a canal view room and found the workings of a city without roads to be a very intriguing sight! Although the rooms were not huge, they were spotless and nicely decorated. The staff were quite friendly and very helpful. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous hotel in ideal setting”
Reviews.Author: surfthewedge
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough positive about this wonderful hotel. The staff was excellent. We had a problem with the air conditioning in my room that that was fixed immediately. The two rooms I rented (I travelled with my family of four, including my 19 and 21 year-old sons) were clean and in good condition. The bathrooms were fine, as were the beds. My wife and I stayed in a room overlooking a canal that made the stay really, really enjoyable. I highly recommend asking for a room overlooking the canal, even though the price is slightly higher. The location of the hotel was fantastic: in a quiet neighborhood that was still close to many wonderful sites and also within easy access to the vaperottos ("sea buses"). I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice. I wish I were there right now, instead of in San Diego writing this review!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cosy & great staff”
Reviews.Author: Mark_from_Thailand
Reviews.Content: We've just left the American & had a great experience. We did not experience cold breakfast, missing shampoo or a poor recommendation. When we were there, we found the locaiton to be great - < 10 mins walk from the Accademia river ferry/vaporetto & around 20 mins to San Marco Square. The staff are very keen to help & efficient. They do get a little overwhelmed when a lot of guests turn up for breakfast at the same time - maybe Anna experienced this. We did not use the one & only Internet terminal provided but I can imagine it was limited. The rooms are small but comfortable, clean & have everything you'll need - comfy bed, shower that works. Unfortunately, the only English channel we could find on the TV was CNN!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Venice”
Reviews.Author: BimKentUK
Reviews.Content: Returned last night from a five day stay in hot, but wonderful Venice. We can only echo all the other sentiments written here - the hotel is beautifully furnished, spotlessly clean and a calm, serene oasis after a hot day's walking in the city. More prosaically but nonetheless necessary, everything worked faultlessly - air conditioning, telephones, room safe, plumbing, etc. The staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly and the hotel is a two minute walk to the Accademia bridge and boat stop, which will take you anywhere in Venice and the islands. It also has it's own landing stage right outside the door which made our water taxis to and from the airport well worth the extra money. (E120 for the taxi - E12 pp for the waterbus). The Dorsoduro area, where the hotel is, is less crowded and touristy than San Marco and Rialto, ( ergo, a good night's sleep) but no less lovely with lots of shops, bars and restaurants a stroll away. The Zattero waterfront is at the end of the street, again with restaurants and bars and a great view of part of the lagoon. We travelled with two teenage girls who were enchanted with their 'padded' silk walls and the free access to the internet which meant they were able to keep in touch with friends on MSN. Having seen rates for other hotels in the city, The American is superb value for money and we were all agreed that it's three star rating could easily have been higher in any other city. When we return to Venice we will definitely stay at the American again. As a further recommendation, if you are staying for more than a day or so, buy the Venice Card. We had blue ones for E52 (for 7 days) which meant unlimited travel on the vaporettos (E5 for a single trip and a queue to buy them otherwise) which probably paid for themselves in the first two days. In all, a great holiday in an enchanting city, enhanced by this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Dorsoduro”
Reviews.Author: DorsoduroFan
Reviews.Content: There is not a negative thing to say about this lovely hotel. The location on a small canal between the Grand and Giudecca was perfect. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and our room overlooking the canal was beautifully appointed and well air conditioned. Our three rambunctuous boys were made to feel right at home right down to the free internet station in the lobby. We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect situation”
Reviews.Author: cassieIpswich
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at this hotel which we chose through recommendation on trip advisor. We were certainly not disappointed. Having never been to Venice before we were extremely pleased to find that we were in a perfect situation, within only a few minutes of two main vaporetto (public waterbus) stops. Everywhere was within easy walking distance, including St. Marks Square. Only a few minutes walk away there was a bench where you can sit and watch the boats on the canals eating italian icecream! The hotel is situatied on a canal in a lovely quiet area. Free internet access was available which was useful. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was enough to last us all day. Although the room was very small, it was adequate for us and we felt the hotel provided extremely good value for money. A lovely cup of Tea brought out to us on the veranda for 2 euros each was excellent value. We would certainly recommend this hotel and would love to return again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great staff, great area, dont miss this one....”
Reviews.Author: cafemosaic
Reviews.Content: after 2 weeks in florence and the tuscan country side, this hotel provided us with a fantastic end to our italian holiday. The area was perfect, located on a quiet canal, just over the Accademia Bridge. After seeing the masses of tourists located around the other main hotels, we were thrilled to be located in such a peaceful environment. The hotel has its own dock for water taxi and we were able to get quickly from and to the airport. As the vaporetto (water buses) were so crowded, i highly recommend this route for arrival and departure. Elizabetta and the entire staff could not have been more accomodating and helpful with every aspect of our stay.... .meal reservations, recommendations, tours, tickets, etc etc... all were arranged by our kind hosts.... all very professional and incredibly knowledgeable... rooms were super clean and tidy and well air conditioned... the bellman was the kindest and most helpful i have ever had... we will return for sure. cant wait!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: TimmyAnn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the American after a cruise based on the reviews we read on Trip Advisor. The accolades were well deserved. The staff is friendly, professional and eager to help when asked. We requested a room on the canal on the lower floor (no elevators) and that's what we got. I don't think I've ever stayed in a similar hotel where the upkeep was as good. Not one stain was visible, the wallpaper was fresh and looked new, the bathroom was immaculate. There is a charming restaurant just next door that has amazing food. If you are interested in dining there in the summer months be sure to make reservations for a table overlooking the canal. Otherwise you're out of luck because it appeared to be a favorite of the residents in the neighborhood. A charming hotel, we recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: woodytwoshoes
Reviews.Content: Friends recommended this hotel, and I would do the same. Great location, friendly, very helpful staff, nice rooms (small, but you are in Europe all the rooms are small) very clean. Good breakfast and free internet access in the lobby. There are no elevators, but you also find this is quite common in smaller European hotels. I loved it at this hotel, would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and an oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: scoobydont17
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a very hot but lovely weekend in Venice. The American is beautifully situated on a quiet canal just off the Grand Canal in Dorsodouro. The room was lovely and clean and the air conditioning superb providng a welcome respite from the heat and humidity. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I found the location ideal situated between the Accademia and the Peggy Guggenheim Collection it was a short walk to the Accademia Bridge and the Vaporetto. As for the previous contributor who complained about the walk to St Marks I found it no problem but there is an alternative using the Traghetto at San Samuele (the big condola which ferries people back and forth across the canal). Shortens the walk considerably and is the best value 50c in the city

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, cold AC!!”
Reviews.Author: 47north117west
Reviews.Content: We stayed in once of the canal view rooms in this hotel for 2 nights and would highly recommend it. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was clean and well-appointed, breakfasts consisted of a good assortment of options, all major attractions are within easy walking distance, and best of all for the southern European heatwave that we encountered, the air conditioning was very cold! No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: BackTooSoon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a pretty and quiet canal in Dorsoduro. The Good: The hotel has a pretty exterior and 'cute' public areas, so you get a good first impression.. The air conditioner in the room worked great. The bathroom was clean. The cappucinos were the best we had in Italy. The Bad: There is no elevator. The room was not spotless. The walls in the rooms are covered with fabric, and the fabric was stained. The walk to St. Marks is 20 minutes. We timed ourselves three times. If you plan to spend a lot of time in the area of St. Marks, or if you want to return in the evening, be aware that you have a 20 minute walk each way.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive Decor and Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: Effydog
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Italy, and Hotel American in Venice was great! It is very well located in the lovely Dorsoduro district of Venice, away from all the swarms of tourists in the San Marco area. The staff is very pleasant and accomodating. Although the room was on the small side, it was beautifully appointed, with fabric covered walls and we had a little terrace overlooking a canal, complete with flowers. One happy surprise was a push-button light-filtering outside shade/shutter that could be adjusted to make the room completely dark, or let some light in. This shutter also reduced any noise from boats on the canal. There was an interior passageway between the two buildings that was fun to walk through, as it felt like an outside covered bridge overlooking the canal. Everything was very clean. There is a Yamaha upright piano in the interior part of the passageway, that is available during the daytime for guests to play. There is no elevator in the building, so plan on walking some steps. Breakfast was fine, with a nice assortment of meats, cheese and eggs, yogurt, fresh fruit and pastries. We were sorry that we had to leave, and if we visit Venice again, will be sure to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good alternative”
Reviews.Author: Msafiri1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because our first choice, Hotel Flora, was fully booked. Quite a good hotel in a quiet location on Dorsoduro. Our room suffered from occasional sewage smells emanating from the bathroom which we traced to the bidet plumbing. Otherwise, no complaints and a good base from which to explore this beautiful city .

Reviews.Title: “Good location. good compromise”
Reviews.Author: dublintraveller100
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the American for the third time in ten visits and continue to see it as a good buy in a city where all hotels are compromises. Venice caters for many budgets, from the big to the enormous, and the three star American is towards the bottom of this range. The location is excellent, on a quiet canal in generally peaceful Dorsoduro, halfway between the Accademia and the Peggy Guggenheim and the Grand Canal and Zattere. The best rooms are 101 and 201, which have small balconies overlooking the local canal. The quite small rooms and bathrooms are all slightly different in size, well equipped and elegantly furnished in traditional Venetian style. Some suffer from intrusive street lighting. The (Italian) breakfast is adequate if unexciting, the staff are pleasant, the laundry is good value and internet access is complimentary. Recommended. Tip - the hotel serves only breakfast and it's almost impossible to get food or refreshment in the area after 10 pm, so plan ahead if arriving late!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: tmiller3
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 12-day trip to Italy, with three nights at the Hotel American. We had the best stay of our trip here. My wife and 17-year old son agreed that this was their favorite. The Room was great, enough room for all of us and our stuff. The nieghborhood is great, it is close to the sights, but you breathe a sigh of relief when you get back to the Dorsoduro side where the activity lessens, but still provides great places to eat, fun shops and a great evening stroll along the Zattere ( with a stop at Nico's for gelato). If you need to get to the "action" a short walk or vaparetto ride. A great hotel in a great location. Only issue is the shower/tub combo with only a half of a shower screen. Took a lot of effort to not get water all over. Ohterwise, nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelerAbq
Reviews.Content: The American is an excellent hotel in the relatively quiet Siestere Dursoduro. It is in a convenient location near two vaparetto stops, Accademia and Zattere. It was easy to get Piazza San Marco, the Ghetto, Strada Nuovo, etc. and, of course, easier to to get to Dursoduro and San Polo sites from I Frari to the Salute. Nice, clean room. Friendly and helpful staff. With special thanks to Marco, Elisabetta and the fellow on at night whose name I can not remember!!! Thanks, too, to the lady who manages the breakfast service. If I visit Venice again, I will defiinately staty at the American. Michael

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DEtraveler
Reviews.Content: After 30 years of marriage, my husband and I finally got around to taking our honeymoon. We went to five cities in Italy, starting in Rome and ending in Venice. All the hotels were nice, but the Hotel American Dinesen was the nicest of all. We spent the first two nights lovely, quiet, and private room overlooking a side canal. The third night, all the canal-view rooms were booked, so we had to move. We packed up and the staff moved all our luggage to a room that faced the side. Although not as beautiful as the first room, it was well-appointed and comfortable. Both rooms had nice bathrooms and good air-conditioning. We liked the location of the hotel--in a quiet area, but near the Accademia vaporetto stop, so we could get to San Marco or the Riato in a few minutes if we wanted more activity. There are several nice restaurants and shops nearby. It is also near a stop for the Alilaguna shuttle to the airport (although we didn't use it.) The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. They took our luggaage to our room (one slight drawback is that there is no elevator) and helped us book water taxis and a tour to Murano. Everyone who helped us spoke excellent English. The only thing I would like to see improved is breakfast. At other hotels, we had more choice of fruits, nicer cheese, and better pastries. The yogurt was an adventure, since it wasn't marked; one morning, it had fruit cocktail in it and another morning it seemed to be lime. I look forward to going back to Venice and certainly would stay again at the Hotel American Dinesen.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: lauriegav
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great very friendly and good value, the location is just right. It is near to all the main attractions but on a quiet side canal with a very good restaurant next door. I would have no problems in recommending this hotel. The rooms are great the staff are friendly, what more do you want.

Reviews.Title: “Buzzing with acitivty”
Reviews.Author: JillConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Good location - quiet canal near Accademia. Staff very helpful (chilled the wine we left for our return visit!). All rooms tasteful -Some are small but with comfortable queen size beds. Rooms overlooking the canal iare lovely (cost more of course). Good breakfast. No nightlife in this area - sometimes a relief! Lots of Americans.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Wonderful Venice”
Reviews.Author: LouiseKIreland
Reviews.Content: Amazing wonderful wonderful hotel. I could not be more complimentary. I have travelled alot on my time and stayed from campsites to 5stars and could not be more complimentary about this hotel. Mario (or Marco?? and Rosa) at reception was a saint and did so much to help us figure out what we were doing. We enjoyed drinks on the rooftop one evening (brought our own). The rooms were clean, the staff fantastic, and access to the internet a bonus. Would absolutely stay here again. Enjoyed the trip immensely. We were safe clean and convenient to the vaporettos. Very scenic and again, thank thank you to the staff,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joy331
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights and enjoyed it very much. The accommodations were very comfortable. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Great breakfast. Conveniently located in Academia section of Venice which is away from the hustle and bustle but still very convenient to the other popular areas. Also, located on a canal which is very convenient for water taxi drop off. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZFlyers
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, especially for European standards. We had a triple room that had plenty of space. It was very clean and comfortable (and the air conditioning is cold!). Another great point is it is VERY convenient to get to/from the train station--once you get off the Vapparetto, it is a quick walk to the hotel on not very crowded streets. The hotel is in a great location as far as being a relatively close walk to St Mark's and the crazy crowds associated with that, but it is in a very quiet neighborhood. It is not noisy so you can sleep, but you can easily walk to great restaurants and nice evening walks. You are only a block away from Giudecca Canal which has the restaurants, and only about two blocks away from the Accademia Bridge and the Grand Canal. The hotel staff was very helpful and it is nice to have free internet access (space available) while you are there. The only down side of the hotel is there is no elevator, so you have to climb stairs to get to/from your room. We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Totally enjoyed American Dinesen Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MunkPaloAlto
Reviews.Content: Two friends told us about this hotel. I couldn't find it in any other tour book. It is not in the main tourist area but quickly accessible. Even though American is in the name, it is very Venitian. Front desk staff were by and large courteous and well informed. The breakfast which is included was lovely. I'm an eggless vegetarian and the front desk staff went out of his way to find out if the bread had eggs in it. (It did not). Our room had a canal view with a small balcony that opened up right over the canal. The only problem was that we left our windows open and received mosquitoe bites as a result. However, by and large, they did not itch. We would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous American in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Yonkers_NewYorkTeri
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous little hotel on a quiet canal! The service was tops! Everything was clean and pretty - a short walk from the Vaporetto! And the breakfast was wonderful - more than just a cappucino and a roll! They couldn't do enough for us. Would certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful View”
Reviews.Author: Heart10
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Venice and we researched so many hotels in Venice before selecting Hotel American. When we arrived our room was not ready but they stored our luggage so we could begin our trek of being lost in Venice (we became professionals at this!) Upon arriving back at the hotel our room was ready and the lady at the desk had a gentleman take our luggage to the room (I wished I remember his name because he was extremely nice....he also worked the breakfast room a couple of mornings) Our room was corner room on the 2nd floor with 3 small balconies. We had a nice view of the canal in front of the hotel and of the grand canal. The room was a very good size. The bed was comfortable but the pillows were not that great. The bath was somewhat small but we had smaller in Rome. The shower only has a half door and did not seal to the bathtub very well, which left plenty of water in the floor. Also there is about a 8-10 inch step up into the bathroom from the bedroom. Also, in case the staff forgets to tell you at check in, to make the lights work the key must be inserted into a slot just inside the door. The breakfast was very nice. Limited fruits but plenty of breads, cereals, meats and such. Our only complaint was in the evening of our first night we were downstairs and was going to just walk outside the door to look around the small canal. We were not going any further then about 10-20 feet from the door. As we started out the door the man working the counter yelled at my husband, "You have to leave the key here." We both looked very surprised and gave him the key. We were gone for all of 5 minutes and when we returned and asked for the key, he slammed it on the counter in front of us. The lady who worked during the day was helpful and helped arrange a water taxi for a 6 am pickup. Overall the stay was nice, the location is perfect, breakfast was good, the staff ...well some where great others were not. View was nice and the area is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four days, This is a charming hotel with a great location, just a few minutes from the Accademia stop. The rooms are small but elegant and comfortable. With very good service, this hotel is an oasis away from the crowds. I

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BevNapa
Reviews.Content: Near the Accademia Bridge and the Peggy Guggenheim museum, the hotel offers great hospitality and a comfortable room with modern bath. Our room was next to an outdoor patio where we had a delightful happy hour and heard the church bells tolling. The staff was most helpful, and the free Internet welcome. The nearby streets are fun to stroll, and the "big water" within a short distance. Good restaurants nearby, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Chezza27
Reviews.Content: Hotel American Dinesen is in a lovely little spot, conveniently located just round the corner from the Accademia Bridge in the Dorsoduro area of Venice. The service at the is very friendly and helpful, breakfast is fine and the room was a reasonable size, clean and pleasantly decorated. However for some reason, it just didn't feel particularly special... for 270 euros a night you'd kind of expect something with a bit of a wow factor, but then again this is super-expensive Venice, so maybe my expectations were a bit too high? Having said that, I believe there are some fantastic boutique hotels which are similarly priced (which were booked up). The food at the restaurant next door is fantastic, and the Piscina restaurant just at the bottom of the canal on the Zattere waterfront was good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: nwildman
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay with nice location. Very clean and within walking distance to all the sites and water buses. The shower only had half a door, so water got everywhere. No elevator. There was free internet and they had a free taxi to a glass shop on Murano. Breakfast was decent. The lady at the front desk was kind of rude, other than that the service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, attractive quiet location”
Reviews.Author: No_one_you_know
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. The hotel staff were friendly and accommodating, helping us with all our requests with speed and a smile. We had a superior room with canal view (non-smoking) that was clean and comfortable in typical European style. Breakfast is somewhat basic compared to other European hotels we've stayed in (which is quite a few), but the quality is good. I would have expected some more fresh fruit options, but perhaps that is not typical in the Veneto region. We found the Dorsoduro area, in particular in the area of the hotel, to be a very nice place to stay....close to the fray of San Marco, but not in it. The hotel has a nice little patio area on the 1st floor where you can bring your own drinks and enjoy a relaxing bit of fresh air. Overall, we would recommend this hotel for almost anyone, though the lack of an elevator could be a turn-off for some.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: BorisWestCountryUK
Reviews.Content: Our family of two adults and two teenage children stayed at this hotel in April 2007, requesting a "4 bedded room". We were put in a room on the 3rd floor which had a camp bed , sofa bed and a double bed. The room was not at all big enough or suitable for 4 people, and there was not even room to put a suitcase on the floor. The air-conditioning in the hotel had not been activated (fair enough for April) but the heating system was broken and could not be turned off, so hot air was coming out of the vent. We complained about the room but were told that no other room was available that night. In the morning we complained again and were put in a much nicer room on the first floor, This was purpose -built for 4 people, and was basically a large room with a double bed and small annexe containing two permanent beds (rather than the much less comfortable temporary beds. This room was nice and was what we had been expecting, although it had no view. The breakfasts at the hotel were much less interesting than you would get at any Holiday Inn in the USA or U.K. -even leaving out the cooked breakfast which I guess is not popular in Italy! It was very limited and I was disappointed to see individually wrapped processed cheese (no other cheese!) for breakfast every morning. The location of the hotel is great - by a quiet canal, and as everyone else has said, away from the crowds of San Marco. The hotel staff were really helpful and recommended some good restaurants nearby such as the Trattoria San Troveso just round the corner, We found the restaurant with the same name (and similar menu) just as nice. Gelateria Nico, by the Zattere water bus stop, is wonderful and cheap and just a short walk from the hotel. Venice is a lovely place, and this part of Venice particularly so. However, we were a bit disappointed by the hotel itself. I think the rooms are probably rather variable-probably those with a canal view might be particularly nice, but there doesn't seem to be a choice of these when you have a 3 or 4 bedded room. Perhaps a good idea is to contact the hotel and find out exactly what you are going to get. Maybe we were expecting too much for nearly 400 Euros per night .

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lauraandrews
Reviews.Content: We arrived by Private Water taxi which was able to take us straight to the door of the hotel, no carrying suitcases through the streets trying to find our hotel! The staff were very friendly and helpful, although we had booked a last minute room with a canal View (on line), these had all been taken for our first night, so they upgraded us to a Junior Suite. Dissappointed we went to the room, this soon diminished as the room was superb, very large, clean and extremely quiet. The next night the hotel staff moved our bags over to a canal view suite, which turned out to be very noisey, due to the traffic on the Canal, however we soon wished we were back in the Junior Suite on the side of the hotel!! The canal view proves to be very noisey due to the water taxis and boats etc. On the day of departure we asked the hotel to book us a water taxi for our return trip to the airport, this arrived bang on time and even gave us our own private tour down the Grand Canal past the Rialto and then out to sea to the Airport....that saved a Gondola ride which we were told was a waste of money! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel American and have recommended this to all our family and friends. Looking forward to returning as soon as we can. Some strong advise is do not use Hotelopia to book your hotel. We booked one for this trip using Hotelopia and when I contacted them to confirm the booking (admittedly I did not have the reference number) they could not confirm I had a booking under my name or email address nor my husbands!!!Consequently I had to make an emergency booking elsewhere...hence the late booking with the Hotel American. On our return from Venice it would appear that we did indeed have a booking with Hotelopia for a Hotel and have since been charged for the 2 nights! I am now in a battle with Hotelopia to clear this up...but don't hold out much hope as they have already taken the money and seem to think it's not their fault and the Hotel are merely passing on their charges.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel American, Venice”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelPlanner
Reviews.Content: My husband, three children, and I stayed here for two nights in April, 2007. This hotel definitely lives up to the praise lauded here on trip advisor. It is charming, quiet, and comfortable. Very Venetian. My husband and two boys had a room overlooking the small canal just off the Grand Canal-- fantastic! We enjoyed basking in the spring sunshine on the balcony. I noticed other hotel guests enjoying the back sunlit patio. The breakfast room was lovely. Venice is not very big, so we were able to easily walk to San Marco square, and yet enjoyed the somewhat less flashy and quieter Dosoduro area surrounding the hotel. Venice is best enjoyed by strolling its back streets and canals-- we were captivated by its elegance and magic (despite the tourism), and this hotel has plenty of old world, Venetian charm at a (relatively) good price. Praise also to Marco, who is most helpful! The pictures on the hotel's website are quite accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlisonHolmfirth
Reviews.Content: My husband i returned from Venice on Sunday 8 April 2007 and stayed at the Hotel American. What a wonderful hotel and yes we did get a lovely typical Ventian style bedroom and a very modern bathroom. Clean towels everyday!!!!!!! Friendly and helpful staff and can recommend this hotel everytime. Would also recommend to everyone that you arrive by water taxi, what a treat. Holmfirth Huddersfield

Reviews.Title: “Great Family-Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: susieny
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a 9-day trip to Italy and we spent 4 wonderful nights at the American Dineson Hotel. We are 2 adults and 2 children (ages 6 and 11) and we were lucky to find a quadruple room at this hotel. The room was quite large and divided into 2 by an archway. One half held a large king-size bed and windows and the other half 2 twin beds and windows. My kids felt as though they had their own room. Everything was beautifully decorated and very clean. While we did not have any view, we felt that the size and organization of the room more than made up for the lack of a view. The only drawback was the lack of shelf space to unpack clothes. Breakfast was good and the staff was friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is excellent and I would not stay anywhere else in Venice. The neighborhood is much less crowded and touristy than the San Marco area. We took many wonderful walks through the narrow streets. The hotel is minutes from the Peggy Guggenheim and the Accademia and close to the Zattere - a wonderful place to stroll by the water. The San Marco area is a short 10 minute walk away. There are many restaurants in the area, as well as gelato, of course. As noted in previous posts, I would not recommend taking the free water taxi to Murano that is offered by the hotel. We heard from other guests that once you get there it is a very hard sell to by expensive products that are available more cheaply elsewhere. We went to Murano on our own by Vaparetto and had a wonderful time walking arouoond the island. If we return ot Venice we would definitely return to the American Dineson.

Reviews.Title: “Good family hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Dtomlinson
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at Hotel American in the beginning of April. We booked it based on previous reviews and were not disappointed. This is a solid three-star hotel in a nice neighborhood. It is close to the vaporetta so it's convenient to get around. The hotel is clean and well cared for. The breakfast is adequate, but slightly understaffed in busy times so allow more time each morning, but certainly this should not change your mind about booking this hotel. It's family-friendly and the front desk can offer some good restaurant recommendations "off the beaten path". Request a canal view room-it's worth the upgrade and we did not find it noisy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: duskydog
Reviews.Content: Well maintained, beautiful hotel in the best location in Venice, after all the touristic sightseeing you are glad to come back to the quiet neighborhood location, the staff was friendly and knowledgeable, could not ask for more, made me smile.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Traditional Venetian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAXGLOS
Reviews.Content: I am quite difficult to please; so an excellent score from me is quite impressive! (see my other reviews) Truly a very special and intimate hotel offering immaculately clean surroundings and good quality service. The breakfast is very tasty and coffee very good. We had a canal view top floor balcony which made a difference. The concierge is very helpful and the beds are medium firmness. Free high speed internet is very good in the lobby. Paid 240 Euros pppn B&B March 2007. Tip#1 Put the "Do not Disturb" sign on your door if you want to lie in as maids can be quite chatty outside your door. Tip #2 The hotel is offering a promotion at the moment for a free water taxi to Morano island to view the glass blowing, which was excellent as this is usually 90 Euros, however "there's no such thing as a free lunch so they say" and we did have the hard sell when we got there, we got away fairly lightly with four hand blown goblets for 180 Euros, after nearly choking on the 750 Euros requested for a decanter and 6 glasses!!!! Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: ZuriWakefield
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at Hotel American Dinesen and would stay there again in a heartbeat. Check out the hotel's webcam for a 24 hour view of the neighborhood with its quaint shops, quiet canal and beautiful stone bridge. (I had been visiting the hotel's webcam site so frequently before the start of our vacation that I recognized the scenery and was able to find the hotel easily after the vaporetto dropped us off at the Zattere stop!) One afternoon as I was enjoying the view from the balcony, to my surprise a gondolier came cruising down the narrow canal and tied up his boat just steps away! We splurged and laughed about hailing a gondola instead of a cab! Our room was exceptionally clean, the staff friendly and hard-working, and the hotel just sparkeled with well-run efficiency. An outstanding find--stop looking and book your stay right now!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time at the Hotel Ameican”
Reviews.Author: inquisitor
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hotel American. Our first was about a year ago for just a few days, but this time we stayed a week. The fact that we got a standard double room in January for the equivalent of $105/night (even with a weak dollar and with a 5% discount for payment in cash) was what made us choose to come at this time of year. Actually we had fairly decent weather and the only drawback to January seems to be that some restaurants are closed. As with our first visit, everything about the hotel was great - the room, the staff, the location, the breakfast. I highly recommend the Hotel American.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: MayScotland
Reviews.Content: My husband took me on a surprise trip to Venice for my 30th, and had booked the Hotel American. Believe me, I wasn't disappointed when I saw the place!! We spent three nights there and were very very pleased indeed with the hotel. We had a superior room with view over the canal. It was beautifully furnished, with a very comfy king size bed and a nice bathroom, and was very clean. Beautiful Venetian view outside. All very romantic and peaceful! The hotel is near everything, 2 minutes from the Accademia, yet is on a tranquil side canal. Staff are very helpful and polite. Just ask at reception if you need anyhting! Breakfast is bountiful, with nice pastries and quite a lot to choose from a buffet. This made a change from some other Italian hotels where we had stayed, as breakfast is not what they do best in Italy. I can only recommend this place very strongly!

Reviews.Title: “We were so fortunate to find this jewel”
Reviews.Author: powergal
Reviews.Content: Five nights at Hotel American in Venice We are so happy we researched on tripadvisor.com when planning our trip to Venice. I read dozens of hotel reviews and made a list of those I would consider. Based on many glowing reviews, Hotel American was near the top of my list. So, when it came time to book and I found an Expedia travel package for Hotel American I immediately booked without hesitation. First let me say that the location in Dorsoduro is PERFECT! Itâ€™s a charming neighborhood with two of the best restaurants we encountered the entire trip and many nice shops and cafes. The location is just across the Accademia Bridge from the touristy San Marco area -- close enough to walk there easily, yet secluded enough to escape the crowds. Marco and the entire hotel staff were extremely accommodating. Gratzie! One wonderful restaurant, Casin de Noboli, was recommended by the bellman, who also happens to be a photographer. The other great restaurant was Taverna San Troveso, each are about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Our room, while very small, was charming and had everything we needed and we both found the twin beds to be comfortable. The bathroom was modern and lovely, (aside from the awful hairdryer). Room had: minibar, flat panel television, safe, corkscrew, small writing desk, and the usual bathroom toiletries. We very much enjoyed the terrace adjacent to our room (and resident cat, Lily). Breakfast selections were extensive; pastries, croissants, breads, fruit, boiled eggs, cheese, sliced ham and salami, several fresh juices and coffee. Breakfast served buffet-style 7:00 a.m. â€“ 10:30 a.m. We wasted money by buying a 3 day Vaparetto pass which we used only 4 times total. Typically, weâ€™d plan our day so we took the Vaparetto to the furthest spot on our tour and then walk our way back to the hotel. From the hotel, the walk to the Guggenheim or Accademia is less than five minutes, St. Marks Square is less than ten minutes. Several times we walked (north) through San Polo to the Rialto Bridge area in about 20-25 minutes. Overall, highly recommend! We got a nice room, in an ideal location, for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “small but good”
Reviews.Author: bean10
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel after reading the reviews, and we were not disappointed. Had a standard room although it was fairly small it was very clean and the bed was extemely comfortable. Staff very friendly and helpful. The area was quiet and within easy walking distance of the Accademia vaporetto stop. Plenty of good places to eat - for a special occasion go to Alle Testiere, it was excellent. Anywhere on St Marks square or the waterfront is expensive, Bellini's at Harry's Bar cost a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: LPF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great find and a great value. Ask for a room on the canal -- it does make a difference and isn't that much more money. Our room was a nice size by European standards and the breakfast was wonderful. Be prepared to have to lug your luggage a bit and over a small bridge if you don't take a private water taxi. If you've got a lot of luggage the private taxi is expensive (about $100 USD) but a real treat. Otherwise, the public water taxi is much more reasonable (about $10 USD) but you do have to get your luggage to the hotel. From here you can walk to most locations or take the water taxi. Beware of the free boat to Murano. You will be met with hard sales at a glass factory. If you're not interested in buying Murano glass go instead to Burano -- a lovely little island with little pressure to buy but lots of lace.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeofYork
Reviews.Content: This hotel is run to the highest standards with beautiful decor and very helpful staff. The buffet breakfast was well stocked, coffee and tea was plentiful, and the service was friendly and efficient. Our room was a bit more spacious than that of the friends we travelled with, but both were well appointed, clean and well decorated. Our bathroom was fitted to excellent standards with clean tiling and modern fittings. Reception staff speak excellent English and are helpful. We had a very enjoyable time here, despite some fairly awful weather!! This is an excellent hotel and we would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Place to stay in Venice...”
Reviews.Author: anne068
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here for a number reasons: The Location - off the beaten path but still near many interesting shops and restaurants. The Room - pay a little extra for the canal view - it was beautiful and a lot of fun to watch the daily acitivities on the canal. We were in 202 which was a corner so there were actually 3 balconies. Bathroom was lovely the only trick was the half shower door and keeping the floor dry. Breakfast was nice and we really appreciated getting a second pot of coffee every day! Nice to be able to check our email in the lobby so we could keep tabs on the care of our dogs back in the US. We would definitely stay here again if we ever make it back to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service/Location”
Reviews.Author: nattyroe
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Hotel American Dinesen. After a horrible flight experience arriving in Venice (missed/delayed flights, airline lost our baggage for two days, missed one whole day of our trip), we were more than ready to get this vacation started. Since we arrived so late to the hotel and had a misunderstanding with the night clerk over the phone, our room had been canceled when we arrived. The hotel was very accomodating and let us have their "penthouse" of sorts, the top front room with canal views/balconies on two sides of the room. we slept hard, but the canal was very noisy and everything echoed. We did have the windows open, but thats because the hotel had their heat on and it was very stuffy and hot without them open. The next room we stayed in was not a canal room, but we actually enjoyed it more. Quiet, pretty, just perfect. Overall, great stay, perfect location (safe, on a canal, walking distance to everything but not touristy), and wonderful, accomodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Second time around”
Reviews.Author: CrackedActor
Reviews.Content: Just come back from from our second visit to this hotel, and we found it as good as our first visit several years ago. We had, by chance, the same room as last time (109?) which has a wonderfully atmospheric view over the canal. Definitely worth the extra money. Will certainly go back here for our next visit to Venice. You'll find that the breakfast room is full of other British voices - or at least it was on our visits) - but I guess that's inevitable in Venice (and maybe lots of people read the Trip Advisor reviews) A good place for dinner - about a 20 minute walk stroll to the NW - is Oniga in Campo San Barnaba. We ate there 4 years ago when it had recently opened and again on this trip. Atmospheric, not too touristy, interesting food and a good wine list at very fair prices for Venice. We'd also highly recommend Al Bacaretto just to the NW of Campo San Stefano, a locals' favourite but just as friendly to visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trishfinnegan
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here in room 101 from the 2nd-5th of March and had an excellent stay. Our double room was perfect with a large balcony that looked out on the small canal outside the hotel. Linen changed everyday and was spotless. The staff were very friendly and have great english.Thanks to Marco at front desk for helping me out when Ryanair lost my luggage. The breakfast was continental with delicious warm crossants every morning before we started our long days of walking around this wonderful city. We were blessed as the weather was so warm this weekend also, around 18 C. It was our first visit to Venice and this hotel but will definitely not be our last. Perfect romantic getaway. We would recommend this hotel to everyone-I couldnt find any fault with it. Plus it is only a couple of minutes walk from the Accademia vaporetto stop which can bring you to anywhere in Venice. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “We would return”
Reviews.Author: mjellisuk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a short 2 night weekend stay at the Hotel American Dinesen between Feb 23-25, and we really enjoyed it. We travelled from Liverpool on Ryanair and after the 45 minute bus ride from the airport arrived in Venice just before 4pm. On exiting the bus at the Pallaze de Roma you turn left to the vaporetto stop where 6 euros will buy you a ticket to Accademia. Be prepared to change at Rialto too. The hotel was exactly as described and we had picked this hotel after reading reviews on tripadvisor. We had a Superior Canal View room, which was clean, comfortable and a decent size. I have attached photos of the view from the balcony but in essence, we didn't really get any benefit from the view as we were out the whole time there. Marco on reception was helpful with our reservation for a local restaurant which was where many locals ate and although not a romantic spot, was excellent cuisine. Breakfast was excellent, and we had the tourist trap gondola ride from Paulo who was located outside the hotel which was convenient to say the least. The thing that we liked best was the location in the arty district of Accademia/Dorsoduro. We walked to the Campo San Marghrita where the square was full of Venetians drinking and relxaing in the outdoor cafes. We went mask shopping at the two most renowned mask makers in Venice, Mondonovo and Ca'Macana, and loved the fact that the hotel was an easy 15 minute walk to Piazza San Marco and about 20 to Rialto. Our favourite experience was walking into a traditional Venitian restaurant in San Marco and sitting amongst locals for the best meal of our trip. I have attached a photo but as with everyone's trips to Venice, the fun isn't just the gondola, Bellinis at Harry's, and the sights, it is walking and walking finding your own favourite spots, and your own experiences. Even the fog and the 10 hour late return home didn't dampen our trip, just our impression of Ryanair. These are a few of our experiences, but regarding the hotel, we would definitely return but a normal room would suffice for our next trip. I don't think you can give a hotel a better recommendation that no complaints and an intention to return. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Carry0n
Reviews.Content: Our family of two adults and one child stayed here from 2/18 through 2/23 and were extremely pleased with the accomodations. Our room on the second floor seemed freshly renovated and was very comfortable. The L-shaped layout allowed our ten year old to enjoy his own "room". Bathroom is a bit small but has everything. The location is to our mind optimal in the lovely yet quiet Dorsiduro area away from the noise of San Marco yet convenient walking or venetto distance to all Venice has to offer. The breakfast is substantial, and the hotel employees are quite personable and helpful. While no other meals are offered, there are several very good restaurants quite near the hotel for both dinner and lunch. It was especially pleasant to be able to return to this hotel for a really good night's rest, particularly during the lively Carnevale period where noisy celebrations carried on nightly. Numerous steps up to the second floor may be a drawback to some, but we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone and would gladly stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AphroditeCA
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in the quiet neighborhood behind the Accademia. Close enough to St. Marks to walk, far enough to be quiet. Also close to the Zattere, a great waterside promenade. Hotel is moderately priced, very nice rooms, a bit small, but good sized bathrooms, we have stayed there twice, the staff is nice and helpful, the breakfast is good, the place was completely renovated maybe in the late 90's and is impeccably kept up. A great find.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Venice!!”
Reviews.Author: kim&mark
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights at the American and found it a lovely friendly hotel. Staff were very accomodating - even lending us an Italian - English dictionary to try and improve our local lingo! Breakfast was typical Continental fare but we loved the fresh croissants and cakes! As previous reviewers have said - it is close to main attractions but far enough away from the hustle and bustle. Stay away from tourist restaurants near St Marks Square - poor quality food at ridiculous prices. You should note though that many of the nice non-tourist restaurants seem to close early (8.30-9.30pm)...hence why we got stuck with tourist restaurant one night!! We recommend doing the Secret Tour of the Doges Palace... you get to see the interesting 'secret' rooms not normally accessible for not a lot of extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeniseyManchester
Reviews.Content: Date: 5/2/07 Reviewer: Manchester, UK This was our third stay in Venice & this is the best Hotel we've stayed in to-date. Located in one of the less touristy areas of Venice (a bonus!) on a quiet canalside, however, conveniently located for the Guggenheim & Santa Maria Della Salute - St Marks being a 20 min walk away. Ensure you ask the helpful & friendly staff for recommendations for bars/restaurants as we had excellent meals at both the restaurants we were directed to - the bar was fab also. Both the restaurants & the bar were full of locals (always a good sign!) We booked a superior room with a balcony, which was lovely. Breakfast is simple (the usual continental selection) however, adequate & will certainly see you through until lunch. We would definitely seek out the American Dinesen on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Me and my boyfriend loved it”
Reviews.Author: viv84
Reviews.Content: Love it. The hotel was lovely and traditional but with all the modern conveniences. Staff were so friendly, reception were very helpful in recommending places that were had good food for a reasonable price as well as routes to take when walking round venice Breakfast was lovely with a wide selection (their hot chocolate was to die for) The room was very nicely decorated (we had the superior canal view room) which had a wonderfyl view, comfortable bed, bathroon was good (lots of hot water), and i thought it was actually quite a large room! i would certianly recommend this hotel to all my friends and family, its in a very god location with everything very close (im a very lazy walker but i had no problems about walking to St Marks and the Rialto from where we were) Stay here!! Good for a romantic getaway...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in a fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: Trumpeter1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly located and the hotel was absolutely fabulous. The service was extraordinary, from the concierge to the housekeeping staff. The only thing I was disappointed in, was the breakfast choices, but that is not a problem, but a personal choice.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Odard
Reviews.Content: Stayed in mid-January 2007. Would stay again. Friendly staff. We stayed on the top floor in two adjacent rooms: the single room was small, but fine for one. Its probably worth paying extra to get a canal front room. When we stayed the location was very peaceful day and night so a canal front room would be no problem. Breakfast was fine. Free internet access in lobby. P.S. we walked everywhere except to get to and from the bus station for airport. We bought a 3 day pass for the water bus, and museum entries, but it was a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Canal-lady
Reviews.Content: A charming little hotel in a great area of Venice away from the crowds, but close enough to the tourist sites when you want to see them. This is a great area to stroll around in and enjoy the architecture without being overcrowded with touristy shops. The shops that are in the area seem to be more unique and not on top of each other. The hotel itself wins bonus points for being really clean, our room was a little small by american standards but was nicely decorated. It was enjoyable to watch the canal traffic from our window during down times, although my daughter spent her down time on the free internet! The only negative I can report is the hardness of the beds. The Italians must like their beds extra firm, because every hotel we stayed in had hard beds so I can't really falt the Dinesan over other hotels. We loved our stay in Venice and won't hesitate to stay at the Dinesan again. p.s. the little cafe at the bridge a few doors down from the hotel has excellent salads and sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed an extra 2 days . .”
Reviews.Author: drive4fun
Reviews.Content: The accomodations were excellent. We opted for a room with a view, so being on the 3rd floor was actually a plus since the view from our windows was superb. The staff were most helpful, especially Ronald (porter) & Alberto (desk). The room was clean & the stairs were no problem for us. The hotel room was very quiet, no trouble sleeping! Friendly atmosphere. Location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: FuzzyInLuanda
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. The location is very good, on a quiet canal, and within walking distance to most sights & a vaporetto stop, but away from the crowds & noise. The rooms are fairly large. The baths are fairly small but efficiently arranged. Everything is very clean. The staff is helpful and efficient. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, want to go back soon!”
Reviews.Author: pobble67
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the thick of things in Venice (near San Marco or Rialto) this is not the place, but if you want quiet, non-touristy surroundings you'll get them here. Short walk to Accademia bridge and ferry stops, so it's still convenient. Also, only a 2 minute walk from the Zattere stop of the Alilaguna water bus from the airport. We had one of the "Superior" rooms -- very clean, spacious, nice furniture, comfy bed, overlooking small, quiet canal. Bathroom had tub w/ shower, excellent by European standards. Lack of a full length shower curtain was about the only drawback. Staff was attentive and friendly, all spoke good English Breakfast was good too, excellent coffee. All in all, a winner!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnTLondon
Reviews.Content: The location is very central within easy walking distance of the Accademia bridge and then on to San Marco. Very convenient to Vaporetto boat stops. On a lovely smaller canal, with plenty of good non-touristy restaurants nearby. Near to so many sights so thats even late-night atmospheric walks become a treat. Spacious, bright well-equipped rooms with comfortable large beds. When we were there the temperature was freezing but the hotel was lovely and warm. The reception and breakfast staff were friendly and welcoming, the hotel characterful and spotlessly clean- there is noting more that I could have wanted from a hotel in central Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: JasperTurin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel American-Dinesen in mid December 2006 and could not find fault with it. The staff were friendly, courteous,helpful and professional from reception, to the bellboy, to the cleaning staff, to the breakfast room staff. I can't comment on the standard rooms because I didn't see them but our superior room was lovely - on a corner of the building with views of both the canal below and the Grand Canal that it flows into. The room was nicely decorated and extremely clean and although not huge, ample in size by European standards. A nice feature was the free use of a PC in a quiet area off the lobby including complimentary internet service. The location of the hotel is very convenient to seeing the major sites of Venice while being away from the crowds of San Marco. If you take the vaporetto get off at the Accademia stop, turn left towards the Peggy Guggenheim museum, cross the first canal and immediately turn right and you will see the hotel - just a few minutes walk from the Accademia Bridge. The vaporettos were on strike the morning we left and the helpful reception staff gave us walking directions to the train station - it was an easy 25 minute walk. The breakfast buffet was very good with plenty of choice and choice of hot beverage and a basket of fresh croissants and rolls provided to each table. All in all, a very good experience at the Hotel American. I would definitely return and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel American is a jewel”
Reviews.Author: CADottoressa
Reviews.Content: A delightful small hotel, beautifully furnished, in the perfect location around the corner from the Accademia Museum and across the Grand Canal from San Marco. It is clean with a friendly, helpful staff, and a fair breakfast. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and great views”
Reviews.Author: staceybass
Reviews.Content: Firstly the booking process was painless, speedy and professional. When we arrived the hotel from the outside looks lovely, very clean and in an excellent state of repair. The location is just beautiful and easy access to the Academia bridge, vapparetto and an excellent local bar. It is also close to a wonderful restaurant - La Piscina. The refurbished canal view room we had really lived up to expectations and impressed my boyfriend!! The staff were very friendly and helpful and always available when we needed them. All in all a great hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: Jayjay5555
Reviews.Content: I took my partner for a very special birthday suprise to the Hotel American in Venice and we both loved every minute of it. The hotel is located in the arty district just off the Accademia vaporetti stop and is situated on a small canal which leads directly onto the Grand Canal. Its quiet enough for a peaceful, relaxing stay, yet within easy walking distance of some of Venice's major sights. The hotel is clean and nicely presented, the staff were pleasant and polite and our room, a deluxe double with canal view was worth every penny. The bathroom was small but perfectly adequate for a two night stay. There is no lift, but a porter will carry you luggage to the room. The breakfast is continental style and just right, all together we enjoyed our stay here very much and would not hesitate in recommending this hotel and its fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Sager
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with another couple stayed at the Hotel Dinesen in Venice for 4 nights in early November. Our room was clean with glass doors opening onto a small balcony overlooking the canal with a clean, modern bathroom. We had excellent complete breakfast every morning including hard boiled eggs, cereal, breads, cheese, meat, and juices. Individual hot drinks of choice delivered to our table by servers. Internet service is free and available in the lobby from 6 am until midnight. We were there during primary elections so use of the computer was essential for us blue staters! The canal was quiet overnight. Deliveries and action started up about 7 to 8 am. We loved watching all to the comings and goings, and were not disturbed by noise. I definitely would stay there again. Venice is a lovely, romantic city explored completely on foot or by boat.

Reviews.Title: “excellent situation”
Reviews.Author: sheona
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned fron a trip to Italy, and the Hotel American was the best accomodation we stayed in. Its location on a quiet canal close to the Accademia Bridge and vaporetta stop was perfect for sightseeing and there were pleasant cafes and restaurants close by. Our room was large enough though not huge, and had lovely views from the balcony. It was recently decorated in silk wall hangings and drapes, which would have been OTT anywhere else but in Venice, had all the facilities you would expect, including a modern bathroom, and was spotlessly clean. Reception staff were very helpful and our bags were carried to our room, which was handy as there is no lift and we were 'over the bridge' in the ajoining building. Breakfast was plentiful - delicious coffee and a large buffet including meats, cheeses and extremely delicious pastries. We hope to return to Venice again as there is too much to see in a short visit and we will certainly stay in the hotel Dinesen.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: f_braun
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a lovely location and very helpfull staff. Our rooms facing the little canal in front of the Hotel was very charming with a typical venetian decor. The staff was very helpfull with good restaurant suggests. The room was clean and big enough, with modern bath. Very usefull the free internet point in the lobby and also the free internet connection hi-speed in the room. The Hotel arranged also a free tour in a glass factory....... Hope to come back in this lovely city and wondefull hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheVirginian
Reviews.Content: Liked the other reviewers, I really liked the Hotel American, mostly due to the charming location across the Accademia Bridge from the main Venetian island. Since I don't care for crowds, I wouldn't want to stay near San Marco square or in the Rialto areas, which were filled with tourists, even in November. I stayed in the single room (304) at the top of the hotel. Initially, it was so small that I felt like I was on a cruise ship, but really it met all my needs. The only issue I had was the lack of screens on the tiny window. I had to keep the window open since it was quite warm in the room (heat probably rising from the rest of the floors), but got 2 mosquito bites (in November!). The room did have its own air conditioner, but I didn't try that. They do have a PC with free internet in the lobby and a very good breakfast in the morning. Though I had requested a non-smoking room, there was an ashtray in the room, but the floor had a non-smoking sign and it didn't smell of smoke at all. The hotel is a just a few minutes walk to the Peggy Guggenheim modern art museum and the Accademia museum, but the area seemed to be mostly residential. There are several restaurants nearby. It is easy to get to from the airport taking the waterbus (12 euros) to the Zatterre stop, going right, then taking a left at the first canal. Hotel staff were all helpful. I'd definitely recommend this hotel if you cherish quiet and a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect: we wouldn't want to stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Retired_from_Kent
Reviews.Content: â€œJust perfect: we would not wish to stay anywhere else.â€� I cannot recommend it highly enough. It deserves a Gold Award. All the staff were excellent, very professional and gave very helpful personal service that made you feel special. The rooms were finished to a high standard and cleanliness was exemplary. The family run hotel has a quiet canal side location a short walk from the major attractions. â€œWe had a better nightâ€™s sleep than at home!â€� Breakfast kept us going until the afternoon. Getting there from Marco Polo Airport (VCE) was very easy. An express coach goes every 20 minutes (3 euros) to Piazzale Roma. From there travel by the Vaporetto 1 or 82 along the Grand Canal to Accademia (5 euros). Each stop is clearly marked on the piers. From the Accademia pier follow signs to Peggy Guggenheim collection. After you cross the first canal bridge you will see the hotel on the canal side on your right.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: grae13
Reviews.Content: we were in Venice for 3 nights, (4 of us) we were staying at a hotel that a friend had recomended us and was close to St Marks. But we were walking around the art galleries when we found this beautiful hotel. It was cheaper than the one near st marks and much more luxurious. Almost all the time the people staying here are tourists.... German, French, American, Australian etc... The room was up one level and crossed over to the other buildings. The bathroom was brilliant and had all the perfect needs. I found the location better than the first one. All the first one had was 5 minutes walk to St Marks. But I found this location just as good. A great cafe and warf to sit at. Close to all the good art galleries, And also has great food for breakfast. (simple but nice) I recomend you stay here on your trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little gem”
Reviews.Author: dps57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights - a surprise trip for my husband's birthday. Great little hotel - I booked it on the strength of TripAdvisor feedback, and wasn't disappointed. Good location on a side canal, and all the sights are within easy walking distance. Friendly, helpful staff and they very kindly left a bottle of chilled champagne in our bedroom. Continental breakfast was excellent - particularly the Italian pastries. If you take advantage of the water taxi service from the Airport to the hotel's own docking bay, ensure you have clear instructions regarding collection. Di and Pete, Lincoln

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: pendulum
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five days at this wonderful hotel in mid October. The location on a quiet canal, just steps away from the Academy and the Guggenheim museum, and easy walking to virtually everything we wanted to see and do, could not have been better. We had a beautifully furnished balcony "room with a view". Every accommodation had been considered for our comfort. A perfect breakfast was served each morning in a splendid and intimate dining room that encouraged conversation among the guests. The hotel staff was courteous, always helpfull and extremely knowlegable. In short, it was complete, not a detail forgotten or left to chance. We could not have stayed at a better hotel. Sandy Henderson & Arthur Weinberg.

Reviews.Title: “Well located with pleasant service”
Reviews.Author: Nick99
Reviews.Content: We found this a pleasant hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. The room was pretty small - typical of Venice - but acceptable and the bathroom was very good. The location is excellent, on a quiet canal in Dorsoduro, so away from the crowds of the Rialto and San Marco - but only 5 minutes' walk from the Accademia with the water bus stop and the excellent pizzeria on the Grand Canal. There's a reasonable breakfast with very pleasant service and a free internet connection in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “What a great little place”
Reviews.Author: TravelToLife
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, on our first trip to Europe, were not sure what to expect, however our stay in Venice was wonderful. We spent three nights here and found the service to be great and the accommodations to be more than adequate. We had a small room with a nice, recently remodeled bath which overlooked the side of the hotel toward other apartments. The breakfast of pastries, cereal, fruit and yogurt along with meat and cheese was more than enough to get the day started. And I wish I could duplicate the caffe latte here at home (I miss it). The hotel is in a quiet area but close to the the sights, about a 10 minute walk to St Marks. There is a wonderful place for dinner right next to the hotel where we had a candle light dinner alongside the canal. Overall, this three star hotel in Venice beat our four star hotel in Florence hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Loved th Hotel American”
Reviews.Author: Traveler699
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice mid-priced hotel on a quiet canal in the Dursoduro section of Venice near the Accademia Bridge. The staff was helpful and curteous. The hotel itself was clean and well maintained. There are no elevators, but we only had to walk up one flight of stairs and the hotel staff took care of our bags. Our room did not have much of a view, but we didn't care. The free breakfast buffet was good and filling. This is a good location to explore Venice. It is only a 5 minute walk to the Accademia Bridge and you can get to St. Mark's in 15 minutes, or take a Vaparetto. You can sometimes find a gondola on the canal in front of the hotel, or at the Accademia Bridge. A good time to get one is in the morning when they're not so busy. You'll need to bargain to get a good rate. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a Wonderful View”
Reviews.Author: TravelinSlow
Reviews.Content: For our first visit to Venice, my wife initially picked the hotel American-Dinesen almost randomly from the web. Our plans were getting close to the trip date and she wanted to be sure we had a room before committing a LOT of frequent-flyer miles to get there. We then researched many other hotels in Venice, and decided that we actively wanted to stay at the American-Dinesen (despite the name, which these days is unfortunate, I'm afraid. We hear it will be shortened to its original Hotel Dinesen soon.) The staff were exceptionally helpful. We had to call (speaking no Italian) about some details, and then exchanged e-mails related to the fact that we shipped luggage â€“ this was immediately after the first no-gel-no-liquid thing, and we werenâ€™t sure what we could get with us on the airlines. In all these dealings, the concierge, named Marco, was wonderful, welcoming and informative. Even the night clerk, who claimed his English wasnâ€™t very good, helped us out at one point on the phone. When we arrived, the staff lived up to what weâ€™d experienced long-distance. They helped us locate the Venice Architect Bienniale offices and get opening hours that werenâ€™t published anywhere, got us tickets to what was probably the best classical music concert Iâ€™ve ever been to (without charging us a commission), and referred us to a couple excellent restaurants. The location, in Dorsoduro, was easy to get to and thus encouraged us to venture afar â€“ but was far enough from the center to avoid the throngs. For Venice, the prices were reasonable. The room that we got had a real view of a real (that is, work-a-day) canal, with a balcony big enough for two of us, barely, to stand and watch the traffic. besides being very beautiful, the canal provided a big part of our enjoyment because we got to see the amazing array of activities that Venice carries out by boat. Boats specializing in delivering one very specific thing â€“ furniture, beer, vegetables, the mail, as well as construction materials and garbage collection went by, as did several gondolas (but not the traffic-jam of them around San Marco) and a racing boat with six standing oarsmen. it was noisy early in the morning, but nothing unusual if youâ€™ve lived in any big city. The last night, there was a miscommunication â€“weâ€™d stated our last day to stay, but in Europe, itâ€™s standard to specify the day of departure. So we were one night short, and the hotel was heavily booked. Marco managed to find a cancellation. The room was much smaller and less romantic, with a view of an ordinary side garden. But we didnâ€™t have to uproot ourselves and re-orient for the last night there. Had we stayed only in the smaller room, our week would have been less perfect â€“ but we spent so much time walking and boating around that it would have been alright. (By the way â€“ the Venice Card is good for peace of mind about transportation, but youâ€™ll never break even on it just for vaporettos. If you plan to hustle to a long list of museums, it is unquestionably a great deal.) One reason we picked the hotel was that there were so many positive comments on TripAdvisor and so few negative ones. The only negatives we saw were about the breakfast, and we disagree. The breakfast was generous, with very good coffee (and refills), fresh croissants and other breads, cereal, juice, yogurt, eggs, and salami or ham. It was the same every day, yes. But for those who canâ€™t manage on a pastry and a cappuccino, Italian style, it was an important advantage to staying here. Breakfast in a street cafÃ© is always an option once you get oriented. All in all, the Hotel American-Dinesen was a highlight of our trip, and contributed to finding other highlights.

Reviews.Title: “great way to end our trip in Italy”
Reviews.Author: itslaurie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel American for three nights at the end of our honeymoon trip to Italy. We found the staff to be pleasant and accommodating and our was really cute! The location was perfect - really close the Accademia stop. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kglavin
Reviews.Content: My husband, brother and I stayed at this delightful hotel the second week of Sept. I had looked at every hotel in Venice on every web site available because I had read such horror stories of hotel rooms in Venice regarding size and expense. I actually had three different hotels booked until my brother decided to join us at the last minute and this was the only one that could find him a room. The location is very easy to get to, the room while not a canal room as requested, was nice size and had a great bathroom. Beware that there is no elevator, not unusual in Venice, but still requires some hauling of heavy bags. The clerk did help us carry some to the room. The staff was very nice, especially during the day shift. Breakfast very good, if uninspired, but why load up at breakfast when there is so much great food the rest of the day. Having the internet was great, especially for checking arrangements for the rest of our trip. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: thanx4help
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this pleasant small hotel. Our room was on the small side, but very clean and comfortable, with a nice view of a canal. The location was perfect, not far from all of the tourist sights but out of the madness of St. Mark's Square and just across the Accademia Bridge, very convenient to everything we wanted to do. Desk staff was very helpful and pleasant. Just a couple of problems we had: the cleaning staff always left the door to the balcony open for fresh air, so we had some mosquitoes at night. And on our last night there was no air conditioning, so our only choice was to open doors and windows and let in even more mosquitoes. When we asked about the air conditioning we were informed that in October they switch the system from air to heat (we didn't know this and had inadvertantly been heating our room for several hours). Other than that, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Observe Local Venetian Living”
Reviews.Author: TomPop
Reviews.Content: The Hotel American allows a unique opportunity to observe the daily fabric of local life in Venice. Our room was on the third floor overlooking the canal. It was a pleasure to observe the Venetians go about their daily tasks in their unique environment that consist of canals and alleys. This is a quiet hotel centrally located near everything but off the beaten track. One might call it a boutique hotel. Major attractions are within a short ride by Vaporetto. Other attractions are within walking distance. The hotel staff is very helpfully and the property is well maintained.
