Our room was better than adequate and comparable to the Hotel Capo dâ€™Africa where we stayed in Rome. A restaurant by the name of Antica Locanda was recommended by a gentleman at the front desk. Donâ€™t eat here! The food is mediocre and the service was rushed. A few suggestions for the hotel are: install full shower stalls since it was impossible to keep the water in the tub; wash the bedspread which had a musty smell; and, stock extra pillows for two pillow sleepers. Otherwise, we had a wonderful time and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Anne-France
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hotel American in Venice and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. The location close to the Accademia is ideal: quiet, charming, and still at easy walking distance of all main attractions. Being a bit further away from Piazza San Marco also meant that we found lovely restaurants that were a bit less touristy than those in the busiest areas. Our bedroom was tastefully decorated in the Venetian style, without overdoing it as it is too often the case in Venice. The hotel must have been refurbished quite recently, as everything was in good working order and looked fresh and well maintained. The bathroom, in particular, was modern and spotless, and it had a window, which is a rare feature in a hotel bathroom. Staff were all perfectly friendly and helpful, and we did not feel anonymous like in bigger chain hotels. Without being as copious as in 4 or 5 star hotels, breakfast was very good, served in a pleasant room. The coffee was excellent, and only bread rolls could have tasted a bit better! Hotels in Venice are very expensive and in such a touristy city, we feared to find poor value for money, but we were completely happy with our choice, and we can only recommend the Hotel American.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel American - a lovely little gem!”
Reviews.Author: LancasterTraveler
Reviews.Content: Oct. 2006 My wife and I and 2 friends stayed 3 nights in the Hotel American and loved it! This beautiful, small hotel is on a small canal in the residential neighborhood of Dorsudoro near the Guggenheim museum but withing walking distance of the Rialto bridge and even St. Marks square. The neighborhood is quiet and void of the hordes of tourists and noise prevalent in the busier parts of Venice. Several fine neighborhood restaurants are just steps away as is the Academia bridge and a 2 vaporetto stops. The Hotel American staff is excellent and friendly. The breakfast room is pleasant and the food is fresh and tasty. I would highly recommend this boutique Hotel to anyone who wants quality and convenience but not the buzz and bustle of more crowded areas. When we return to Venice we will definitely stay at the Hotel American again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel American Dinesen - 2nd visit!”
Reviews.Author: dfsannapolis
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two weeks in Italy which included three days in Venice. We arrived the morning of the Historical Regatta holiday (September 3rd). Venice was PACKED - there were actually "people jams"! We happily returned to The Hotel American Dinesen, where we had stayed in May 2003. We prefer the Dorsoduro section of Venice just south of the Accademia Bridge. Dorsoduro has plenty to offer - shopping, galleries and restaurants, but still allows a reprieve from the intesity of the area around St. Mark's, which is a nice 15 minute walk away. The Hotel American Dinesan offers all ameities, and the staff is very professional and responsive. This small hotel is located on a picturesque canal, and we highly recommend a canal view room. On this trip, we had three balconies, and took every opportunity to stand and relax and enjoy the views. The early morning brings boats with pick ups and dceliveries that support the infrastructure of Venice. It adds to the experience, and provides a glimopse into how Venice works. Overall, we recommend the Hotel American Dinesan, and would gladly return again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel excellent location”
Reviews.Author: nextime
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, big suite, excellent decor, friendly checkin with Marco! Free internet access in the lobby. Plentiful breakfasts. Within walking distance to San Marco Square and Rialto Bridge. Good shopping nearby. Loved everything about the hotel, would definately come back!

Reviews.Title: “Just passing through”
Reviews.Author: sueandjohn01
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on way back to UK from camping holiday. Very pleasant Team, room very nice, lovely location on quiet canal. Will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Hotel American”
Reviews.Author: Nanook1
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful. Room was pleasant and well appointed. Location of the hotel is ideal. Breakfast was wonderful. Good value for the price. I appreciated their quick response to my email inquiries. Will certainly stay at this hotel again when visiting Venice. Bob Portland, Oregon

Reviews.Title: “Hotel American Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: kapsun
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Very friendly staff. Great location. We stayed in a large room with 2 kids, so got a suite with 2 rooms. Great accommodation. Only thing is that bathroom is a bit small. Would recommend this hotel to anyone & we would surely stay there next time when we are in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, good location, OK value-for-money”
Reviews.Author: bullshead
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to catching the Royal Clipper from San Basilio (the Maritime Terminal) nearby, which is what influenced our choice. Our first choice (La Calcina, which we visited; see brief review) was full and this is only round the corner from there. The A-D is located on a side canal which links the Giudecca Canal and the Grand Canal. Zattere (on the Giudeccca) is the nearest vaporetto stop, but Accademia (on the S side of the Grand) is also fairly convenient. Thus it is not far to start walking to the main sights of Venice and you are not paying a premium for San Marco. That said, Venice is not a cheap place to stay, and this hotel is not as cheap as some. It is very pleasant however and our room was perfectly fine, if a little compact. But so long as the weather is OK you're only going to sleep there anyway. Breakfast was fine. The hotel has no restaurant, which is not a problem for most people, given the wide choice of places to eat within easy walking distance. The staff were friendly and helpful (they looked after our cases until 4pm) and we were made to feel welcome (in direct contrast to snooty places like the Gritti Palace).

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Our Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: ejm3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in early Sept 06 and enjoyed it very much. The room was fairly small, which didn't really surprise me because most hotel rooms in Europe and especially Venice are that way. It wasn't cheap, but nothing in Venice is so I think I probably paid a fair rate relatively speaking. The staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms we clean and well maintained. The hotel was clearly recently renovated so the lobby and breakfast area are small but nice. Breakfast was simple but tasty and I really missed it when I moved to another hotel in a different city. I thought the location away from the hectic touristy areas was great. Its about a 20 minute walk (a really nice walk with lots to see and do anlong the way) to San Marco and a little more to the Rialto but the crowds in those areas are insane. It was in a quiet neighborhood but there were still plenty of stores and restaurants in the immidiate area. Overall I would definately recommend this hotel to others and I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: kalinak
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were warmly greeted and the clerk recommended a restaurant close by for a quick bite of lunch however the place he suggested was terrible horrible service and the food was the worst we ate the entire trip. I booked our room based on the many positive reviews on this site and I was very disappointed in the stay. Our room was small but ok and it two windows....one viewed directly into another room and the other to the canal. The problem was at night it was VERY noisy outside with people talking right below and in the morning you could hear everyone banging their suitcases down the stairs which was directly outside our door. Secondly, the mosquitos were TERRIBLE....they were everywhere in our room and both my husband and I were covered in bites...in fact one morning i woke up with a eye swollen shut from being bit in the eyelid!!!! The topper was when we came back to our room after lunch and there was a water leak in the ceiling from the air conditioner and it soaked the flooring and my suitcase. They fixed it right away but left the ceiling open and our room smelled horrible like musty moldy smell. When I called they quickly closed it back up and apologized for forgetting to fix it. The television never worked which was disappointing at night when lying in bed....it was locked on one channel and they were unable to fix it. The staff were very nice however I expected to receive either an offer to move to a different room or AT A MINIMUM a discount off our stay for the problems with our room. I would NOT recommend this hotel nor stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rather expensive”
Reviews.Author: Hilamo
Reviews.Content: My partner and me stayed in the AmericanpDinesen for 3 nights last week and I must say we enjoyed our stay however 320 euros for the room we stayed in was too much. Location is great, staff was friendly, especially the lady serving breakfast was great! A big bonus was the free ride by watertaxi to Murano to visit one of the glassfactories.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RutlandMarket
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent two nights at the American Hotel. It is very well situated for easy walking to all main attractions. The room was clean and very nicely decorated.The en-suite was alittle cramp but adequate. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and most spoke excellent english. We would definitely use this hotel on future visits to Venice

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: florians
Reviews.Content: We could not have chosen better - the Hotel American is fantastic in every way. The staff are all helpful and very kind, the location is perfect. We did not have a canal room, but to be honest it really didn't matter, as we were not in the room long enough to worry about it. After having a full day out and about it was a lovely sanctuary to return to, very quiet with good air-conditiong, clean and comfortable. We enjoyed our breakfast each morning. If we are lucky enough to return to Venice we would not stay anywhere else. We have already recommended this hotel to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “American Dinesen is Perfecto !!”
Reviews.Author: Penaw
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a fantastic holiday in Venice . Enjoyed every minute of our 4 nights. The Hotel American is marvelous - rooms comfortable, clean and with all the necessary facilities. We have stayed in 5 star Hotels other European destinations and this Hotel is well amongst top of list in this respect although only 3 star category. We were hesitant to book a 3 star hotel but after reading write ups on Trip Advisor we took the chance. Glad we did.Definitely the place to stay in Venice. All staff were very efficient and extremely helpful. Hotel is in perfect area to get everywhere. The Hotel is decorated with taste and colour. With painting adding to the warm feeling of the Hotel. I did read only one negative report on trip advisor prior to booking and that relating to "rude" night reception clerk. I am sure that the problem was with the guest. We found the night reception clerk (Luciano) - I hope that is correct spelling of his name, to be most courteous pleasant and informative. I am attaching a photo of the Reception area facing the room with computer for free Internet available to guests and you can see on the right in the decorative wall mirror a reflection of Luciano at work behind reception desk. If you choose this hotel you will not regret it !! - and nobody paid me to say that --- its great !!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: travelinggypsy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, wonderful service. We stayed there for our 2nd wedding anniversary and they made arrangements for a gondola ride and a wonderful dinner nearby. The free water taxi and tour of Murano was great. They also provided a delicious continental breakfast, spoke English very well, and the rooms were very clean. We had a canal view room with a small balcony, which was a steal for the price. We highly recommend this hotel. (Only one word of advice, bring a hairdryer with an adapter if you need one).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel American - loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: europe06
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at the Hotel American on Aug. 2-4, 2006 and had a lovely time. We booked a quad suite for 200 euros a night. The room had two small balconies that gave us a great view of the canal - what a treat this was. The air conditioning worked great - the best of the three places we stayed at in Italy. The room was very comfortable and very clean. The breakfasts were standard but good - warm croissants and rolls and fresh fruit. They also had great capuccinos and cioccolatos (they gave you plenty). Although there was no lift, we did not have to worry about carrying our luggage up or down - they did it for us. They also held our luggage after checkout while we explored the city some more before our train left. The only minor downside was we couldn't keep the water in the tub - we didn't have a shower curtain - just one of those small side enclosures that covered about 1/3 of the tub. But if that is the worst I encounter in any hotel, I'm good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: luisajoe
Reviews.Content: We were there Aug 2- 4. My experience was great. The staff was always pleasant and helpful. The first day we arrive my reservation for some reason did not show up on their records, however without a hitch we were accomodated and also upgraded to a canal view for the first night at no extra cost. The hotel is recently renovated and rooms were beautiful. The hotel is located away from the crazy overcrowed areas of Venice. The only problem I incurred was that there is no elevator and our room was in the connecting building two flights up. It was a little rough but worth the walk. Even if you asked for the first floor you need to walk up a flight of stairs. They do have a service elevator but not for guests. This is the only drawback. Internet access was great and breakfast was adaquate. I would return if they make it handicap accessible and get an elevator for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay from beginning to end”
Reviews.Author: TripperLondon
Reviews.Content: This is how a hotel should be, great location, polite staff willing to help with all queries and make suggestions of places to visit, helpful informative porter, large, clean comfortable room and tasty breakfast! I was surprised on arrival that this was only a 3 star hotel, it's very well maintained in a classical style with convenient free internet access and air conditioning in the rooms. We loved the American and are planning on recommending it to everyone, from younger friends to parents as it's an ideal base for a short or long visit to Venice. It's a 5 minute walk from the Accademia vaporetta stop (very handy!) and the same to the bridge with a 15 minute walk in total to St Marks Square. Dorsoduro is a great area to stay in, away from the general hubbub of the touristy areas but so close with lots of restaurants conveniently tucked away in the streets off the Grand Canal. Venice was a superb place to visit and I am trying to plan when to go again, and the American will be top of the list of places to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel American, a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: st-hookem
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel American and had a wonderful experience. Our family of four had a "quad" room overlooking the canal. There was a very comfortable king bed, plus a queen-sized sofa bed that was big enough for my 21-year-old daughter and 17-year-old son to sleep in. The room was beautifully decorated, and had a balcony to step out on to enjoy the view. The bathroom was fantastic--a bathtub, shower, hairdryer, houseshoes and lots of toiletries. The breakfast was delicious, and quite plentiful. The first morning, we slept a bit late and my husband went down to get coffee. They gave him a tray with not just coffee, but tea, rolls, cheese, and meats as well. What exceptional service! This is truly a "five-star" hotel in terms of the service, and the lovely quiet room with the outstanding view. Staying in the Dorsoduro area got us away from the crowds and noise to a more peaceful location. We will definitely stay at the Hotel American if we make it back to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: scphel
Reviews.Content: The American-Dinesen is a wonderful place to stay in Venice. The location is superb: between the Academia and Gugenheim museums and near the vaparetto stop. We had a great triple overlooking the canal from our balcony, with very comfortable beds and a full bath (with a tub!). The breakfast was very good but not as varied as some of the other hotels we stayed in Italy. Overall, we thought the American was a fantastic place to stay and would again gladly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Venezia”
Reviews.Author: njitalian76
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is the best in venice.....I'm a frequent traveler to venice and I would never stay anywhere else. The service hear is all class , the employees are wonderful and friendly people. The location of this hotel is perfect!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: JWS77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this for 2 nights in August. Before we got there, I was a little afraid of expecting too much after reading so many good reviews about the hotel. We werenâ€™t disappointed. Rooms are clean and spacious. The hotel is also very quiet, which is really the most important thing to me when it comes to choosing a hotel. Breakfast was good and healthy. You need to leave the keys with the front desk when you leave the hotel during the day, but then this practice seems to be very common in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall Place”
Reviews.Author: patty17
Reviews.Content: This is a cute little hotel located in a great area of Venice. Personally I didn't think it was an amazing place, but it was very average. We did not have a canal view room so maybe that is why. However I saw a canal view room and did not find it worth paying the extra $60euro a night the hotel was asking. Other than that the service was good and the free internet helped.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: HudZo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very charming with its own personality. The staff was very friendly and helpful and everyone we interacted with spoke impeccable English. The room was tidy and clean and the bathroom was recently remodeled. Bonus: free internet in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Area”
Reviews.Author: RLZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charming, clean, well run and a bargain in an otherwise very expensive city. (And free internet access is a nice little bonus.) The location, although close to museums, is on the "other" side of the Grand Canal and may not be for everyone. We loved it. Much of Venice, especally between the Rialto and the Piazza San Marcos, seemed to me like Disneyworld--a place that existed for no purpose other than as a tourist attraction. Being able to cross the brige to a very pretty and much quiter area of town, although still within easy walking distance of major sights, was a pleasure. Every place in Venice is touristy but at least the area around the Hotel American was free of massive crowds. The breakfast was only so-so, but this is a very minor resevation in what was otherwise a terrific experience.

Reviews.Title: “Quite location, excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: LomasdeLaDehesa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in early July 2006 following the comments we saw in Trip Advisor (which we find the most useful source of reviews around). We found the hotel excellent value for money for what it is a very expensive city. The room, bathroom and the common areas are of a high standard. It is well located close to the Accademia, but about 20min walk from St. Marco, which I think it is a good thing as it gives you a respite from the noise and the crowds. Breakfast was simple, but quite good and well appointed. We stayed with a family of 5 (two adults, 2 children and a baby) and the double sized room was well layed out and spacious. Did not have a view, but that is of lesser importance when you are travelling with kids. Overall - Highly recommended. We have travelled around quite a lot and currently live in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, professionally managed”
Reviews.Author: bc399
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, professionally managed, tastefully decorated with courteous staff. Just a two minute walk from the Accademia vaparetto stop, yet in a quite neighborhood. Reasonably priced for the standard of rooms and services provided. The air-conditioning was very nice in the sweltering summer heat! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: Me&Ha
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a terrific short stay of three nights at the Hotel American for our second visit to Venice. It was easy to walk to all central locations in Venice and close to the Gugenheim and Accademia and still only a short walk to St Marks Square or a short vaporetto trip, We stayed closer to St Marks before but found this very relaxed and the canal view room was a treat. The breakfast is simple but adequate and I highly recommend this hotel very clean well decorated and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Spot”
Reviews.Author: Get0utat0wn
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled to finally round a corner and see the view we'd saved on our computer. The hotel has a perfect location, you feel like you have your private canal and the locals in the neighborhood could not have been nicer. Only complaint was that our room, canal side, had a bright streetlight right outside it-bright in our room. I would go to the hotel again; we liked the breakfast and again, the location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: mcphail858
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a wonderful trip to Italy and the U.K. We were very glad we took the recommendations of tripadvisor and Rick Steeves in picking Hotel American for our stay in Venice. The entire staff was friendly and willing to answer any questions we had. I am rather surprise at a recent post regarding a rude employee during the evening shift. Even if he was as rude as described, the hotel as a whole is outstanding. Location- Couldn't be better! It is away from the ridiculous crowds at St. Marks square but only a 10-15 min walk or 1 vapparreto stop away. After spending several days in Rome and Florence, we were sick of crowds and were so happy to be a safe distance away. Staff- Everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful. They even arranged for a water taxi to pick us up at the hotel and take us to a glass factory on Murano island and back for free. Granted, the glass factory is the one who pays the water taxi fare but I would not have thought to get to Murano island this way had the hotel staff not recommended it. Even if you have no desire to buy glass, it is an excellent way to get a free water taxi ride through the back canals on your way yo Murano. You just have to look interested in glass for about 10 minutes while you are at the glass factory. Rooms- We were in room 201 which was the corner room on the second floor. It was small but very clean and has A/C. Room size was not an issue because we were never in the room except to sleep and change. It had three large windows with views of the canal the hotel is on, as well as the Grand Canal about 40 yards away. You can even walk out on the tiny balconies attached to each window and take in the atmosphere. Bathroom was small but very clean and appeared new. Breakfast- Outstanding for Italian standards. All cold items but this was typical for all hotels we stayed at in Italy. Be sure to get a cappaccino which is free and delicious. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Venice. For the price, it cannot be matched in Venice. If you pay in cash at checkout they will give you a 5% discount not to mention you won't have to pay the 3% that American Credit Card companies charge for the international transaction fee. Also, if you show up without a reservation, you can get a room cheaper but you run the risk of there being no rooms available. While I was using the free internet in the lobby I watched a customer walk in without a reservation and get a room for EUR 100 for the night but I it didn't have a canal view. If you come to Venice, stay at the Hotel American. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good 2nd visit”
Reviews.Author: 3happytravelers
Reviews.Content: We like the Hotel American for its generally friendly staff (one person not very firendly or helpful), great location, terrific rooms, especially the triples. Not all rooms have internet access, which I had been led to believe they did -- so if you need internet, ask for it ahead of time. This was our second visit. Air coniditioning worked very well in one room, not as well in the other. We were on 3rd floor which you can only do if you're in good physical shape since the satirs ar every steep and no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Baby friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BallFamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for three nights in July 2006 with my husband and 2 month old baby. Our canal side room was roomy by European standards and very clean. The room next to us was a housekeeper's closet so we wouldn't have to worry about the baby disturbing anyone. We rec'd very nice service from all of the staff and the area was quiet and nicely located. I will stay here again if I return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty evening staff!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was insulted and mocked by the hotel clerk after I mistakenly said the wrong ITALIAN word! The hotel clerk looked more German than Italian- BEWARE- he is rude, ignorant, and has no respect for customers. He was so condensing that this first Italian encounter completely dampened my husband familyâ€™s perception of â€œItalianâ€� people. We continued to refer to that first day, and compared every hotel with the poor service we received at the American Dinesen. Iâ€™m an avid reader of Trip Advisor, and chose hotels based on positive experiences. Upon arriving at the Hotel America I was welcomed by a pleasant, superb clerk (Roberto). My day went well, as I was able to practice a little Italian with the hotel staff, and street sellers while awaiting my husband and in-laws to join me later in the evening. (My parents are Sicilian immigrants, and Iâ€™m fairly verse in Italian/Sicilian). In the evening, my husband and in-laws arrived, and noted that their air conditioner was not working. To my surprise Robertoâ€™s shift had ended, and another clerk was at the front desk. I told him that our air conditioner was not working, however I mistakenly said the wrong Italian word. The hotel clerk (I believe "Lucky" was his name), continued to insult me, yell and say that I didnâ€™t know how to speak Italian (I was speaking an â€œancient languageâ€�??!!), and then he insulted my father in-law. Having good upbringing and being a New Yorker, Iâ€™ve learned to deal with ignorant, obnoxious people, thus instead of arguing back, I left the hotel feeling completely humiliated, angry, and wanting to change hotels. I travel often for business and for pleasure, but have NEVER met hotel staff like this! Lucky has no respect for customers. If it wasnâ€™t for the location and Roberto, a nice hotel clerk, Iâ€™m not sure how this hotel would stay in business. I would not recomment this hotel unless you're looking to be insulted!

Reviews.Title: “Dosoduro Star”
Reviews.Author: bevandavidrhys
Reviews.Content: This was a v enjoyable stay. Hotel is quiet,discrete comfortable and very well situated between the accademia and the zattere, giving a useful choice of vaparetto access. Our room was a front corner with three balconies so views of the s.vio canal grand canal and guideca. Room was excellent maid service good and v discrete. Aircon v effective. I love restaurant (and hence cooking smell) free hotels. The Dosoduro is a wonderfully civillised part of Venice. I will return here.

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem”
Reviews.Author: LisaBSeattle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a short visit to Venice. While there we stayed at the Hotel American, based on great reviews written by other visitors. The hotel is situated on a quiet canal away from the throngs of tourists. It is immaculately clean. The small lobby and adjacent sitting room area are richly and comfortably decorated. Our room was on the 2nd floor. I don't believe the hotel has an elevator, but we used the stairs out of habit. A porter lugged our bags for us. We had requested a canalside room and were so pleasantly surprised at how beautiful it was! The walls were covered with pink-striped fabric. The bed was large and comfortable. The green and flowery painted furniture was charming. The overhead pink and white chandelier was crafted of shiny Venetian glass. The bathroom, while a bit small, had all of the amenities we could hope for including the ubiquitous bidet which generally held our used towels only. There was a heated towel rack, marble floors, plenty of toiletries, and all was spotlessly clean. Best of all, we had three tiny balconies all for ourselves, each one accessed by French doors, and with dark green wooden shutters attached to the outside window frames. All of the balcony railings were covered with windowboxes overflowing with purple petunias. We spent much of our in-room time on the balocnies while watching locals operating their boats through the canal, laughing at locals playing with their tiny dogs on the sidewalks, and generally just enjoying the beautiful scenery. Breakfast was included in the price of our room and included rolls, cheeses, meats, hard boiled eggs, cereals, yogurt, juices, coffee, etc. There was also a computer available off the lobby for free Internet usage. We were extremely pleased with our room, the hotel, and the staff. The location is excellent--just a short walk to the Accademia, a little farther for the other big sights of St. Mark's, the Doges Palace, etc. We would definitely stay at Hotel American again.

Reviews.Title: “Good situation, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, excellent situation ,the room was a little small. Staff very plesant.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel American Dinesen - PERFECT IN EVERY WAY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel American Dinesen was the perfect hotel to come into after a long 2 legged flight from the US. The water taxi pulls up 2 feet from the door and you are efficiently & warmly greeted. The rooms and the entire hotel is one of the cleanest - if not the cleanest - of any hotels that I have stayed in - and that includes the Four Seasons, Ritz, Hiltons & Hyatts. The hotel is a short walk to San Marco Square. We were SO GLAD we decided against a hotel located in the Square - which is noisy and very crowded - always. The Hotel American Dinesen is located in a quiet area close to "must see" museums - with a great restuarant right next door. Along with a great breakfast the hotel itself can provide coffee, tea, etc. during the day with charming service. We had a room with a balcony and canal view which also gave us a view into the everyday life in Venice - but never a problem with noise or crowds. Important for those that always need to be connected to the office - they provide internet service either in the rooms or through their computer in the lobby. I used both and they worked perfectly. We would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel to anyone visiting Venice - it was perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Hotel American”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 7 stayed at the American Hotel in the Accademia section of Venice in late June 2006. We found the staff to be quite helpful, both in recommending restaurants and in making sure our rooms were clean and in total working order. For example, one lightbulb and one channel ("Uno -- playing the World Cup matches) were out in one of our three rooms, and these were fixed immediately upon request. The free breakfast was good, and I particularly appreciated the second cappucino each morning. We loved the location -- close enough to St. Mark's square to get there in a 12 minute walk, yet far enough away to miss the throngs. Finally, the air conditioning worked perfectly, which was important as we were there in a heat wave with temps in the mid-to-upper 90s by day (35-36 C) and one night not falling below 80.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice of hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a great choice because of its location and size. The people were very, very nice and helpful, room(suite) was very clean and well fitted.....I would have liked to have had a view of the water but, frankly, I was not in the room long enough to worry about the view.... I would highly recommend this hotel as it certainly provides a great location slightly off the main, crowded areas....

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Comfort with a View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After visiting 4 previous hotels in Italy that were supposed to be top notch, my family and I were pleasantly shocked that the American Dinesen was so fantastic, eloquent, marbled cleanliness, nice bathrooms, and totally well rounded great place to stay. The staff was great also--luxury hotel with a family feel of comfort.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: nswerdl
Reviews.Content: I loved it when I came in! Free internet rocks and the place is pretty. The breakfast times are a nice range as well. Great location to the great Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were given what must be the best room, (number 212 I think!), with a view up and down one of the small canals. Very quiet away from the tourist turmoil but easy access to just about everywhere. Very friendly, traditional, with a big bathroom and a really nice bedroom. The padded fabric walls are very Venice. Good cafes nearby and a good restaurant next door. We first saw the Hotel American on a previous visit and it lived up to our hopes and expectations. We will stay there again and recommend it unhesitatingly.

Reviews.Title: “Continues to be a great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert-J
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the last week in May at the American-Dinesen as has been our habit for several years. It continues to be a comfortable hotel in a good canal-side location with a friendly and helpful staff. Marco, Elisabetta, Beppi et al go out of their way to be charming and alway ready to answer your questions. Halfway between the Accademia and the Peggy Guggenheim Museum of Modern Art, on Dorsoduro, it is well located and convenient for both the Accademia and Zattere vaporetto landing stages. The computer and internet facilities available free of charge in the residents sitting room is a welcome feature. The breakfast is a simple but adequate buffet breakfast with a range of fruit juices, cereals, fruit, ham, sliced sausage and hard boiled eggs. I particularly like their caraway bread. Next door the Cantinone Storico provides excellent meals every day except Sunday with a menu including both sea food and meat dishes. If I have any complaints at all it is that the bath is not very big and my bulk feels cramped when trying to sit in it. However the shower is fine and plenty of space to stand in the bath.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel American is the best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located close to the Accademia and good restaurants, but in a quiet, higher-end primarily residential area. Our room was beautifully furnished, well-appointed, and had a canal view and a small terrace. Included breakfasts were the best we've had anywhere in Europe. What really makes the Hotel American stand out, however, is the consistently high level of service, always charmingly offered. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL - GREAT LOCATION - EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The perfect honeymoon hotel. We got a fantastic room with a canal view which is to recommended. The staff were very friendly particularly the night manager (alas, I cant remeber his name) who got us info on connectiong trains \ hotels \ Venice - and MARCO the day manager was also a great help. The room was extremely clean, bright and airy. The bathroom was exceptionally large and well appointed. Breakfast was fine, and room service was very good. The location has to be one of the best in Venice - beside a water bus staion - lots of great restaurants, cafes, museums nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, beautiful room, close to some great restaurants. In a great part of town, yet quiet area and off the heavy traffic walkways. Canal view room was delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel, very charming. The staff is very friendly and very kind, the location was great, a 15 min. walk from San Marco square and Rialto bridge. Also very good the suggest about the restaurant Taverna San Trovaso, 5 min. walk from the Hotel, in the Dorsoduro area. the room was lovely decorated in venetian style. Very nice Hotel, to suggest!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: enjoyinglife53
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently in a triple room in the Hotel American. Great location and easy to get to with a lot of luggage! We had a canal view (paid extra for this) and the room was adequate. The adjoining building was undergoing some construction so we had some noise early in the morning but otherwise, it would have been a quiet location. I thought the room was overpriced compared to other places we stayed in Italy but maybe that is Venice for you. Overall, if I returned to Venice (as I hope we will), I would consider other places but would not hesitate to stay at Hotel American again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the BEST !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dear All, we have been (me, my wife and our daughter) at the Hotel American Dinesen in May. Our stay has been wonderfull, starting for the staff, very helpfull, also the location was perfect, in the Dorsoduro Area, 10 min.walk from s.mark square and the Rialto bridge. Also our Superior room with the Canal view and the balcony was great!!! we could see from our balcony the venetians making their business with the boat or by walk. At the end we highly recommend this fantastic Hotel !!! We will never forget our stay at the HOTEL AMERICAN DINESEN !!!! THANKS AMERICAN

Reviews.Title: “would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: la2londonLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a quad room with our two young children and found the hotel to be ideal. The room was large and clean with a modern bathroom. Marco and the staff are friendly and extremely accommodating. The hotel is in the perfect location for walking to all of the major sights just over the accademia bridge (which is also a vaporetto stop) so it makes getting wherever you want to go very easy! we took advantage of the free water taxi to the island of murano which was fantastic. we found better deals on the items we wanted to purchase outside of the factory but it was fun to see the men at work, creating their famous pieces. I would definitely recommend getting a canal side room if you can as the hotel is on a side canal and noise is not a problem. if the weather is right, take the vaporetto to the lido beach for some fun in the sun. i also think the elevator up the campanile tower is worth the price for the views. we did a gondola ride (i recommend picking one out near rialto bridge for better prices), it is well worth the price in my opinion. one more thing, we took a water taxi from the airport to the hotel which i believe is worth the 100 euros. it is a fantastic way to arrive but to save money, i'd take the vaporetto back to the airport. just a tip! enjoy your trip and the hotel american, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Benessimo. I would stay here again. A nicely appointed hotel in a quiet location on a canal about three blocks from the Accademia bridge and vaporetto stop, with a beautiful gardened apartment across the canal (you're not looking at a wall). The staff was GREAT...helpful with all our needs. The breakfast buffet (European style) was very good. An excellent restaurant is two doors down, or walk a long block in the other direction if you want to dine overlooking the water. Also, you pass a good pizza bar on the way to the Accademia bridge. I am an early riser and got to see all the morning activities on the canal and nearby streets... the deliveries being made by boat, the fish and produce vendors setting up their stalls around the block...a short walk over to the Giudecca canal to watch the morning sky...with none of the crowds you encounter at the sites during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katloveslife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in this small but beautiful hotel on a side canal near the Accademia Bridge/Stop in Venice. It is the perfect location if you want a quieter neighborhood, yet you can walk to San Marcos and other great sites in 10 minutes or less. This hotel is nicely decorated; we also stayed in the 2nd floor balcony room with windows on both sides and it is truly the best room. They were well informed and easy to communicate with. The breakfasts were delicious and fresh. We found the staff very helpful. Their restaurant recommendations were very good, and we also liked the restaurant next door. We would definitely return to the American Dinesen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, except for the unconfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I f only the beds and pillows were more confortable... But sleeping on an inclined bed really is not confortable. Staff friendly, breakfast excellent, small but nice and pretty new bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a quieter retreat in busy Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A lovely little hotels in a quieter part of Venice, but within 10 minutes walk from San Marco, close to the grand canal and boats from Zattere. Staff helpful for booking trips and opera. Rooms well decorated with lovely views of the canal (get 202 for the best view!). Reasonable breakfast. Strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel on a quiet canal”
Reviews.Author: cfsnow
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our recent stay at this hotel very much. The bathrooms were especially well appointed and modern. The location is very convenient and the staff was very helpful and professional. It also nice to have free internet access in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay at charming Hotel American........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: .......just returned from 2 days at your charming hotel.....would love to have stayed longer as we were extremely happy and comfortable in our room looking out on a side canal........ very well located......easy to reach from vaporetto stop.....the internet access was free (which made my granddaughter very happy).....the breakfast was lovely and more than adequate - with kind attention to the guests' needs.....the front desk personnel was very helpful and answered all our all queries.....I will definitely return on my next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the American”
Reviews.Author: MissEG
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel American for 2 nights in April. The hotel was wonderful, close enough to everything you'd want to see, but far enough away to sample some of the true Venice life. Walking to the square took about 10 minutes and the Accademia bridge couldn't have been in a more convenient place. The staff who spoke perfect English was very helpful. Definitely take advantage of the free water taxi ride to the Murano glass factory. Don't buy any glass in their showroom though, because as you walk out there are many more shops with more reasonable prices on the same items. We stayed in a corner balcony room on the 2nd floor. Though the room was a bit small, it was beautifully decorated and nice enough for the little time you should be spending in it-you are in Venice! Beware of the mosquitos that may fly in with the windows open, they like American blood! The breakfast was a great way to start the day and they were very attentive with getting you what you'd like. We would definitely stay in this hotel again and have already reccommended it to others. They even watched our luggage as we walked around a bit the day we checked out and had time to kill before heading to the airport. Finally, be sure to eat as much gelato as you can as it is a delicious treat!

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel Where Memories Are Made”
Reviews.Author: stidagu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights at the Hotel American in Venice and loved every moment. The location is perfect, on a nice quiet/romantic canal, near all the sites. The staff was great, friendly, and helpful. The hotel was beautiful, very clean, traditional Venician style that sets a very romantic mood. There was free internet access, and breakfast was also very good. Our room had canal views from three windows, all with small balconys. If we are ever able to make it back to Venice, this will be the only hotel I will book. Regards, a young married couple from Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Room 207”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a lovely stay. The hotel is in a very quiet but central location. Unfortunately, on our last day we moved rooms to one which was extremely hot, the only way to regulate the temperature was to open the window which in turn let in the mosquitos. The front desk, both night and morning, was less than interested in discussing the matter - it was one of the few times during our stay in Venice we experienced true Italian service !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. The hotel is very nicely decorated and is in a quiet location. Very comfortable bed. Very good breakfast. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from St. Mark's. We would definitely stay there again when we return to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The American Hotel for 4 nights from 1/4/06. My husband, myself and the 2 children shared a quadruple room. The room was very spacious and comfortable. We found the staff extremely helpful especially Marco and all were very friendly. The location of the hotel is excellent-in a very quiet area but within easy walking distance of St Mark's Square-about 15 minutes easy walking. There are 2 vaporetto stops very close-Academia and Zattere making it very easy to get anywhere in the city. Academia gallery is on the doorstep, also the Guggenheim gallery. There are many delightful restaurants nearby. We would certainly stay at the American Hotel again if we returned to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value Great location.”
Reviews.Author: oakridge_10
Reviews.Content: We just returned. This hotel couldn't be beat. We stayed 4 nights out of a total of 21 nights in Italy and it was the best hotel for the price. Breakfasts were very good, and the staff was very helpful and spoke perfect English. The room and public areas were spotless, the view from our balcony was entertaining. We overlooked a small canal (but we could see the grand canal). The facilities have all of the latest features including free internet service, and electric shutters. The furnature, decorations, chandeliers, plumbing, and maid service were first class. We walked everywhere from the hotel which is only a few blocks from the Accedemia bridge over the grand canal (one of only a few such bridges). I recommend it to anyone without a doubt. We stayed in a lot of 3 star hotels and this was the best. It would probably get a fourth star if it had a full restaurant, but there are plenty of good non tourist restaurants within a 5 minute walk. Savannah, Georgia

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: CtJean
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hotel American in Venice was wonderful. Friendly and helpful staff, wonderfully clean (breakfast room especially pristine), fabulous location on a quiet canal in easy walking distance to San Marco and many other important sites and also with immediate access to vaporetto stop (Academia)to take you anywhere. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing a good value for the money especially with the lower prices of off season. Room was small (bathroom large and lovely), but adequate for 2 persons.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel with terrific staff.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel has a gracious and accomodating staff and a convenient location in Dorsoduro. Although steps away from the Accademia and the Peggy Guggenheim, this is a wonderfully quiet location, especially at night. In the top floor room with the canal view, we never lost sight that we were in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: HMAAmersham_England
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel American in Venice on two occasions and found it to be an excellent choice. It is wonderfully located by a small canal in the Dorsoduro, just 2 minutes from the Accademia Gallery, vaporetto stop and bridge. However it is quiet, well-furnished and very clean. Breakfasts are served in a pleasant salon, and the staff are helpful and courteous. My only criticism is of a small room (number 106) that was given to us as a twin, which is not up to the standard of the rest of the hotel - but a switch was effected without hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Bueno Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights with my daughter and we both loved the hotel American. Lovely helpful staff, nice rooms and bathrooms, and nice breakfast which was served until half ten ( very civilised ).A nice touch was we were both given flowers on our last morning because it was ladies day in Italy. One last thing, I really recommend The restuarant Osteria Enoteca on Campo San Barnaba Venevia ( about 15mins walk ) reasonable prices great atmosphere, try the angus beef! closed tuesdays other wise we would have gone back!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this Hotel. The American Dinesen is Perfect”
Reviews.Author: rbi2000
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel in the perfect location. The staff was wonderful, especially Alberto who was there to welcome us.The food at the buffet in the morning was perfect and one could not ask for more of a three star hotel.I would stay here again in a heartbeat . Very quiet location as oposed to the hotels around St. Marks Square.Trust me, you will not be disapointed with this hotel for your stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Venice”
Reviews.Author: LucyMia
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice for Valentine's day and and were very pleasantly surpirsed at our hotel. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The fact that they spoke English was great. The room was clean and comfortable. They had excellent suggestions for dinner and tours. We would defnitley return.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time in Venice, hotel was superb, rooms great, staff very helpfull, location excellent, can't really say any more, will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: sempreingiro
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel American was just perfect. It is within walking distance of the Accademia, the Peggy Gugghenheim galleries, the zattere and many wonderful shops and restaurants. The rooms are beautifully decorated and very comfortable; the staff is attentive, the breakfast plentiful and the extras â€“ free internet service and boat transfers to Murano glass factories â€“ are a nice touch. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: love2travelKelly
Reviews.Content: Loved this section of Venice. Just out of the hustle and bustle of most crowded areas and major canals, yet so close to everything you want to see in Venice! Also, it was close to the water bus stop from the airport, quick walk to the water bus stop to the train station and just a quick walk over the Academia Bridge to the main tourist area, St. Mark's Sq. Our room, w/ french doors to a balcony, overlooked one of the side canals, and we saw "locals" headed to work every day via boat. Balcony flowers and birds are plentiful in the neighboring buildings that you view. Quiet area, yet felt safe walking around at night. Staff was very pleasant and helpful for restaurant suggestions, etc... Carrying luggage to the third floor was our only complaint! Rooms were clean and our family of four were able to sleep in the same room. Bathrooms were small, but modern and nice. We also enjoyed the hotel arranging for a private water taxi to Murano at no charge, except for driver tip. It was a real treat to watch the artisans blow glass and to tour one of the factories. We enjoyed our morning in Murano. We took the slow water bus back to Venice from Murano, enjoying the views along the way. The breakfast was simple, yet very nice. Can't wait to go back to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: campbell4608
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything about this hotel. Hotel has about 30 rooms and is very quaint. Located just a few minutes walk from the Accadamia Bridge so you don't have to walk far with your luggage - on a side canal, so our water taxi back to the airport (for a 6:30 am flight) pulled up right ot the door. Breakfast selection was good. This was our first trip to Europe however we met several guests that were well seasoned travelers and they all had good things to say about hotel. One couple who had been on Rick Steve's tours said, although the hotel was not in his book, it was listed on his map. We will definately stay there again as we hope to return to Venice soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids too!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel American over Christmas 2005 with our 2 children (aged 6 and 9) - fist visit to Venice for all except my wife, and we all loved it! Great location with easy access to water buses or just to walk around. The staff were very helpful, suggesting places and 'phoning up restaurants to find somewhere for us which was a great benefit on Christams Day. The staff were also very friendly with children and our kids had a great time, from the sweets to standing out on the balcony of our room and watching Venetian life go by -quite an eye opener for them. We do hope to return to Venice and will be looking at staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet romantic Hotel American-Dinesen”
Reviews.Author: PJAH42
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights here in this lovely hotel. From the warm welcome onwards, every single member of staff, bar none, were really friendly and could not do enough for you. Bedroom beautifully decorated, great bathroom and all spotlessly clean. Just 3 minutes walk from a Vaporetto stop, in a lovely little backwater away from the tourist crowds. Adequate breakfast served impeccably each morning, to set you up for the day's exploring. Will love to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel American”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days here and it truly felt like home. The staff was very helpful, the rooms clean and comfortable, and it was in close proximity to every venue we wished to see. We would come back in a moment. It was really a delight!

Reviews.Title: “Bellisimo...Italian Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am not sure I want to let anyone know how wonderful this hotel in Venice is! It is everything I expected from a hotel in Venice...Bellisimo. Lovely and elegant without being too expensive. Great location...near all the sights but quiet and quaint! Cannot wait to come back! Fantastico!

Reviews.Title: “I, my husband, and 21 students loved the Hotel American”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from Dec. 30 (05) to January 14 2006, so we really got to know the hotel and staff well. Our purpose for the stay was to hold a class for the University of Mississippi Study Abroad Program on writers and artists influenced by Venice. My husband and I arrived early and spent two days in a beautiful room overlooking the canal. It was wonderful. Then we were moved to another huge, amazing room (suite-sized)where we remained the rest of our stay. We then had 21 American college students arrive. We taught an English class there for two weeks. The staff was exceptionally understanding, never having had a group before. They graciously let us use the breakfast room in the afternoons for our classes (we toured the city, museaums, islands in the mornings). The breakfasts were wonderful and all of the staff members were curteous, friendly, and helpful. The rooms were clean, well furnished, and spacy for a small European hotel. We loved it, and intend to stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute find!”
Reviews.Author: gallafi
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I have written as I am normally far too lazy, however, the staff, the accomodation and the overall quality of the Hotel American inspired me! This hotel is incredibly good value having recently been renovated. From location, to great showers, to the management, this hotel is a gem. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Hotel American and very much enjoyed my stay. The hotel is charming and cozy and the staff was delightful. The hotel is a short walk away from St. Mark's Square and very near to vaporetto stop on the Grand Canal. I will surely visit Venice again and look forward to another pleasant stay at the Hotel American.

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL & DELIGHTFUL HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We LOVED the Hotel American-Dinesen, and RECOMMEND IT HIGHLY!!! My husband and I stayed there about ten days in December 2005. It was a charming, extremely pleasant, and quiet environment. The breakfasts were ample and excellent, the hotel staff were superior in every respect. The location is, as are all the hotel services, outstanding--very close to the Accademia, but off the beaten path. We couldn't have wished for more!, and will always return to the Hotel American! We came from Cambridge, Mass., in the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Terific Find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This last December (December, 2005) We had the opportunity to stay at the Hotel American in Venice. A terrific find. The hotel was everything we had hoped it would be and the staff was first rate. Located near the Accademia Bridge, we could could walk everywhere we needed to go. We would gladly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful American!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our friends recommended this hotel to me & to my wife and we have been totally satisfied of the services provided by the Hotel American Dinesen!!! The staff has been very very helpfull including suggests about restaurants/museums/shopping etc......The rooms have been renovated last year including the bathroom. We loved the cleanless of the Hotel and also the fantastic view of the Canal from our room. We appreciated also the free Internet Point in the lobby!!! The hotel is located in a wonderfull area, called Dorsoduro, very tipical and so relaxing...We arrived directly from the Airport to the private landing place in front of the Hotel, where an helpfull bellboy helped us with the luggages. So.......we will return to the Hotel American Dinesen and we recommend to do the same!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thank You American Dinesen!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all i want to thank all the Staff at the Hotel American for the wonderful stay!!I've been surprised because i found in the room the day of my birthday a bouquet of lovely flowers and a bottle of prosecco. It was so kind and generous to think of us in my birthday. I booked with my boyfriend through their website (which is very simple to do it) one Canal view room, lovely with a nice balcony facing the Canal!! Marco & Elisabetta helped us with Restaurants and cityvisits suggestions, couldn't be so kind & Helpfull. The Hotel is very charming and romantic. Absolutely we reccomend it and we will come back for sure!!!Thank you American.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Not a Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: germanfan
Reviews.Content: I am an avid reader of Trip Advisor and selected this hotel based on the reviews. I must honestly say that the hotel itself was acceptable, had a nice location and was quiet. The room size and quality was also acceptable. But I do not recommend this hotel. Unfortunately, we had a bad experience with the managment and would not stay there again. Due to a change in our cruise ship itinerary, we needed to change our room reservations from two nights to one night. We emailed the hotel 48 hours priorto check-in(from our cruise ship) as per their policy. They claimed that reservation change was not in time (citing that the 48 hours prior to the start of the day of check in, so we were 12 hours late). They then claimed there was a two day stay minimum, which was never stated in their policy or website. I felt they were arrogant and did not value me as a customer. Instead of arguing with their managment and ruining our day, I paid the bill and then received a refund from my credit card company (they agreed with our argument.) Sorry Hotel American..never again.

Reviews.Title: “in the heart of venice”
Reviews.Author: Iuvenalis
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights in the Hotel American and I can recommend it wholeheartedly: the room was nice and proper, the bathroom too, the staff very kind and helpfull... but the breakfast not as good as in 'German culture' hotels (as Italians are not Germans). Just a short warning: the hotel is slightly more expensive comparing with what you could have found (for the same quality) in - e.g. - Vienna or Berlin, but it is the price you are paying for staying in the heart of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel in Dosurdoro area of Venice Italy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Hotel American-Dinesen in the Dosorduro district in Venice. We had a 1st floor (really second floor) corner room facing the canal. It was a lovely room, decorated in the Venetion style and it was close to the Guggenheim and Accademia. The bathroom was marble and new. The Accademia bridge and water busses were close by so that we could take them from the airport and also to the train station. It was a 10 minute walk from San Marco and i liked the walk and scenery.. Not as touristy which we preferred, but a charming area to discover. I would definately recommend this hotel. The front desk helped us book our train fare over the internet, there is internet access and our breakfast room and breakfast selection was fine and was perfectly adequate. We found this hotel in Time-Out Venice and it was exactly as described.....Try to book room 101 for the views.

Reviews.Title: “What a charming hotel in a charming city!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The American Hotel is in a great location, easy to find and close to many attractions. The staff was very helpful with everything from restaurant recommendations to drawing us maps to lugging our bags up the stairs. One gentleman even walked us and our luggage to a taxi stop when the tide was too high for the taxi to meet us out front of the hotel. The rooms were small but decorated very nicely, the bathrooms are clean and modern. Our family will definitely stay here next time we are in Venice. This was our favorite hotel on our trip through Italy!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel American Dinesen
HotelInfo.Address: San Vio 628 Accademia | Dorsoduro District, 30123 Venice, Italy
